original: @95b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @95b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: aabhi dharma marma pra d'i pa n'a ma britti /
analyzed: aabhi dharma marma pra d'i pa n'a ma britti /
translated: Abhidharmako≈õabhƒÅ·π£ya-nƒÅma-v·πõtti

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: chos mngon pa'i 'grel pa gnad kyi sgron ma zhes bya ba /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i 'grel pa gnad kyi sgron ma zhes bya ba /
translated: The Commentary on the Abhidharmako≈õa called the Lamp of the Essential Points

original: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Buddha

original: gang zhig kun la mun pa gtan bcom zhing //
analyzed: gang zhig kun la mun pa gtan bcom zhing //
translated: Homage to him who has utterly destroyed the darkness in all ways,

original: 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs mdzad pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs mdzad pa //
translated: Who has rescued beings from the mire of cyclic existence,

original: don bzhin ston pa de la phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: don bzhin ston pa de la phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: Having paid homage to him, the teacher of truth,

original: chos mngon mdzod kyi bstan bcos rab bshad bya //
analyzed: chos mngon mdzod kyi bstan bcos rab bshad bya //
translated: I will explain the treatise on the Abhidharmako≈õa.

original: bstan bcos byed par 'dod pas rang gi ston pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan bcos byed par 'dod pas rang gi ston pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Desiring to compose a treatise, in order to understand the greatness of one's own teacher,

original: de la yon tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas phyag 'tshal ba rtsom ste /
analyzed: de la yon tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas phyag 'tshal ba rtsom ste /
translated: one begins the homage preceded by the expression of his qualities.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa'o //
translated: The phrase whoever is spoken from the perspective of the BhagavƒÅn Buddha.

original: 'di'i'am 'dis mun pa bcom pas mun pa bcom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i'am 'dis mun pa bcom pas mun pa bcom pa'o //
translated: He is the destroyer of darkness because he has destroyed or he destroys darkness.

original: thams cad la mun pa rnam pa thams cad du bcom pas kun la mun pa gtan bcom pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad la mun pa rnam pa thams cad du bcom pas kun la mun pa gtan bcom pa'o //
translated: He is the one who has utterly destroyed darkness everywhere, because he has destroyed darkness in every way.

original: mi shes pa ni yang dag pa'i don mthong ba la bgegs su gyur pa'i phyir mun pa ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa ni yang dag pa'i don mthong ba la bgegs su gyur pa'i phyir mun pa ste /
translated: Darkness is ignorance, because it is an obstruction to seeing the truth.

original: de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnyen po brnyes nas shes bya thams cad la phyis mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir gtan nas ye bcom pa ste /
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gnyen po brnyes nas shes bya thams cad la phyis mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa'i phyir gtan nas ye bcom pa ste /
translated: And that has been utterly destroyed by the Lord Buddha, because he has attained the antidote and all objects of knowledge have become manifest to him, never to return.

original: de'i phyir kun la mun pa gtan bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun la mun pa gtan bcom pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the one who has utterly destroyed darkness everywhere.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang nyon thos rnams kyang nyon mongs pa can gyi rmongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir kun la mun pa bcom par ni 'dod mod kyi gtan nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang nyon thos rnams kyang nyon mongs pa can gyi rmongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir kun la mun pa bcom par ni 'dod mod kyi gtan nas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is accepted that the Solitary Sages and the Sravakas have destroyed darkness everywhere, because they are free from afflicted ignorance. But it is not utterly destroyed,

original: 'di ltar de dag la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: because they still have non-afflicted ignorance.

original: 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs mdzad pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs mdzad pa //
translated: He has pulled the world out of the mire of cyclic existence.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan la phan pa sgrub pas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan la phan pa sgrub pas bstod pa'o //
translated: This verse praises the Buddha for accomplishing the benefit of others.

original: 'khor ba ni 'gro ba kun du chags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / rgal bar dka' ba yin pa'i phyir 'dam lta bu yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni 'gro ba kun du chags pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / rgal bar dka' ba yin pa'i phyir 'dam lta bu yin te /
translated: Samsara is like a swamp, because it is the abode of attachment to all reincarnating beings, and because it is difficult to cross.

original: 'gro ba der bying ba drangs so //
analyzed: 'gro ba der bying ba drangs so //
translated: Those who are submerged in it are pulled down.

original: don bzhin ston pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis 'di'i gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i thabs ston te /
analyzed: don bzhin ston pa zhes bya ba ni 'dis 'di'i gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i thabs ston te /
translated: The expression ‚Äúteaches in accordance with reality‚Äù indicates the means by which he accomplishes the welfare of others.

original: de ni ston pa na yang dag pa'i lta ba bzhin du ston pas 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs kyi /
analyzed: de ni ston pa na yang dag pa'i lta ba bzhin du ston pas 'khor ba'i 'dam las 'gro ba drangs kyi /
translated: He pulls reincarnating beings out of the swamp of samsara by teaching in accordance with the correct view.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang dam pa sbyin pa'i mthus ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang dam pa sbyin pa'i mthus ni ma yin no //
translated: He does not do so by the power of his magical abilities or by the power of his generosity.

original: de la phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ba ni dus dang por bya ba brjod nas bstan bcos rab bshad bya zhes smras te /
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ba ni dus dang por bya ba brjod nas bstan bcos rab bshad bya zhes smras te /
translated: Having paid homage to him, I will explain the treatise, having stated what is to be done at the beginning.

original: bstan bcos gang zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos gang zhe na /
translated: What is the treatise?

original: chos mngon pa mdzod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos mngon pa mdzod ces bya ba'o //
translated: It is called the Treasury of Abhidharma.

original: chos mngon pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos mngon pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Abhidharma?

original: chos mngon shes rab dri med rjes 'brang bcas //
analyzed: chos mngon shes rab dri med rjes 'brang bcas //
translated: The Abhidharma is uncontaminated wisdom and that which is associated with it.

original: shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par @96a * //
analyzed: shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par @96a * //
translated: Wisdom is the thorough knowledge of dharmas.

original: 'byed pa'o // dri med ces bya ba ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'byed pa'o // dri med ces bya ba ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äústainless‚Äù means ‚Äúwithout outflows.‚Äù

original: rjes 'brang bcas zhes bya ba ni 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rjes 'brang bcas zhes bya ba ni 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúalong with its following‚Äù means ‚Äúalong with its retinue.‚Äù

original: de ltar na zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga ni chos mngon pa zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga ni chos mngon pa zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the five aggregates that are without outflows are called the ‚ÄúAbhidharma.‚ÄùüîΩThis is the ultimate Abhidharma.

original: re zhig 'di ni don dam pa'i chos mngon pa'o //üîΩbrdar btags pa yang /
analyzed: re zhig 'di ni don dam pa'i chos mngon pa'o // brdar btags pa yang /
translated: The conventional Abhidharma is thatüîΩwhich is taught in order to attain that,

original: de thob bya phyir gang dang bstan bcos gang //
analyzed: de thob bya phyir gang dang bstan bcos gang //
translated: and the treatise that explains it.

original: gang dang ni thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab zag pa dang bcas pa dang / skyes nas thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa'o //üîΩbstan bcos gang zhes bya ba ni shes rab de thob par bya ba'i phyir de yang de'i tshogs su gyur pas chos mngon pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang dang ni thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab zag pa dang bcas pa dang / skyes nas thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa'o // bstan bcos gang zhes bya ba ni shes rab de thob par bya ba'i phyir de yang de'i tshogs su gyur pas chos mngon pa zhes brjod do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the wisdom that arises from listening, reflection, and meditation, which is accompanied by outflows and is acquired at birth, along with its following.üîΩThe ‚Äútreatise‚Äù is called the Abhidharma because it is the collection of teachings that explains that wisdom in order to attain it.

original: nges pa'i tshig tu na rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos te /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig tu na rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos te /
translated: In terms of its verbal definition, the Abhidharma is called the Abhidharma because it is the Dharma that holds its own characteristics.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni don dam pa'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni don dam pa'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa'am /
translated: Therefore, this is the ultimate reality, nirvana.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir chos mngon pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir chos mngon pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is Abhidharma, because it is directed toward the ultimate truth, nirvana, or the characteristics of the truths.

original: bstan bcos 'di ji ltar na chos mngon pa'i mdzod yin zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di ji ltar na chos mngon pa'i mdzod yin zhe na /
translated: How is this treatise a treasury of Abhidharma?

original: 'dir de don du yang dag chung phyir ram //
analyzed: 'dir de don du yang dag chung phyir ram //
translated: Because it is the true meaning of that, or

original: 'di yi gnas de yin pas chos mngon mdzod //
analyzed: 'di yi gnas de yin pas chos mngon mdzod //
translated: because that is its domain, it is the treasury of Abhidharma.

original: ces bya ba chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos 'di ni de'i mdzod lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba chos mngon pa'i bstan bcos 'di ni de'i mdzod lta bu yin no //
translated: This treatise is like a treasury of that Abhidharma.

original: yang na de las 'di phyung bas chos mngon pa de bstan bcos 'di'i gnas lta bu yin no //
analyzed: yang na de las 'di phyung bas chos mngon pa de bstan bcos 'di'i gnas lta bu yin no //
translated: Or, because it is drawn from that, Abhidharma is like the domain of this treatise.

original: de'i phyir chos mngon pa de nyid 'di'i mdzod yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos mngon pa de nyid 'di'i mdzod yin te /
translated: Therefore, that Abhidharma is its treasury.

original: de lta bas na bstan bcos 'di ni chos mngon pa'i mdzod yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bstan bcos 'di ni chos mngon pa'i mdzod yin no //
translated: Thus, this treatise is the treasury of Abhidharma.

original: yang na ci'i phyir chos mngon pa bstan pa'am 'di dang po nyid du sus bstan zhe na /
analyzed: yang na ci'i phyir chos mngon pa bstan pa'am 'di dang po nyid du sus bstan zhe na /
translated: Or, why was the Abhidharma taught? By whom was it first taught?

original: gsungs pa / chos rnams rab tu rnam 'byed med par nyon mongs rnams //
analyzed: gsungs pa / chos rnams rab tu rnam 'byed med par nyon mongs rnams //
translated: Without the discernment of phenomena,

original: gang phyir nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i thabs med la //
analyzed: gang phyir nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i thabs med la //
translated: there is no means to pacify the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pas kyang 'jig rten srid mtsho 'dir 'khyams te //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas kyang 'jig rten srid mtsho 'dir 'khyams te //
translated: And the afflictions cause the world to wander in this ocean of existence.

original: de bas de phyir 'di ni ston pas gsungs so lo //
analyzed: de bas de phyir 'di ni ston pas gsungs so lo //
translated: Therefore, the Teacher taught this.

original: gang gi phyir chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa med par nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i thabs med la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa med par nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i thabs med la /
translated: Because without the discernment of phenomena, there is no means to pacify the afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kyang 'jig rten 'khor bar 'khyam par byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kyang 'jig rten 'khor bar 'khyam par byed pa ste /
translated: and the afflictions cause the world to wander in sa·πÉsƒÅra,

original: de'i phyir ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa de'i don du ston pas ni sangs rgyas kyi chos mngon pa gsungs so lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa de'i don du ston pas ni sangs rgyas kyi chos mngon pa gsungs so lo //
translated: therefore, for the sake of that discernment of phenomena, the Teacher taught the Abhidharma of the Buddha.

original: chos mngon pa bstan pa med par ni slob mas chos rab tu rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos mngon pa bstan pa med par ni slob mas chos rab tu rnam par dbye bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without the teaching of the Abhidharma, students cannot discern phenomena.

original: chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are those phenomena?

original: zag bcas zag pa med chos rnams //
analyzed: zag bcas zag pa med chos rnams //
translated: They are contaminated and uncontaminated phenomena.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus it is said.üîΩüîΩ

original: 'di ni chos @96b thams cad mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos @96b thams cad mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the summary of all dharmas.

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the dharmas with outflows?

original: lam ma gtogs pa'i 'dus byas rnams //üîΩzag bcas zhes smos so //
analyzed: lam ma gtogs pa'i 'dus byas rnams // zag bcas zhes smos so //
translated: The conditioned dharmas, with the exception of the Path, are with outflows.

original: lam gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa 'dus byas kyi chos gzhan rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ma gtogs pa 'dus byas kyi chos gzhan rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: The conditioned dharmas, with the exception of the Truth of the Path, are with outflows.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang gi phyir de dag la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag la /
translated: Because the outflows increase in them.

original: zas rnams kun du rgyas par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ste /üîΩ'di rnams la zag pa rnams rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zas rnams kun du rgyas par 'gyur // zhes bya ste / 'di rnams la zag pa rnams rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: The outflows increase in the conditioned dharmas, with the exception of the Path.

original: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa dag la dmigs pa yin du zin kyang rgyas par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa dag la dmigs pa yin du zin kyang rgyas par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though the outflows can have the Truth of Cessation and the Truth of the Path for their cognitive object, they do not increase there.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The dharmas with outflows have been discussed.

original: zag med lam gyi bden pa dang // 'dus ma byas rnam gsum yang ste //
analyzed: zag med lam gyi bden pa dang // 'dus ma byas rnam gsum yang ste //
translated: The Truth of the Path and the three unconditioned things are without outflows.

original: rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three unconditioned things?

original: nam mkha' dang ni 'gog pa gnyis //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang ni 'gog pa gnyis //
translated: Space and the two kinds of cessation.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two cessations?

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste /
translated: 1. cessation through deliberation, 2. cessation not through deliberation.

original: de ltar na nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas gsum po de dag dang lam gyi bden pa ni thag pa med pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: de ltar na nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas gsum po de dag dang lam gyi bden pa ni thag pa med pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: Thus, these three unconditioned things, i.e., space, etc., and the Truth of the Path are the dharmas without cause.

original: de dag la zag pa rgyas par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la zag pa rgyas par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the contaminants do not expand in them.

original: 'dus ma byas pa bstan pa /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa bstan pa /
translated: The unconditioned things have been discussed.

original: rnam pa gsum po gang yin pa //üîΩde la nam mkha' mi sgrib pa //üîΩnam mkha' ni sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin te //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po gang yin pa // de la nam mkha' mi sgrib pa // nam mkha' ni sgrib pa med pa'i rang bzhin te //
translated: What are the three kinds of unconditioned things?üîΩSpace and the two cessations.üîΩSpace is the absence of an obstruction.

original: gang na gzugs kyi go yod pa'o//üîΩso sor brtags pas 'gog pa gang //
analyzed: gang na gzugs kyi go yod pa'o// so sor brtags pas 'gog pa gang //
translated: It is the absence of an obstruction, i.e., the absence of matter.üîΩCessation through deliberation is disjunction.

original: bral ba'o so so so so yin //
analyzed: bral ba'o so so so so yin //
translated: Cessation not through deliberation is a different thing.

original: gang zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang bral ba de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams dang bral ba de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: Disjunction from the impure dharmas is cessation through deliberation.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la so sor rtog pa ni so sor brtags pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams la so sor rtog pa ni so sor brtags pa ste /
translated: Deliberation on the Truths is deliberation.

original: dge ba'i blo yi bye brag go ;
analyzed: dge ba'i blo yi bye brag go ;
translated: It is a particular kind of good mind.

original: / des thob par bya ba'i 'gog pa ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: / des thob par bya ba'i 'gog pa ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: Cessation that is to be attained by that is analytical cessation.

original: de yang 'di zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi so so sor te /üîΩldan pa'i rdzas rnams ji snyed pa //
analyzed: de yang 'di zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi so so sor te / ldan pa'i rdzas rnams ji snyed pa //
translated: And that is for each of the contaminated dharmas.üîΩAs many substances there are of possession,

original: bral ba'i rdzas kyang de snyed do //
analyzed: bral ba'i rdzas kyang de snyed do //
translated: there are that many substances of nonpossession.

original: 'gog pa gcig nyid yin na nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gcig spongs na de mngon sum du byas par 'gyur bas lhag ma'i gnyen po bsgom pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes so sor brtags pas 'gog pa bshad zin to //üîΩskye la gtan du gegs byed pa //
analyzed: 'gog pa gcig nyid yin na nyon mongs pa'i phyogs gcig spongs na de mngon sum du byas par 'gyur bas lhag ma'i gnyen po bsgom pa don med par 'gyur ro zhes so sor brtags pas 'gog pa bshad zin to // skye la gtan du gegs byed pa //
translated: If there were only one cessation, then when one part of the defilements was abandoned, it would be manifested. Therefore, it would be pointless to cultivate the antidote to the remaining parts.

original: 'gog gzhan so sor brtags min pas //üîΩchos ma 'ongs pa rnams skye ba la gtan du gegs su gyur pa bral ba las @97a * //
analyzed: 'gog gzhan so sor brtags min pas // chos ma 'ongs pa rnams skye ba la gtan du gegs su gyur pa bral ba las @97a * //
translated: The other cessation is nonanalytical.üîΩThe other cessation, which is a permanent obstruction to the arising of future dharmas, is a cessation that is different from separation.

original: gzhan pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa ste /
translated: That is nonanalytical cessation.

original: 'di so sor brtags pas thob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di so sor brtags pas thob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not attained by analysis.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: rkyen ma tshang ba las thob ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen ma tshang ba las thob ba'o //
translated: they are obtained through the non-fulfillment of conditions.

original: yang / lam ma gtogs pa'i 'dus byas rnams //
analyzed: yang / lam ma gtogs pa'i 'dus byas rnams //
translated: The conditioned factors, with the exception of the path, are impure.

original: zag bcas zhes gang smras pa'i yul 'dus byas de dag gang zhe na /üîΩ'dus byas chos rnams de dag kyang //
analyzed: zag bcas zhes gang smras pa'i yul 'dus byas de dag gang zhe na / 'dus byas chos rnams de dag kyang //
translated: What are these conditioned factors?üîΩThe conditioned factors are the five aggregates,

original: gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga //
translated: form, etc.

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya ba de dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya ba de dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams so //
translated: The five aggregates are the aggregate of form, the aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of perception, the aggregate of the formations, the aggregate of consciousness.

original: rkyen rnams 'dus shing phrad nas byas pa dag gi phyir 'dus byas rnams so //
analyzed: rkyen rnams 'dus shing phrad nas byas pa dag gi phyir 'dus byas rnams so //
translated: They are conditioned because they are produced by the coming together of causes and conditions.

original: de dag nyid dus gtam gzhi dang // nges par 'byung bcas gzhi dang bcas //
analyzed: de dag nyid dus gtam gzhi dang // nges par 'byung bcas gzhi dang bcas //
translated: The time periods are past, future, and present.

original: de la song ba dang 'gro ba dang 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de la song ba dang 'gro ba dang 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ram /
translated: The time periods are so called because the factors have gone into the past, are not yet come into the present, or are in the process of coming into the present.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis za ba'i phyir dus rnams so ;üîΩ/ gtam ni dag go //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis za ba'i phyir dus rnams so ; / gtam ni dag go //
translated: Or else, the time periods are so called because the factors are devoured by impermanence.üîΩThe basis is the foundation.

original: de'i gzhi ni ming ste /
analyzed: de'i gzhi ni ming ste /
translated: The basis is the name.

original: don dang bcas pa'i gzhi bzung bas na 'dus byas ni gtam gyi gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dang bcas pa'i gzhi bzung bas na 'dus byas ni gtam gyi gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: The conditioned is the basis of discourse because it is the basis of the discourse on the truths.üîΩThe unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.üîΩThe unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.

original: nges par 'byung ba nyid ni nges par 'byung ba ste /üîΩ'dus byas thams cad kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'o //üîΩde 'di dag la yod pas nges par 'byung bcas dag go //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba nyid ni nges par 'byung ba ste / 'dus byas thams cad kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'o // de 'di dag la yod pas nges par 'byung bcas dag go //
translated: The unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir gzhi dang bcas pa dag go //üîΩyang 'dus byas de dag nyid /üîΩgang dag zag bcas nyer len pa'i //
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir gzhi dang bcas pa dag go // yang 'dus byas de dag nyid / gang dag zag bcas nyer len pa'i //
translated: The unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.üîΩThe unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.üîΩThe unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.üîΩThe unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.

original: phung po'ang de dag / de dag nye bar len pa dag ni nyon mongs pa rnams te /üîΩdper na rtsva dang sbun pa'i me bzhin nam /
analyzed: phung po'ang de dag / de dag nye bar len pa dag ni nyon mongs pa rnams te / dper na rtsva dang sbun pa'i me bzhin nam /
translated: The unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.

original: de dag la rag lus pa'i phyir rgyal po'i mi bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag la rag lus pa'i phyir rgyal po'i mi bzhin no //
translated: The unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.üîΩThe unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.üîΩThe unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.üîΩThe unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.üîΩThe unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.üîΩThe unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.üîΩThe unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.üîΩThe unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.üîΩThe unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.üîΩThe unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.

original: yang na de dag las nye bar len pa rnams 'byung bas nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams te /üîΩme tog dang 'bras bu'i shing ljon pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na de dag las nye bar len pa rnams 'byung bas nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams te / me tog dang 'bras bu'i shing ljon pa bzhin no //
translated: The unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object of the discourse on the truths.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos de dag nyid /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos de dag nyid /
translated: The unconditioned is the basis of the discourse on the truths because it is the object

original: 'thab bcas kyang zhes brjod do //üîΩ'thad pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'thab bcas kyang zhes brjod do // 'thad pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams te /
translated: They are also called ‚Äúthe quarrelsome‚Äù because of the quarrels that arise from them.

original: bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The defilements are the quarrels because they are harmful to oneself and to others.

original: de dag gis rgyas par byas pa nyid kyi phyir 'thab bcas dag ste /
analyzed: de dag gis rgyas par byas pa nyid kyi phyir 'thab bcas dag ste /
translated: They are called ‚Äúquarrelsome‚Äù because they are developed by the quarrels.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa bzhin no //
translated: They are like the ‚Äúdefilements‚Äù.

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'jig rten dang // lha gnas srid pa'ang de dag yin //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'jig rten dang // lha gnas srid pa'ang de dag yin //
translated: They are the origin of suffering, the world, the abodes of the gods, and also existence.

original: 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa'i phyir sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa'i phyir sdug bsngal lo //
translated: They are suffering because they are contrary to the noble ones.

original: 'di @97b las sdug bsngal kun 'byung bas na kun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di @97b las sdug bsngal kun 'byung bas na kun 'byung ngo //
translated: They are the origin of suffering because suffering arises from them.

original: skad cig re rer 'jig pas na 'jig rten no //
analyzed: skad cig re rer 'jig pas na 'jig rten no //
translated: They are the world because they are destroyed every moment.

original: 'di la lta brgyas par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas gnas pas na lta ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: 'di la lta brgyas par 'gyur ba'i sgo nas gnas pas na lta ba'i gnas so //
translated: They are the abodes of the views because the views are developed in them.

original: sdug bsngal ni kun 'byung las 'byung ba'i phyir srid pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni kun 'byung las 'byung ba'i phyir srid pa'o //
translated: They are existence because suffering arises from them.

original: de ltar na 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam grangs don dang mthun pa dag go //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi rnam grangs don dang mthun pa dag go //
translated: Thus these synonyms of the ‚Äúimpure dharmas‚Äù are in agreement with their meanings.

original: gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga //üîΩzhes gsungs te /üîΩde la / gzugs ni dbang po lnga dang don //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga // zhes gsungs te / de la / gzugs ni dbang po lnga dang don //
translated: The five aggregates are form and so on.

original: lnga dang rnam rig byed min nyid //
analyzed: lnga dang rnam rig byed min nyid //
translated: Form is the five sense faculties, the five objects, and non-revealing form.

original: dbang po lnga ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi dbang po rnams dang / don lnga ni mig la sogs pa dbang po de dag nyid kyi yul gang dag yin pa gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang /üîΩro dang / reg bya rnams dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po lnga ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi dbang po rnams dang / don lnga ni mig la sogs pa dbang po de dag nyid kyi yul gang dag yin pa gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ste /
translated: The five sense faculties are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body faculties. The five objects are the objects of those faculties, namely, form, sound, smell, taste, and tangible objects.üîΩNon-revealing form is also form.

original: de snyed cig ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: de snyed cig ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: That is the form aggregate.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa'i don gang 'di dag smos pa /
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa'i don gang 'di dag smos pa /
translated: The objects of form and so on that have been mentioned

original: de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten ;
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi rnam shes rten ;
translated: are the bases of the consciousnesses of form and so on.

original: / mig la sogs gzugs dang rnams /
analyzed: / mig la sogs gzugs dang rnams /
translated: The eye and so on are form.

original: gzugs dang sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rten du gyur pa'i gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid lnga po gang dag yin pa de dag ni rim pa bzhin du mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang /üîΩlce dang / lus ngag yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩdbang po lnga bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rten du gyur pa'i gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid lnga po gang dag yin pa de dag ni rim pa bzhin du mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus ngag yin par rig par bya'o // dbang po lnga bshad zin to //
translated: The five that are the basis of the consciousness of form, sound, smell, taste, and tactility are, respectively, the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: don lnga bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: don lnga bshad par bya ste /
translated: The five faculties have been explained.üîΩThe five objects will now be explained.

original: gzugs rnam gnyis dang / kha dog dang dbyibs so //üîΩyang de nyid /
analyzed: gzugs rnam gnyis dang / kha dog dang dbyibs so // yang de nyid /
translated: Form is twofold: color and shape.

original: rnam nyi shu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam nyi shu zhes bya ste /
translated: It is also said to be twentyfold.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ring po dang / thung ngu dang / lham pa dang / zlum po dang / mthon po dang / dma' ba dang / phya le ba dang / phya le ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ring po dang / thung ngu dang / lham pa dang / zlum po dang / mthon po dang / dma' ba dang / phya le ba dang / phya le ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: blue, yellow, red, white, long, short, small, large, square, round, high, low, even, uneven, light, shadow, sun, clouds, and space.

original: sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa'o //
analyzed: sprin dang / du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang / grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang / mun pa'o //
translated: cloud, smoke, dust, mist, shadow, sunshine, light, darkness.

original: de la phya le ba ni dbyibs mnyam ba'o //
analyzed: de la phya le ba ni dbyibs mnyam ba'o //
translated: Among these, the beautiful is the even shape.

original: phya le ba ma yin pa ni dbyibs mi mnyam pa'o//
analyzed: phya le ba ma yin pa ni dbyibs mi mnyam pa'o//
translated: The ugly is the uneven shape.

original: khug rna ni lho bur ro //
analyzed: khug rna ni lho bur ro //
translated: Mist is fog.

original: nyi ma ni nyi ma'i 'od do //
analyzed: nyi ma ni nyi ma'i 'od do //
translated: Sunshine is the light of the sun.

original: snang ba ni zla ba dang skar ma dang / me dang sman dang nor bu rnams kyi 'od dag go //
analyzed: snang ba ni zla ba dang skar ma dang / me dang sman dang nor bu rnams kyi 'od dag go //
translated: Light is the light of the moon, the stars, fire, gems, and medicinal herbs.

original: grib ma ni gang na gzugs rnams snang pa'o //
analyzed: grib ma ni gang na gzugs rnams snang pa'o //
translated: Shadow is where forms are visible.

original: bzlog pa ni mun pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni mun pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is darkness.

original: lhag ma ni brda phrad par sla bas rnam par ma phye'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni brda phrad par sla bas rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: The rest are easy to understand, so they are not explained.

original: sgra ni rnam pa brgyad @98a * //
analyzed: sgra ni rnam pa brgyad @98a * //
translated: Sound is of eight kinds:

original: yod de / zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba sems can dang sems can ma yin par te rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: yod de / zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba sems can dang sems can ma yin par te rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: It is produced by the great elements that are its cause, which are either appropriated or non-appropriated, and it is either sentient or non-sentient. Thus, there are four kinds.

original: de yang yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: The sound is of eight types, being divided into agreeable and disagreeable.

original: de la zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni lag pa dang ngag gi sgra'o //
analyzed: de la zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni lag pa dang ngag gi sgra'o //
translated: Sound that arises from the great elements that are its cause and that are grasped is the sound of the hand and the voice.

original: ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni rlung dang nags tshal dang chu bo'i sgra'o //
analyzed: ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ni rlung dang nags tshal dang chu bo'i sgra'o //
translated: Sound that arises from the great elements that are its cause and that are not grasped is the sound of the wind, the forest, the river.

original: sems can du ston pa ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgra'o //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa ni ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi sgra'o //
translated: Sound that is informative of sentient beings is the sound of speech.

original: gzhan ni sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Other sound is not informative of sentient beings.

original: gzhan du yang sgra thams cad gnyis gnyis su bsdus pa'i phyir sgra ni rnam pa bzhi ru brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan du yang sgra thams cad gnyis gnyis su bsdus pa'i phyir sgra ni rnam pa bzhi ru brjod do //
translated: Or else, all sound is included in two categories: sound that is grasped and sound that is not grasped.

original: sgra ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: sgra ni bshad zin to //
translated: Sound has been discussed.

original: ro ni rnam drug / mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva ba dang / tsha ba dang / kha ba dang / bska ba'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: ro ni rnam drug / mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva ba dang / tsha ba dang / kha ba dang / bska ba'i bye brag gis so //
translated: Taste is of six types: sweet, sour, salty, pungent, bitter, and astringent.

original: dri rnam bzhi /
analyzed: dri rnam bzhi /
translated: Odor is of four types.

original: dri zhim pa dang / dri nga ba gnyis la /
analyzed: dri zhim pa dang / dri nga ba gnyis la /
translated: Pleasant and unpleasant odors,

original: mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are equal and unequal.

original: reg bya bcu gcig bdag nyid do //
analyzed: reg bya bcu gcig bdag nyid do //
translated: The tangible consists of eleven types.

original: 'byung ba bzhi dag dang / 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid dang / lci ba nyid dang / yang ba nyid dang / grang ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi dag dang / 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid dang / lci ba nyid dang / yang ba nyid dang / grang ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa'o //
translated: The four primary elements, smoothness, roughness, heaviness, lightness, cold, hunger, and thirst.

original: de la 'byung ba rnams ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba rnams ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: The primary elements will be explained later.

original: 'jam pa nyid ni mnyan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam pa nyid ni mnyan pa'o //
translated: Smoothness is softness.

original: rtsub pa nyid ni hrud hrud po'o //
analyzed: rtsub pa nyid ni hrud hrud po'o //
translated: Roughness is harshness.

original: lci ba nyid ni gang gis na dngos po rnams 'jal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: lci ba nyid ni gang gis na dngos po rnams 'jal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Heaviness is that by which things can be weighed.

original: bzlog pa ni yang ba nyid do //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni yang ba nyid do //
translated: Lightness is the opposite.

original: grang ba ni dro ba 'dod par byed pa'o //üîΩbkres pa ni zas 'dod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: grang ba ni dro ba 'dod par byed pa'o // bkres pa ni zas 'dod par byed pa'o //
translated: Cold is that which causes a desire for warmth.üîΩHunger is that which causes a desire for food.

original: skom pa'i btud pa 'dod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skom pa'i btud pa 'dod par byed pa'o //
translated: Thirst is that which causes a desire for drink.

original: rgyu las 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir te /üîΩdper na / sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde//
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu btags pa'i phyir te / dper na / sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde//
translated: The effect is figuratively designated as the cause.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is said, ‚ÄúThe appearance of the Buddhas is happiness.üîΩ‚Äù

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang zhe na /üîΩg-yengs dang sems med pa yi yang //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang zhe na / g-yengs dang sems med pa yi yang //
translated: What is non-revealing form?üîΩIt is that which is related to virtue and non-virtue,

original: dge dang mi dge rjes 'brel gang //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge rjes 'brel gang //
translated: whether the mind is distracted or not,üîΩwhether there is mind or not,

original: 'byung ba che rnams rgyur byas pa //
analyzed: 'byung ba che rnams rgyur byas pa //
translated: and which is made of the great elements.

original: de ni rnam rig byed min brjod //
analyzed: de ni rnam rig byed min brjod //
translated: It is called non-revealing form.

original: sems g-yengs pa zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i sems pa'i yang yin pa'o ;üîΩ/ sems med pa'i yang zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: sems g-yengs pa zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i sems pa'i yang yin pa'o ; / sems med pa'i yang zhes bya ba ni //
translated: ‚ÄúDistracted mind‚Äù means a mind other than that which is presently active.

original: 'du shes med pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i yang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i yang yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhether there is mind or not‚Äù means whether there is the meditative absorption of non-perception or the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ma yengs pa dang sems dang bcas pa'i yang yin no zhes bya bar yang mngon no //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ma yengs pa dang sems dang bcas pa'i yang yin no zhes bya bar yang mngon no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is also related to a mind that is not distracted and that is presently active.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba ni dge legs dang dge legs ma @98b yin pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba ni dge legs dang dge legs ma @98b yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúVirtue and non-virtue‚Äù means wholesome and unwholesome.

original: rjes 'brel gang zhes bya ba ni rgyun to //
analyzed: rjes 'brel gang zhes bya ba ni rgyun to //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is related‚Äù means a continuum.

original: thob pa'i rgyun yang 'di lta bu yod pas bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thob pa'i rgyun yang 'di lta bu yod pas bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Since there is a continuum of obtainment, in order to distinguish it,

original: 'byung ba che rnams rgyur byas pa //
analyzed: 'byung ba che rnams rgyur byas pa //
translated: it is said that it is made of the great elements.

original: zhes bya ba brjod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba brjod do //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: rgyur byas pa'i don ni rgyu'i don te /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i don ni rgyu'i don te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúderived‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúcause,‚Äù

original: skyed pa la sogs pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyed pa la sogs pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of a cause that generates and so forth.

original: de ni rnam rig byed min zhes bya ba la de ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de'i ming shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni rnam rig byed min zhes bya ba la de ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de'i ming shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: That is called ‚Äúnon-revealing form.‚Äù The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù indicates that it is known by name.

original: gzugs dang byed pa'i rang bzhin yin yang rnam par rig byed bzhin du gzhan la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang byed pa'i rang bzhin yin yang rnam par rig byed bzhin du gzhan la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: Even though it is by nature form and action, it is non-revealing form, unlike revealing form, which causes others to know one‚Äôs thoughts.

original: brjod ces bya ba ni slob dpon gyi tshig yin par ston pa'o //
analyzed: brjod ces bya ba ni slob dpon gyi tshig yin par ston pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúsays‚Äù indicates that this is the statement of the master.

original: mdor na rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i gzugs dge ba dang mi dge ba ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mdor na rnam par rig byed dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i gzugs dge ba dang mi dge ba ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: In brief, non-revealing form is virtuous or nonvirtuous form derived from revealing form and meditative absorption.

original: 'byung ba che rnams rgyur byas pa //
analyzed: 'byung ba che rnams rgyur byas pa //
translated: It is derived from the great elements.

original: zhes gsungs pa de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are those great elements?üîΩThe elements are the earth element,

original: 'byung ba dag ni sa khams dang // chu khams me khams rlung khams rnams //
analyzed: 'byung ba dag ni sa khams dang // chu khams me khams rlung khams rnams //
translated: the water element, the fire element, and the wind element.

original: de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang 'dzin pa'i phyir khams dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang 'dzin pa'i phyir khams dag go //
translated: They are elements because they hold their own characteristics and they hold derivative form.

original: 'di dag gzugs gzhan thams cad kyi rten nyid du rags pa'i phyir chen po nyid do //
analyzed: 'di dag gzugs gzhan thams cad kyi rten nyid du rags pa'i phyir chen po nyid do //
translated: They are great elements because they are the basis of all other forms and because they are gross.

original: yang na de las byung ba'i rang bzhin sa dang / chu dang / me dang rlung gi phung po de dag bya ba la shas che ba dag la de rnams chen por gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na de las byung ba'i rang bzhin sa dang / chu dang / me dang rlung gi phung po de dag bya ba la shas che ba dag la de rnams chen por gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, the great elements are so called because the four primary elements of earth, water, fire, and wind, which are derived from them, are the most important in their functions.

original: yang khams de dag gi las gang yang dag par 'grub /
analyzed: yang khams de dag gi las gang yang dag par 'grub /
translated: What is the function of these elements?

original: rang bzhin dag ni ci zhe na /üîΩ'dzin pa la sogs las su 'grub //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag ni ci zhe na / 'dzin pa la sogs las su 'grub //
translated: What is their nature?

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Their function is to support and so forth.

original: 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du 'dzin pa dang / sdud pa dang / smin par byed pa dang / rgyas par byed pa'i las yang dag par sgrub po //
analyzed: 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du 'dzin pa dang / sdud pa dang / smin par byed pa dang / rgyas par byed pa'i las yang dag par sgrub po //
translated: Their function is to support, to hold, to mature, and to increase.

original: rgyas par byed pa yang 'phel ba dang / rgyas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas par byed pa yang 'phel ba dang / rgyas par byed pa'o //
translated: Increasing means to grow and to expand.

original: rang bzhin ni go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni go rims bzhin du /
translated: Their nature is to be hard,üîΩwet, hot, and to move upward.

original: sra gsher dro nyid g-yo rnams te //
analyzed: sra gsher dro nyid g-yo rnams te //
translated: solidity, fluidity, heat, and motion.

original: sra ba ni sa'i khams so //
analyzed: sra ba ni sa'i khams so //
translated: Solidity is the earth element.

original: gsher ba ni chu'i khams so //
analyzed: gsher ba ni chu'i khams so //
translated: Fluidity is the water element.

original: dro ba ni me'i khams so //
analyzed: dro ba ni me'i khams so //
translated: Heat is the fire element.

original: g-yo ba ni rlung gi khams so //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni rlung gi khams so //
translated: Motion is the wind element.

original: 'dis 'byung ba'i yul gzhan du skyed pa'i phyir g-yo bar byed de /
analyzed: 'dis 'byung ba'i yul gzhan du skyed pa'i phyir g-yo bar byed de /
translated: It is called motion because it generates the object of origination in another place,

original: sgron ma g-yo ba bzhin du g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: sgron ma g-yo ba bzhin du g-yo ba yin no //
translated: like the motion of a lamp.

original: yang sa la sogs pa dang sa'i khams la sogs pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: yang sa la sogs pa dang sa'i khams la sogs pa la bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between earth, etc. and the earth element, etc.?

original: 'jig rten gyi ni tha snyad du //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi ni tha snyad du //
translated: In the world, they are known

original: kha dog dbyibs las zhes brjod //
analyzed: kha dog dbyibs las zhes brjod //
translated: by their color and shape.

original: 'di ltar sa ston pa na kha dog dang dbyibs @99a * //üîΩston par byed do //üîΩsa la ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa ston pa na kha dog dang dbyibs @99a * // ston par byed do // sa la ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: When one sees earth, one sees color and shape.

original: chu me yang ngo //
analyzed: chu me yang ngo //
translated: The same for water and fire.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du kha dog dang dbyibs nyid la brjod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du kha dog dang dbyibs nyid la brjod do //
translated: In the world, one designates color and shape as earth, water, and fire.

original: rlung tshogs khams nyid yin //
analyzed: rlung tshogs khams nyid yin //
translated: The wind element is the wind.

original: rlung gi khams gang yin pa de nyid la 'jig rten na rlung zhes 'dogs so //
analyzed: rlung gi khams gang yin pa de nyid la 'jig rten na rlung zhes 'dogs so //
translated: The wind element is called wind in the world.

original: de dang 'dra ba'ang yin ;
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'ang yin ;
translated: It is also similar to that.üîΩ

original: kha dog dang dbyibs kyang ngo //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs kyang ngo //
translated: It is also the color and shape.

original: ji ltar rlung tshogs sngon po rlung tshogs zlum po zhes zer ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rlung tshogs sngon po rlung tshogs zlum po zhes zer ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as one says: ‚Äúa mass of wind,‚Äù ‚Äúa round mass of wind.‚Äù

original: 'di yang gzugs su rung bas gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: 'di yang gzugs su rung bas gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: And this is called the aggregate of material form because it is suitable as form.

original: gzugs su rung ba ni gnod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs su rung ba ni gnod pa'o //
translated: To be suitable as form is to be suitable as an object of contact.

original: thogs pa'o zhes kha cig gi'o //
analyzed: thogs pa'o zhes kha cig gi'o //
translated: Some say: ‚ÄúIt is to be impeded.‚Äù

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa gang dag yin pa /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa gang dag yin pa /
translated: The nature of the aggregate of material form has been explained.

original: dbang don de dag kho na la //üîΩskye mched dang ni khams bcur 'dod //
analyzed: dbang don de dag kho na la // skye mched dang ni khams bcur 'dod //
translated: The same sense faculties and objectsüîΩare considered to be the ten elements and the ten bases.

original: skye mched rnam par gzhag pa ni skye mched bcu ste /
analyzed: skye mched rnam par gzhag pa ni skye mched bcu ste /
translated: The bases are established as ten:

original: mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched nas /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched nas /
translated: the eye base and form base,

original: lus kyi skye mched dang / reg bya'i skye mched kyi bar yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi skye mched dang / reg bya'i skye mched kyi bar yin no //
translated: up to the body base and tangible object base.

original: khams rnam par gzhag pa ni de dag nyid bcu ste /
analyzed: khams rnam par gzhag pa ni de dag nyid bcu ste /
translated: The elements are established as ten:

original: mig gi khams dang gzugs kyi khams nas lus kyi dang reg bya'i khams kyi bar yin no //
analyzed: mig gi khams dang gzugs kyi khams nas lus kyi dang reg bya'i khams kyi bar yin no //
translated: the eye element and form element, up to the body element and tangible object element.

original: gzugs kyi phung po bshad zin to //üîΩde la tshor ba myong ba /
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po bshad zin to // de la tshor ba myong ba /
translated: The aggregate of form has been explained.üîΩThe aggregate of feeling is the experience of the object.

original: myong ba rnam pa gsum ni tshor ba'i phung po ste /
analyzed: myong ba rnam pa gsum ni tshor ba'i phung po ste /
translated: The aggregate of feeling is the experience of the three kinds of sensation.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Pleasant, unpleasant, and neither unpleasant nor pleasant.

original: de yang dbye na tshor ba'i tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: de yang dbye na tshor ba'i tshogs drug ste /
translated: When classified, there are six collections of feeling,

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i bar ro //
translated: from the feeling that arises from the contact of the eye up to the feeling that arises from the contact of the mind.

original: 'du shes ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'du shes ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The aggregate of perception is the grasping of the mark.

original: gang sngon po dang ser po dang / ring po dang / thung ngu dang / pho dang / mo dang / mdza' bshes dang / mdza' bshes ma yin pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par la mtshan mar 'dzin pa de ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: gang sngon po dang ser po dang / ring po dang / thung ngu dang / pho dang / mo dang / mdza' bshes dang / mdza' bshes ma yin pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par la mtshan mar 'dzin pa de ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: The aggregate of perception is the grasping of the mark of the particular nature of an object, such as blue or yellow, long or short, male or female, friend or foe, pleasure or pain, and so on.

original: de yang dbye na 'du shes kyi tshogs drug ste tshor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang dbye na 'du shes kyi tshogs drug ste tshor ba bzhin no //
translated: When classified, there are six collections of perception, like the collection of feelings.

original: 'du byed phung po bzhi las gzhan //
analyzed: 'du byed phung po bzhi las gzhan //
translated: The aggregate of formations is other than the four aggregates.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'i 'du byed rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'i 'du byed rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
translated: The aggregate of formations is the formations that are other than form, feeling, perception and consciousness.

original: de gsum / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dag ste /
analyzed: de gsum / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dag ste /
translated: These three are the aggregates of feeling, perception and formations.

original: skye mched dang / khams @99b rnam par gzhag pa ni /üîΩrnam rig byed min dang / 'dus ma byas rnams bcas pa ni //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams @99b rnam par gzhag pa ni / rnam rig byed min dang / 'dus ma byas rnams bcas pa ni //
translated: The presentation of the bases and elements is as follows:

original: chos kyi skye mched khams zhes bya //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched khams zhes bya //
translated: The unconditioned is included in the phenomena base and element.

original: de ltar rdzas bdun po 'di dag ni chos kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rdzas bdun po 'di dag ni chos kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus these seven substances are called the phenomena base and the phenomena element.

original: rnam shes so sor rnam rig pa /
analyzed: rnam shes so sor rnam rig pa /
translated: Consciousness is the awareness of each object.

original: yul dang yul las so sor rnam par rig cing dmigs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul dang yul las so sor rnam par rig cing dmigs pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the awareness and observation of each object and each object-field.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
translated: It is the six collections of consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar ro //
translated: They are the eye consciousness to the mental consciousness.

original: skye mched rnam par gzhag pa la /
analyzed: skye mched rnam par gzhag pa la /
translated: In the presentation of the sense bases,

original: yid kyi skye mched kyang de yin /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched kyang de yin /
translated: the mental faculty is also a sense base.

original: khams rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: khams rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: In the presentation of the elements,

original: khams bdun dag tu 'od 'dod pa ste //
analyzed: khams bdun dag tu 'od 'dod pa ste //
translated: it is asserted that the mental faculty is seven elements.

original: bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: rnam par shes pa drug dang yid //üîΩmig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug dang yid // mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas /
translated: The six consciousnesses and the mental faculty.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yid kyi khams kyi bar ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yid kyi khams kyi bar ro //
translated: The element of eye consciousness up to the element of mental consciousness are the seven elements.

original: de ltar na phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / khams bco brgyad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus the five aggregates, twelve sense bases, and eighteen elements are presented.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ma gtogs pa gzugs kyi phung po ni skye mched bcu dang khams bcu dag go //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ma gtogs pa gzugs kyi phung po ni skye mched bcu dang khams bcu dag go //
translated: The form aggregate, excluding nonindicative form, is the ten sense bases and ten elements.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa phung po gsum dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas dag ni chos kyi skye mched dang chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa phung po gsum dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas dag ni chos kyi skye mched dang chos kyi khams so //
translated: The three aggregates of feeling and so on, nonindicative form and unconditioned states are the phenomena base and phenomena element.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni yid kyi skye mched dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang / yid kyi khams so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni yid kyi skye mched dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang / yid kyi khams so //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the sense-sphere of the mental faculty, the six elements of consciousness, and the element of the mental faculty.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni rnam par shes pa'i phung por bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni rnam par shes pa'i phung por bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: Aren't the six collections of consciousness explained as the aggregate of consciousness?

original: yang de dag las gzhan pa'i yid kyi khams de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang de dag las gzhan pa'i yid kyi khams de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mental faculty that is different from those?

original: gzhan ni gang yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni gang yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not anything other than those.

original: de dag nyid /üîΩdrug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: de dag nyid / drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
translated: Those very six collections of consciousness are the mental faculty.

original: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
analyzed: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
translated: The immediately past sixth consciousness is the mental faculty.

original: rnam par shes pa gang 'gags ma thag pa de nyid ni yid kyi khams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang 'gags ma thag pa de nyid ni yid kyi khams zhes bya ste /
translated: The consciousness that has just ceased is called the mental faculty.

original: dper na bu nyid phar 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu de nyid gzhan gyi sa bon yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bu nyid phar 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu de nyid gzhan gyi sa bon yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a son himself becomes a father, and a fruit itself is the seed of another.

original: de lta na 'o na ni rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang / yid kyi rnam shes gcig gi nang du gcig 'dus pa'i phyir rdzas su na khams bcu bdun nam bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang / yid kyi rnam shes gcig gi nang du gcig 'dus pa'i phyir rdzas su na khams bcu bdun nam bcu gnyis su 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then since the six elements of consciousness and the one element of mental consciousness are included in one another, there would be seventeen or twelve real substances.

original: de lta 'ang yin mod kyi 'on kyang /üîΩdrug pa'i @100a * //
analyzed: de lta 'ang yin mod kyi 'on kyang / drug pa'i @100a * //
translated: But this is not so.

original: rten ni rab bsgrub phyir //
analyzed: rten ni rab bsgrub phyir //
translated: The sixth is taught in order to establish its basis.

original: khams ni bco brgyad dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: khams ni bco brgyad dag tu 'dod //
translated: The elements are accepted as eighteen.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga po dag gi rten lnga ni mig gi khams la sogs pa yin na drug pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi rten ni gzhan med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga po dag gi rten lnga ni mig gi khams la sogs pa yin na drug pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi rten ni gzhan med do //
translated: The five sense consciousnesses have five bases, which are the eye element, etc. But the sixth, the mental consciousness, has no other basis.

original: de'i phyir rten rab tu bsgrub pa'i ched du yid kyi khams bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir rten rab tu bsgrub pa'i ched du yid kyi khams bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the mental element is taught in order to establish its basis.

original: de ltar na rten dang brten pa dang dmigs pa drug tshan rnam par gzhag pas khams bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rten dang brten pa dang dmigs pa drug tshan rnam par gzhag pas khams bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the elements are established as eighteen by positing six bases, six dependent things, and six objects.

original: de la phung po de dag gis ni 'dus byas thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: de la phung po de dag gis ni 'dus byas thams cad bsdus so //
translated: In this regard, all conditioned things are included in the aggregates.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po dag gis ni zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po dag gis ni zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad bsdus so //
translated: All things that are subject to impurity are included in the appropriating aggregates.

original: skye mched dang khams dag gis ni chos thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: skye mched dang khams dag gis ni chos thams cad bsdus so //
translated: All things are included in the bases and elements.

original: mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: phung po dang ni skye mched dang // khams gcig gis ni thams cad bsdus par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: phung po dang ni skye mched dang // khams gcig gis ni thams cad bsdus par shes par bya ste /
translated: One should know that all are included in one aggregate, one base, and one element.

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi khams kyis chos thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o//
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi khams kyis chos thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o//
translated: One should know that all things are included in the form aggregate, the mental faculty base, and the factors element.

original: bsdu ba de dag ni gang dang gang nas 'byung yang rung /
analyzed: bsdu ba de dag ni gang dang gang nas 'byung yang rung /
translated: These inclusions should be understood as they occur in the sutras.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis te /
translated: They are by way of intrinsic nature,

original: gzhan gyi dngos pos ni ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos pos ni ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: not by way of extrinsic nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgzhan gyi dngos dang mi ldan phyir //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gzhan gyi dngos dang mi ldan phyir //
translated: Why is this?üîΩBecause they do not possess extrinsic natures.

original: chos ni gzhan gyi dngos po dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos ni gzhan gyi dngos po dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Things do not possess extrinsic natures.

original: de lta bas na gang dang mi ldan pa de nyid kyis bsdus par yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang dang mi ldan pa de nyid kyis bsdus par yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible for something to be included in that in which it is not included.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang sna dag gnyis gnyis yod pa'i phyir khams nyi shu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang sna dag gnyis gnyis yod pa'i phyir khams nyi shu rtsa gcig tu 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Since there are two eyes, two ears, and two nostrils, shouldn‚Äôt there be twenty-one elements?

original: mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te /
translated: There should not be.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Why is this?

original: mig la sogs pa gnyis mod kyi //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa gnyis mod kyi //
translated: Although there are two eyes, etc.,

original: rigs dang spyod yul rnam par shes //
analyzed: rigs dang spyod yul rnam par shes //
translated: The elements are the same because of the similarity of their type, object, and consciousness.

original: 'dra ba'i phyir na khams gcig nyid ;
analyzed: 'dra ba'i phyir na khams gcig nyid ;
translated: The elements are the same because of the similarity of their type, object, and consciousness.

original: / de la rigs 'dra ba ni gnyis ka mig gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de la rigs 'dra ba ni gnyis ka mig gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The similarity of type is because both are of the nature of eye.

original: spyod yul 'dra ba ni gnyis ka'i yul gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod yul 'dra ba ni gnyis ka'i yul gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The similarity of object is because both have form as their object.

original: rnam par shes pa 'dra ba ni gnyis ka mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig gi rten yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'dra ba ni gnyis ka mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig gi rten yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The similarity of consciousness is because both are the basis of a single eye consciousness.

original: de lta bas na mig gi khams ni gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na mig gi khams ni gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the eye element is the same.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dag la yang sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dag la yang sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the ear and nose.

original: mdzes bya'i phyir na gnyis byung ngo //
analyzed: mdzes bya'i phyir na gnyis byung ngo //
translated: Two arise for the sake of beauty.

original: mig la sogs pa'i khams gcig pa nyid yin yang rten mdzes par bya pa'i phyir gnyis byung ngo //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i khams gcig pa nyid yin yang rten mdzes par bya pa'i phyir gnyis byung ngo //
translated: Even though the eye element is the same, two arise for the sake of the beauty of the support.

original: phung po dang / khams dang skye mched dag bshad zin to //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang skye mched dag bshad zin to //
translated: The aggregates, elements, and bases have been explained.

original: phung po dang / khams dang skye @100b mched kyi don gang yin pa 'dir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang skye @100b mched kyi don gang yin pa 'dir brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the meaning of the aggregates, elements, and bases should be stated here.

original: spungs dang skye sgo rigs kyi don //
analyzed: spungs dang skye sgo rigs kyi don //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù is a heap;üîΩthe meaning of ‚Äúbase‚Äù is a gateway;

original: phung po skye mched khams rnams yin //
analyzed: phung po skye mched khams rnams yin //
translated: the meaning of ‚Äúelement‚Äù is a lineage.

original: spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don to //
analyzed: spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúaggregate‚Äù is a heap.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba'i sgo'i don ni skye mched kyi don to //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba'i sgo'i don ni skye mched kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúbase‚Äù is a gateway for the arising of mind and mental factors.

original: rigs kyi don ni khams kyi don to//
analyzed: rigs kyi don ni khams kyi don to//
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúelement‚Äù is a lineage.

original: rigs kyang 'byung gnas so //
analyzed: rigs kyang 'byung gnas so //
translated: A lineage is also a source.

original: yang ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po la sogs pa'i sgo nas bstan pa rnam pa gsum rtsom par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po la sogs pa'i sgo nas bstan pa rnam pa gsum rtsom par mdzad ce na /
translated: Why did the BhagavƒÅn compose the three teachings of the aggregates and so on?

original: smras pa / gdul bya rnams kyi /üîΩrmongs dbang 'dod rnams gsum gyi phyir //
analyzed: smras pa / gdul bya rnams kyi / rmongs dbang 'dod rnams gsum gyi phyir //
translated: It is said:üîΩThe three teachings of the aggregates and so on

original: phung po la sogs gsum bstan to //
analyzed: phung po la sogs gsum bstan to //
translated: are for the three types of disciplesüîΩwho are confused, who have faculties, and who have desire.

original: sems can rnams kyi rmongs pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rmongs pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The confusion of sentient beings is of three types.

original: kha cig sems las byung ba rnams la ril po'i bdag tu 'dzin pas rmongs so //üîΩkha cig ni gzugs kho na la'o //
analyzed: kha cig sems las byung ba rnams la ril po'i bdag tu 'dzin pas rmongs so // kha cig ni gzugs kho na la'o //
translated: Some are confused because they apprehend the mental factors as a single whole self.üîΩSome are confused about form alone.

original: kha cig ni gzugs dang sems dag la'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs dang sems dag la'o //
translated: Some are confused about both form and mind.

original: dbang po dag kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dbang po dag kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The faculties are also threefold:

original: dbang po rnon po dang / 'bring dang / rtul po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po dang / 'bring dang / rtul po'i phyir ro //
translated: sharp, middling, and dull.

original: 'dod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Desire is also threefold:

original: bsdus pa dang / bar ma dang / rgya chen po 'dod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsdus pa dang / bar ma dang / rgya chen po 'dod pa'i phyir te /
translated: desire for the brief, middling, and extensive.

original: de dag la go rims bzhin du phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams gsum bstan te zhes grag go //
analyzed: de dag la go rims bzhin du phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams gsum bstan te zhes grag go //
translated: It is well known that the aggregates, bases, and elements are taught in order for those of sharp, middling, and dull faculties, respectively.

original: yang ci'i phyir na sems las byung ba gzhan rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung po gcig tu bsdus la 'du shes dang tshor ba dag ni logs shig tu phung por byas she na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir na sems las byung ba gzhan rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung po gcig tu bsdus la 'du shes dang tshor ba dag ni logs shig tu phung por byas she na /
translated: Why are other mental factors included in the aggregate of formation, but feeling and discernment are made into separate aggregates?

original: smras pa / rtsod pa'i rtsa bar gyur pa dang // 'khor ba'i rgyu phyir rim rgyu'i phyir /
analyzed: smras pa / rtsod pa'i rtsa bar gyur pa dang // 'khor ba'i rgyu phyir rim rgyu'i phyir /
translated: They are taught separately because they are the root of dispute,üîΩthe cause of cyclic existence, and the order of the aggregates.

original: sems byung rnams las tshor ba dang // 'du shes logs shig phung por gzhag / rtsod pa'i rtsa bdag ni gnyis te 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa dang / lta ba la lhag par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: sems byung rnams las tshor ba dang // 'du shes logs shig phung por gzhag / rtsod pa'i rtsa bdag ni gnyis te 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa dang / lta ba la lhag par zhen pa'o //
translated: The root of dispute is twofold: attachment to desire and attachment to views.

original: de gnyis kyi rgyu'i gtso bo ni go rims bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dag ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rgyu'i gtso bo ni go rims bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dag ste /
translated: The principal causes of these two are, respectively, sensation and ideation.

original: tshor ba'i ro myangs pa'i dbang gis ni 'dod pa rnams la mngon par zhen la /
analyzed: tshor ba'i ro myangs pa'i dbang gis ni 'dod pa rnams la mngon par zhen la /
translated: One becomes attached to the sense-desires through the power of savoring the taste of sensation.

original: 'du shes phyin ci log gi dbang gis ni lta ba rnams la ste /
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log gi dbang gis ni lta ba rnams la ste /
translated: One becomes attached to views through the power of erroneous ideation.

original: de gnyis ni 'khor ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni 'khor ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo yin te /
translated: These two are the principal causes of cyclic existence.

original: tshor ba la zhen cing 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni 'khor ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la zhen cing 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa ni 'khor ro //
translated: One cycles in existence through attachment to sensation and through erroneous ideation.

original: gang yang phung po'i go rims kyi rgyu ston par 'gyur ba'i go rims kyi rgyu de'i phyir yang 'di gnyis logs shig tu phung por byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang phung po'i go rims kyi rgyu ston par 'gyur ba'i go rims kyi rgyu de'i phyir yang 'di gnyis logs shig tu phung por byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that these two are distinguished as separate aggregates because they are the principal causes of the order of the aggregates, as will be explained.

original: @101a * // 'o na ci'i phyir skye mched dang khams dag tu ni 'dus ma byas bshad la /üîΩphung bo dag tu ni ma yin zhe na /üîΩphung po dag tu 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: @101a * // 'o na ci'i phyir skye mched dang khams dag tu ni 'dus ma byas bshad la / phung bo dag tu ni ma yin zhe na / phung po dag tu 'dus ma byas //
translated: Why is the unconditioned not explained as an aggregate?

original: don du mi rung phyir ma bshad //
analyzed: don du mi rung phyir ma bshad //
translated: The unconditioned is not mentioned as an aggregate because it serves no purpose as an aggregate.

original: de ni phung po dag gi nang du brjod pa na de ni gzugs ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ni phung po dag gi nang du brjod pa na de ni gzugs ma yin zhing /
translated: If it is said to be included among the aggregates, it is not form,

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang ma yin pas don du mi rung ba'i phyir re zhig de dag nyid kyi nang du bsdu bar ni mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang ma yin pas don du mi rung ba'i phyir re zhig de dag nyid kyi nang du bsdu bar ni mi nus so //
translated: and it is not consciousness, and so on. Therefore, since it is not suitable as an object, it cannot be included among the aggregates.

original: phung po drug par brjod par yang mi nus so //
analyzed: phung po drug par brjod par yang mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be said to be a sixth aggregate.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why not?

original: don du mi rung ba'i phyir te /üîΩspungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don to zhes bshad na 'dus ma byas ni gzugs bzhin du 'di ltar de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas 'dus ma byas kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro bar 'gyur ba 'das pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis
analyzed: don du mi rung ba'i phyir te / spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don to zhes bshad na 'dus ma byas ni gzugs bzhin du 'di ltar de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas 'dus ma byas kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro bar 'gyur ba 'das pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis
