translated: Because it is not suitable as an object.üîΩIf the meaning of aggregate is a heap, then like form, it would not be different in terms of the distinctions of past and future, and so on.

original: tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it would not be an unconditioned state.

original: rim ni rags dang kun nyon mongs //
analyzed: rim ni rags dang kun nyon mongs //
translated: The order is according to coarseness, affliction,

original: gnod sogs don khams ji bzhin no //
analyzed: gnod sogs don khams ji bzhin no //
translated: and according to the realms of meaning, harm, and so on.

original: gzugs ni thogs pa dang bcas phyir rags so //
analyzed: gzugs ni thogs pa dang bcas phyir rags so //
translated: Form is coarse because it is impeded.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi nad na yang tshor ba'i rgyu ba rags pa'i phyir te /üîΩ'di ltar nga'i lag pa la tshor ro //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams kyi nad na yang tshor ba'i rgyu ba rags pa'i phyir te / 'di ltar nga'i lag pa la tshor ro //
translated: The order of the members that are not form is in accordance with the grossness of the manifestation of feeling.

original: de'i rkang pa la tshor ro zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //üîΩ'du shes ni gnyis pas ches rags so //
analyzed: de'i rkang pa la tshor ro zhes tha snyad 'dogs so // 'du shes ni gnyis pas ches rags so //
translated: For example, it is said, ‚ÄúI feel in my hand,‚Äù or ‚ÄúI feel in my foot.‚ÄùüîΩAnd feeling is grosser than ideation, because of the grossness of the manifestation of the experience of pleasure, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa bas ni 'du byed de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bas ni 'du byed de /
translated: And the formative forces are grosser than consciousness, because of the grossness of the manifestation of the volitions.

original: de'i phyir gang ches rags pa de sngar bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang ches rags pa de sngar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, that which is grosser is explained first.

original: yang na thog ma med pa can 'khor ba na pho dang mo dag phan tshun gzugs la mngon par dga' ste /
analyzed: yang na thog ma med pa can 'khor ba na pho dang mo dag phan tshun gzugs la mngon par dga' ste /
translated: Alternatively, in beginningless samsara, men and women are mutually attracted to each other through their attachment to form.

original: de dag kyang tshor ba'i ro myang ba la chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang tshor ba'i ro myang ba la chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And this is due to their attachment to the experience of the taste of feeling.

original: de la chags pa yang 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la chags pa yang 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This attachment is due to the perversion of ideation.

original: phyin ci log de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dag gis so //
analyzed: phyin ci log de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dag gis so //
translated: And this perversion is due to the defilements.

original: sems kyang de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du byas pas de'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i go rims ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sems kyang de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du byas pas de'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i go rims ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: And the mind is defiled by them. Therefore, the order of the members is in accordance with the order of the defilements.

original: yang na snod la sogs pa'i don gyis te /
analyzed: yang na snod la sogs pa'i don gyis te /
translated: Or else, by the meaning of ‚Äúreceptacle‚Äù and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po ni snod dang / zas dang / tshod ma dang / byan po dang / za ba po lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po ni snod dang / zas dang / tshod ma dang / byan po dang / za ba po lta bu'o //
translated: The aggregates of form, etc., are like a receptacle, food, a cook, and one who eats.

original: yang na khams kyis te /
analyzed: yang na khams kyis te /
translated: Or else, by the realms.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan gzugs kyis rab tu phye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan gzugs kyis rab tu phye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: The realm of desire is distinguished by the object of desire, form.

original: tshor bas rab tu phye ba ni bsam gtan rnams so //
analyzed: tshor bas rab tu phye ba ni bsam gtan rnams so //
translated: The absorptions are distinguished by feeling.

original: 'du shes kyis rab tu phye ba ni gzugs med pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'du shes kyis rab tu phye ba ni gzugs med pa gsum mo //
translated: The three formless realms are distinguished by ideation.

original: 'du byed tsam gyis rab tu phye ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo ste /
analyzed: 'du byed tsam gyis rab tu phye ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo ste /
translated: The peak of existence is distinguished by the mere formative forces.

original: 'di dag ni rnam @101b par shes pa'i gnas pa yin la de dag la rnam par shes pa gnas so zhes phung po'i go rims zhing dang sa bon gyi go rims lta bur bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rnam @101b par shes pa'i gnas pa yin la de dag la rnam par shes pa gnas so zhes phung po'i go rims zhing dang sa bon gyi go rims lta bur bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These are the stations of consciousness, and consciousness resides in them. The order of the aggregates is taught to be like the order of a field and seeds.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phung po rnams ni lnga ste mi nyung mi mang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phung po rnams ni lnga ste mi nyung mi mang ngo //
translated: That is why the aggregates are five in number, neither more nor less.

original: rim pa'i rgyu de nyid kyi phyir tshor ba dang / 'du shes dag ni 'du byed rnams las logs shig tu phung por byas so //
analyzed: rim pa'i rgyu de nyid kyi phyir tshor ba dang / 'du shes dag ni 'du byed rnams las logs shig tu phung por byas so //
translated: Feeling and ideation are distinguished from the formations in order to show that they are the causes of the aggregates of sensation and of consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag ni ches rags pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag ni ches rags pa'o //
translated: They are the most gross among the formations.

original: mig la sogs pa'i khams dang skye mched drug gi go rims brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i khams dang skye mched drug gi go rims brjod par bya ste /
translated: The order of the six sense-spheres and the six consciousnesses is explained.

original: de'i dbang nyid kyis na de'i yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rim pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang nyid kyis na de'i yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rim pa'o //
translated: The order of the sense-spheres and of the consciousnesses is established according to the order of their controlling faculties.

original: drug po de dag las kyang /üîΩda lta'i don phyir dang pe lnga ;
analyzed: drug po de dag las kyang / da lta'i don phyir dang pe lnga ;
translated: Among the six sense-spheres,üîΩthe first five have present objects.

original: / mig la sogs pa lnga'i yul ni da ltar ba yin pa'i phyir sngar smos so //
analyzed: / mig la sogs pa lnga'i yul ni da ltar ba yin pa'i phyir sngar smos so //
translated: The first five sense-spheres, i.e., the eye sense-sphere, etc., have a present object-field, because their object-field is simultaneous with them.

original: 'byung ba las gyur don phyir bzhi //üîΩdang por zhes bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur don phyir bzhi // dang por zhes bya bar snyegs so //
translated: The first four have derived matter for their intrinsic nature.

original: lnga po rnams las kyang bzhi sngar smos pa ni yul 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lnga po rnams las kyang bzhi sngar smos pa ni yul 'byung ba las gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first four sense-spheres, i.e., the eye sense-sphere, etc., have derived matter for their intrinsic nature.

original: lus kyi yul ni ma nges te /
analyzed: lus kyi yul ni ma nges te /
translated: The object-field of the body is not determined.

original: res 'ga' ni 'byung ba dag yin la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni 'byung ba dag yin la /
translated: Sometimes it is the four great elements, i.e., the tangible.

original: res 'ga' ni 'byung ba las gyur bdag yin no //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni 'byung ba las gyur bdag yin no //
translated: Sometimes, the self is derived from the primary elements.

original: res 'ga' ni gnyis ka yin no //üîΩgzhan ni ches ring myur 'jug phyir //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gnyis ka yin no // gzhan ni ches ring myur 'jug phyir //
translated: Sometimes, the self is both.üîΩThe other sensefaculties are mentioned in the order in which they are encountered when one goes far away from the body and then returns to it.

original: lhag ma ni ci rigs par ches rgyang ring ba dang / myur bar 'jug pas gzhan pas sngar smos te /
analyzed: lhag ma ni ci rigs par ches rgyang ring ba dang / myur bar 'jug pas gzhan pas sngar smos te /
translated: The other sensefaculties are mentioned in the order in which they are encountered when one goes far away from the body and then returns to it.

original: mig dang rna ba ni yul rgyang ring ba'i phyir gnyis pas de dag sngar smos so //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba ni yul rgyang ring ba'i phyir gnyis pas de dag sngar smos so //
translated: The eye and ear sensefaculties are mentioned first because their objects are at a distance.

original: de gnyis las kyang mig ni ches rgyang ring po la 'jug pa de'i phyir de sngar smos so //
analyzed: de gnyis las kyang mig ni ches rgyang ring po la 'jug pa de'i phyir de sngar smos so //
translated: Among these two, the eye sensefaculty is mentioned first because its object is very distant.

original: sna dang lce ni rgyang ring po la 'jug pa med mod kyi de nyid las kyang sna ni ches myur bar 'jug pa'i phyir sngar smos so //
analyzed: sna dang lce ni rgyang ring po la 'jug pa med mod kyi de nyid las kyang sna ni ches myur bar 'jug pa'i phyir sngar smos so //
translated: The nose and tongue sensefaculties are not at a distance from the body, but the nose sensefaculty is mentioned first because its object is encountered sooner.

original: yang na ji ltar gnas rim bzhin //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar gnas rim bzhin //
translated: Or else, in the order in which they are sheltered.

original: yang na lus 'di la mig gi rten ni steng na gnas so //üîΩde'i 'og na ni rna ba'i'o //üîΩde'i 'og na ni sna'i'o //
analyzed: yang na lus 'di la mig gi rten ni steng na gnas so // de'i 'og na ni rna ba'i'o // de'i 'og na ni sna'i'o //
translated: The eye sensefaculty is the highest, i.e., the most elevated, because it is located in the eyes which are at the top of the face.üîΩThe ear sensefaculty is higher than the nose sensefaculty.

original: de nas ni lce'i'o //
analyzed: de nas ni lce'i'o //
translated: The nose sensefaculty is higher than the tongue sensefaculty.

original: lus kyi ni phal cher de'i 'og na'o //
analyzed: lus kyi ni phal cher de'i 'og na'o //
translated: The body sensefaculty is lower than the tongue sensefaculty, for it is located in the body and in the limbs.

original: yid ni de dag la brten pa dang yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yid ni de dag la brten pa dang yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: but is based on those sense faculties.

original: de dag gi go rims ni ji ltar gnas pa bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi go rims ni ji ltar gnas pa bzhin yin no //
translated: The order of the sense faculties is in accordance with their coarseness.üîΩWhy is one of the ten sense bases that subsume the form aggregate called the form sense base?

original: yang ci'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po bsdus pa'i skye ma ched bcu po dag las gcig gzugs kyi skye mched du brjod la /üîΩthams cad kyang chos kyi rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gzugs kyi phung po bsdus pa'i skye ma ched bcu po dag las gcig gzugs kyi skye mched du brjod la / thams cad kyang chos kyi rang bzhin yin na /
translated: And why is one of the five sense bases that subsume the form aggregate called the form sense base?

original: gcig chos kyi skye mched ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: gcig chos kyi skye mched ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why is one of the five sense bases that subsume the form aggregate called the form sense base?

original: smras pa / bye brag don dang gtso bo'i phyir //
analyzed: smras pa / bye brag don dang gtso bo'i phyir //
translated: Because it is the object of the eye and because it is the most important,

original: chos mang ba dang mchog bsdus phyir //
analyzed: chos mang ba dang mchog bsdus phyir //
translated: because it subsumes many forms and because it is the best,üîΩone is called the form sense base

original: @102a * // gcig ni gzugs kyi skye mched dang // gcig ni chos zhes bya bar brjod //
analyzed: @102a * // gcig ni gzugs kyi skye mched dang // gcig ni chos zhes bya bar brjod //
translated: and one is called the phenomena sense base.

original: bye brag gi don ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bye brag gi don ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the word specific?

original: ci nas kyang yul dang yul can nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas bcu po 'di dag so sor skye mched nyid yin gyi spyir ni ma yin no zhes rtogs par bya ba yin mig la sogs pa bye brag tu byas pa dag gis ni gang migüîΩla sogs par ni ming ma btags la /
analyzed: ci nas kyang yul dang yul can nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo nas bcu po 'di dag so sor skye mched nyid yin gyi spyir ni ma yin no zhes rtogs par bya ba yin mig la sogs pa bye brag tu byas pa dag gis ni gang mig la sogs par ni ming ma btags la /
translated: The eye and so on are specified because the form base is not named after the eye and so on.

original: gzugs ni yin pa de gzugs kyi skye mched du shes par rung bas 'di'i ming gzhan ma brjod do //üîΩyang gzugs kyi skye mched ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs ni yin pa de gzugs kyi skye mched du shes par rung bas 'di'i ming gzhan ma brjod do // yang gzugs kyi skye mched ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is suitable to know that the form base is the form base because it is form.üîΩAlso, the form base is primary because it is suitable to be touched by contact with the hand and so on, since it is impeded.

original: de ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis reg na gzugs su rung ba dang / bstan du rung ba'i phyir te /üîΩ'di ni 'di na'o //
analyzed: de ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir lag pa la sogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis reg na gzugs su rung ba dang / bstan du rung ba'i phyir te / 'di ni 'di na'o //
translated: It is suitable to be demonstrated because it is suitable to be analyzed as this or that.

original: che ge mo zhig na'o zhes brtag tu rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: che ge mo zhig na'o zhes brtag tu rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is suitable to be analyzed as here or there.

original: bye brag gi don nyid kyis gcig ni chos kyi skye mched du bshad kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bye brag gi don nyid kyis gcig ni chos kyi skye mched du bshad kyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: One is explained as the phenomena base due to its specific meaning, not all.

original: gzhan yang 'dir tshor ba la sogs pa chos mang po rnams bsdus te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dir tshor ba la sogs pa chos mang po rnams bsdus te /
translated: Moreover, many dharmas are included in this aggregate of dharma, such as feeling.

original: de'i phyir chos kyi sgra spyir rjod par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi sgra spyir rjod par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the word dharma is used in a general sense.

original: chos kyi mchog mya ngan las 'das pa yang 'dir bsdus te gzhan dag tu ma yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog mya ngan las 'das pa yang 'dir bsdus te gzhan dag tu ma yin no //
translated: The supreme dharma, nirvana, is included here, but not in the others.

original: mdo dag las /
analyzed: mdo dag las /
translated: In the sutras,

original: phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams shes par bya ba gzhan dag kyang dmigs na /
analyzed: phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams shes par bya ba gzhan dag kyang dmigs na /
translated: other topics are also mentioned, such as the aggregates, bases, and elements.

original: ci de rnams 'di dag nyid kyis bsdus sam /üîΩ'on te tha dad pa zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci de rnams 'di dag nyid kyis bsdus sam / 'on te tha dad pa zhig yin zhe na /
translated: Are they included in these aggregates or are they separate?

original: 'di dag nyid kyis bsdus kyi tha dad pa ni med de /
analyzed: 'di dag nyid kyis bsdus kyi tha dad pa ni med de /
translated: They are included in these aggregates, but they are not separate.üîΩThe eighty thousand aggregates of dharma

original: de la re zhig / chos kyi phung po brgyad khri dag / gang rnams thub pas gsungs de dag / tshig gam ming yin de dag ni //
analyzed: de la re zhig / chos kyi phung po brgyad khri dag / gang rnams thub pas gsungs de dag / tshig gam ming yin de dag ni //
translated: that the Sage taught are either words or names

original: gzugs dang 'du byed dag tu 'dus //
analyzed: gzugs dang 'du byed dag tu 'dus //
translated: and are included in the form aggregate or the formation aggregate.

original: gang dag gi ltar na sangs rgyas kyi gsung tshig gi rang bzhin yin pa de dag gi ltar na de dag ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus so //
analyzed: gang dag gi ltar na sangs rgyas kyi gsung tshig gi rang bzhin yin pa de dag gi ltar na de dag ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus so //
translated: Those who believe that the Buddha‚Äôs words are by nature speech include them in the form aggregate.

original: gang dag gi ltar na ming gi rang bzhin yin pa de dag gi ltar na ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus so //
analyzed: gang dag gi ltar na ming gi rang bzhin yin pa de dag gi ltar na ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus so //
translated: According to those who maintain that the aggregates are by nature name, the aggregates are included in the aggregate of formations.

original: yang chos kyi phung po'i tshad ni ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: yang chos kyi phung po'i tshad ni ji tsam zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of a collection of dharmas?

original: kha cig bstan bcos tshad ces zer /
analyzed: kha cig bstan bcos tshad ces zer /
translated: Some say: The measure of a treatise.

original: kha cig na re de ni chos kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i chos mngon pa'i tshad tsam mo zhes zer te /
analyzed: kha cig na re de ni chos kyi phung po zhes bya ba'i chos mngon pa'i tshad tsam mo zhes zer te /
translated: Others say: The measure of the Abhidharma called a collection of dharmas.

original: de ni shlo ka drug stong ngo //
analyzed: de ni shlo ka drug stong ngo //
translated: That is six thousand ≈ölokas.

original: yang gzhan dag na re /üîΩphung po la sogs pa gtam re yin zhes zer te /
analyzed: yang gzhan dag na re / phung po la sogs pa gtam re yin zhes zer te /
translated: Others say:üîΩEach topic is a collection of dharmas.üîΩEach topic such as the aggregates, sense bases, elements, dependent origination, etc. is a collection of dharmas.

original: phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel @102b bar 'byung ba la sogs pa'i gtam rgyud re re ni chos kyi phung po'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel @102b bar 'byung ba la sogs pa'i gtam rgyud re re ni chos kyi phung po'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The collections of dharmas were taught

original: spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen por ni //üîΩchos kyi phung po mthun par gsungs //
analyzed: spyod pa rnams kyi gnyen por ni //üîΩchos kyi phung po mthun par gsungs //
translated: as antidotes to the conduct of beings.

original: 'di skad du sems can rnams kyi spyod pa 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal la sogs pa spyod pa tha dad pa brgyad khri yod de /
analyzed: 'di skad du sems can rnams kyi spyod pa 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal la sogs pa spyod pa tha dad pa brgyad khri yod de /
translated: It is said that the eighty-four thousand types of conduct of sentient beings are conduct that is dominated by attachment, aversion, delusion, pride, and so on.

original: de dag gi gnyen por chos kyi phung po brgyad khri gsungs so zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen por chos kyi phung po brgyad khri gsungs so zhes brjod do //
translated: The antidote to these is said to be the eighty-four thousand aggregates of the Dharma.

original: de ltar chos kyi phung po brgyad khri phung po 'di dag nyid du bsdus pa /
analyzed: de ltar chos kyi phung po brgyad khri phung po 'di dag nyid du bsdus pa /
translated: Thus the eighty-four thousand aggregates of the Dharma are included in these five aggregates.

original: de bzhin gzhan yang ci rigs par //
analyzed: de bzhin gzhan yang ci rigs par //
translated: In the same way, the other aggregates, sense bases, and elements

original: phung po skye mched khams rnams ni //
analyzed: phung po skye mched khams rnams ni //
translated: are included in the aggregates, sense bases, and elementsüîΩas is appropriate.üîΩThe aggregates, sense bases, and elements

original: rang gi mtshan nyid legs dpyad de //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid legs dpyad de //
translated: should be well analyzed according to their characteristicsüîΩand included in the aggregates, sense bases, and elements

original: ji skad bshad par bsdu bar bya //
analyzed: ji skad bshad par bsdu bar bya //
translated: as they are explained.

original: mdo gzhan dag las /
analyzed: mdo gzhan dag las /
translated: In other s≈´tras, the aggregates, sense bases, and elements are explained in many different ways.

original: phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams gzhan gang dag gsungs pa de dag kyang bstan bcos 'di las ji skad bshad pa bzhin de dag gi rang rang gi mtshan nyid legs par dpyad nas phung po la sogs pa 'di skad bshad pa 'di dag nyid du bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams gzhan gang dag gsungs pa de dag kyang bstan bcos 'di las ji skad bshad pa bzhin de dag gi rang rang gi mtshan nyid legs par dpyad nas phung po la sogs pa 'di skad bshad pa 'di dag nyid du bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: The other aggregates, bases, and elements that are taught should be included in these aggregates, etc., as they are explained in this treatise, after their individual characteristics have been properly investigated.

original: de la re zhig tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po dag las tshul khrims kyi phung po ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus so //
analyzed: de la re zhig tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po dag las tshul khrims kyi phung po ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus so //
translated: Among the aggregates of morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the knowledge and vision of liberation, the aggregate of morality is included in the aggregate of form.

original: lhag ma rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung pos bsdus so //
translated: The remaining aggregates are included in the aggregate of formations.

original: zad par gyi skye mched bcu po dag las brgyad ni ma chags pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched bcu po dag las brgyad ni ma chags pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus so //
translated: Among the ten totalities, eight are included in the sense base of mental objects, because they are by nature non-greed.

original: 'khor rnams dang bcas na ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag gis bsdus te /
analyzed: 'khor rnams dang bcas na ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag gis bsdus te /
translated: If they are considered together with their retinue, they are included in the mental faculty and the entity basis, because they have the nature of the five aggregates.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dag kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched dag kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The bases of subjugation are also like that.

original: zad par nam mkha' dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dag dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa bzhi po dag ni phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag gis bsdus so //
analyzed: zad par nam mkha' dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dag dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa bzhi po dag ni phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag gis bsdus so //
translated: The bases of totality, the bases of infinite space and infinite consciousness, and the four such as the base of infinite space are included in the mental faculty and the entity basis, because they have the nature of four aggregates.

original: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched lnga po dag ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i skye mched lnga po dag ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir chos kyi skye mched kyis bsdus so //
translated: The five bases of liberation are included in the entity basis, because they have the nature of wisdom.

original: 'khor rnams dang bcas na ni sgra dang yid dang chos kyi skye mched rnams kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: 'khor rnams dang bcas na ni sgra dang yid dang chos kyi skye mched rnams kyis bsdus so //
translated: If they are considered together with their retinue, they are included in the sound, mental faculty, and entity bases.

original: skye mched gnyis las 'du shes med pa'i sems can ni dri dang ro'i skye mched med pa'i phyir skye mched bcu po @103a * //üîΩrnams kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: skye mched gnyis las 'du shes med pa'i sems can ni dri dang ro'i skye mched med pa'i phyir skye mched bcu po @103a * // rnams kyis bsdus so //
translated: Beings without ideation are included in the ten sense-spheres, because they do not have the sense-spheres of odor and taste.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba ni yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag gis bsdus so //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du nye bar 'gro ba ni yid dang chos kyi skye mched dag gis bsdus so //
translated: Beings in the perception-sphere of neither ideation nor non-ideation are included in the sense-spheres of the mental faculty and of factors.

original: khams mang po pa las gang dag sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug bstan pa la /üîΩde dag las gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ma bshad na de ci nam mkha'i nyid nam mkha'i khams yin pa'am /
analyzed: khams mang po pa las gang dag sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug bstan pa la / de dag las gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ma bshad na de ci nam mkha'i nyid nam mkha'i khams yin pa'am /
translated: In the BahudhƒÅtuka S≈´tra, six elements are taught: the earth element, the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element.

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa'i khams yin par rig par bya'am zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa'i khams yin par rig par bya'am zhe na /
translated: If the characteristics of two of them are not explained, should space be understood as the space element, and all consciousness as the consciousness element?

original: smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma yin no //
translated: No, they should not be understood in this way.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: sgo dang / skar khung dang / kha dang sna la sogs pa'i bu ga nam mkha'i khams zhes bya /
analyzed: sgo dang / skar khung dang / kha dang sna la sogs pa'i bu ga nam mkha'i khams zhes bya /
translated: The cavities of the eyes, ears, nostrils, mouth, etc., are called the space element.

original: bu ga zhes bya ba ci zhig yin par rig par bya zhe na /üîΩsnang dag mun pa dag yin lo //
analyzed: bu ga zhes bya ba ci zhig yin par rig par bya zhe na / snang dag mun pa dag yin lo //
translated: What is the nature of the cavities?üîΩLight and darkness.

original: bu ga ni snang ba dang / mun pa dag las gzhan gzung du med do //
analyzed: bu ga ni snang ba dang / mun pa dag las gzhan gzung du med do //
translated: The cavities are not perceived as being different from light and darkness.

original: de lta bas na nam mkha'i khams ni snang ba dang mun pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na nam mkha'i khams ni snang ba dang mun pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Thus the space element has the nature of light and darkness.

original: mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i rang bzhin yin par rig par bya'o zhes grag go //üîΩzag dang bcas pa'i rnam shes ni //
analyzed: mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i rang bzhin yin par rig par bya'o zhes grag go // zag dang bcas pa'i rnam shes ni //
translated: It is known as having the nature of night and day.üîΩThe consciousness element is the six consciousnesses.

original: rnam shes khams yin /
analyzed: rnam shes khams yin /
translated: The consciousness element is the six consciousnesses.

original: ci'i phyir zag pa med pa la mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zag pa med pa la mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the uncontaminated not considered to be an element?

original: 'di ltar khams drug po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar khams drug po 'di dag ni /
translated: Because these six elements

original: skye ba'i rten yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: skye ba'i rten yin par 'dod de /
translated: are considered to be the basis of birth.

original: de dag ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems nas 'chi ba'i sems kyi bar du skye ba'i gzhir gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems nas 'chi ba'i sems kyi bar du skye ba'i gzhir gyur pa ste /
translated: They are the basis of birth from the moment of conception until death.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: The uncontaminated dharmas are not like that.

original: de'i phyir / de ltar na de dag las khams bzhi ni reg bya'i khams kyi nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de ltar na de dag las khams bzhi ni reg bya'i khams kyi nang du 'dus so //
translated: Thus, among the eighteen elements, four are included in the tangible-object element.

original: lnga pa ni gzugs kyi khams kyi nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: lnga pa ni gzugs kyi khams kyi nang du 'dus so //
translated: The fifth is included in the form element.

original: drug pa ni rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun po dag tu 'dus so //üîΩgang dag khams bco brgyad bstan pa de dag las bstan du yod pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: drug pa ni rnam par shes pa'i khams bdun po dag tu 'dus so // gang dag khams bco brgyad bstan pa de dag las bstan du yod pa rnams ni du /
translated: The sixth is included in the seven consciousness elements.

original: bstan du med pa rnams ni du zhe na /üîΩbstan yod 'dir ni gzugs gcig pu //üîΩde ni 'di ni 'di na'o //
analyzed: bstan du med pa rnams ni du zhe na / bstan yod 'dir ni gzugs gcig pu // de ni 'di ni 'di na'o //
translated: Among the eighteen elements that have been presented, how many are visible and how many are not visible?üîΩHow many are resistant and how many are nonresistant?üîΩOnly form is visible.üîΩIt can be indicated as being here or there,

original: che ge mo zhig go zhes bstan par nus so //
analyzed: che ge mo zhig go zhes bstan par nus so //
translated: as being of such and such a size.

original: lhag ma rnams ni bstan du med pa'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //üîΩthogs pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni bstan du med pa'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro // thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
translated: The remaining elements are not visible.

original: thogs pa med pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are resistant and how many are nonresistant?

original: thogs dang bcas pa gzugs can bcu //
analyzed: thogs dang bcas pa gzugs can bcu //
translated: Ten are resistant.

original: gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i khams bcu gang dag bshad @103b pa de dag ni sgrib pa la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa'i khams bcu gang dag bshad @103b pa de dag ni sgrib pa la thogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams so //
translated: The ten elements that are included in the aggregate of form are resistant because they are impeded by resistance.

original: lung ma bstan brgyad de dag nyid //
analyzed: lung ma bstan brgyad de dag nyid //
translated: Eight are neutral.

original: gzugs sgra ma gtogs dbang po lnga po rnams dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i khams rnams te brgyad po de dag ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngo bor lung bstan du med pa'i phyir lung ma bstan dag go //
analyzed: gzugs sgra ma gtogs dbang po lnga po rnams dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i khams rnams te brgyad po de dag ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngo bor lung bstan du med pa'i phyir lung ma bstan dag go //
translated: The five sense faculties, the element of visible form, the element of sound, and the element of smell, taste, and touch, which are eight in all, are neutral because they are not declared to be either virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: gzhan rnam gsum /
analyzed: gzhan rnam gsum /
translated: The others are of three kinds.

original: sems kyi khams bdun ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni dge ba yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi khams bdun ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni dge ba yin no //
translated: The seven mental elements are virtuous when they are concomitant with nonattachment and so on.

original: chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni mi dge ba yin no //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag ni mi dge ba yin no //
translated: They are nonvirtuous when they are concomitant with attachment and so on.

original: gzhan dag lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The others are neutral.

original: chos kyi khams ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas bslang ba dang / so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi khams ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas bslang ba dang / so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni dge ba'o //
translated: The element of factors is wholesome when it is by nature non-greed, etc., or associated with non-greed, etc., or it is the cessation due to deliberation.

original: chags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas bslang ba ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / kun nas bslang ba ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: It is unwholesome when it is by nature greed, etc., or associated with greed, etc., or it is the continuation of the unwholesome.

original: gzhan ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The other factors are indeterminate.

original: gzugs dang sgra'i khams ni lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis bsdus pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba dag ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag go //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra'i khams ni lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis bsdus pa dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis kun nas bslang ba dag ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag go //
translated: The elements of form and sound are wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate, according to the wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate nature of the informative action of body and voice by which they are produced.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa dag ni du zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa dag ni du zhe na /
translated: How many elements are included in the realm of desire?

original: 'dod khams gtogs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: 'dod khams gtogs pa thams cad do //
translated: All are included in the realm of desire.

original: gtogs pa ni ma bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtogs pa ni ma bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIncluded‚Äù means not separated from.

original: gzugs kyi khams na bcu bzhi ste //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na bcu bzhi ste //
translated: In the realm of form, there are fourteen.

original: dri dang ro dang sna dang ni //
analyzed: dri dang ro dang sna dang ni //
translated: The elements of odor and taste, and the two, nose and tongue,

original: lce yi rnam shes khams ma gtogs //
analyzed: lce yi rnam shes khams ma gtogs //
translated: The element of the tongue consciousness is excluded.

original: de na dri dang ro dag med de /
analyzed: de na dri dang ro dag med de /
translated: There is no smell or taste there,

original: gnyis ni khams kyi zas yin pa'i phyir yin la /
analyzed: gnyis ni khams kyi zas yin pa'i phyir yin la /
translated: because these two are the food of the elements.

original: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang der skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang der skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And those who are free from attachment to them are born there.

original: de lta bas na dmigs pa med pa'i phyir sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa dag kyang med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dmigs pa med pa'i phyir sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa dag kyang med do //
translated: Therefore, the nose and tongue consciousnesses do not exist there, because their objects do not exist.

original: gzugs med rtogs pa yid dang ni //
analyzed: gzugs med rtogs pa yid dang ni //
translated: The formless are realized by the mental faculty,

original: chos dang yid kyi rnam shes khams //
analyzed: chos dang yid kyi rnam shes khams //
translated: the element of mental objects, and the element of mental consciousness.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams der skyes te /üîΩde'i phyir gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi khams bcu dang / de dag la brten pa dang / dmigs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yang med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams der skyes te / de'i phyir gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi khams bcu dang / de dag la brten pa dang / dmigs pa rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yang med do //
translated: Those who are free from attachment to form are born there.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
translated: Therefore, the ten elements that have form, the five consciousnesses that have form as their object, and the five consciousnesses that have form as their basis do not exist there.üîΩHow many elements are impure?

original: zag pa med pa rnams ni du zhe na //
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams ni du zhe na //
translated: How many are pure?

original: yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes @104a * //
analyzed: yid dang chos dang yid kyi rnam par shes @104a * //
translated: The mental faculty, mental objects, and the mental consciousness

original: pa'i chos gang dag bshad pa /
analyzed: pa'i chos gang dag bshad pa /
translated: are the three that were explained.

original: de gsum zag bcas zag pa med //
analyzed: de gsum zag bcas zag pa med //
translated: These three are both impure and pure.

original: gang dag lam gyi bden pa dang 'dus ma byas kyis bsdus pa de dag ni zag pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag lam gyi bden pa dang 'dus ma byas kyis bsdus pa de dag ni zag pa med pa yin no //
translated: The factors included in the truth of the path and in the unconditioned are free from fluxes.

original: lhag ma dag ni zag bcas so //
analyzed: lhag ma dag ni zag bcas so //
translated: The other factors are with fluxes.

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /üîΩrtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam dag ni du /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam dag ni du /
translated: How many factors are with initial inquiry and with investigation?üîΩHow many are without initial inquiry but with investigation?

original: rtog pa yang med pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa yang med pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are without initial inquiry and without investigation?

original: rtog dang dpyod dang bcas pa ni /
analyzed: rtog dang dpyod dang bcas pa ni /
translated: Those that are with initial inquiry and with investigation are

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yin //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga yin //
translated: the five sense consciousnesses.

original: 'di dag ni khams rtag tu rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni khams rtag tu rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
translated: These five sense consciousnesses are always associated with initial inquiry and with investigation.

original: tha ma gsum ni rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: tha ma gsum ni rnam gsum mo //
translated: The last three are of three types.

original: de la yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag las gzhan pa chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa dag 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po na ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de la yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag las gzhan pa chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa dag 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po na ni rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dag yin no //
translated: The mental faculty, the mental consciousness and the factors associated with the mental faculty, with the exception of initial inquiry and investigation, are with initial inquiry and with investigation in the realm of desire and in the first meditation.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can na ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam dag yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can na ni rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam dag yin no //
translated: In the special meditative attainment of the second meditation, there is only investigation, not analysis.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa nas bzung ste srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi dang / chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa thams cad dang / bsam gtan khyad par can gyi dpyod pa ni rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa nas bzung ste srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi dang / chos kyi khams mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa thams cad dang / bsam gtan khyad par can gyi dpyod pa ni rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa dag yin no //
translated: In the second meditation and above up to the summit of cyclic existence, in the part of the element of mental objects that is not associated with thought, and in the investigation of the special meditative attainment, there is neither investigation nor analysis.

original: rtog pa ni rtog pa gnyis pa yang med pa'i phyir dang / dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rtog tu rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa ni rtog pa gnyis pa yang med pa'i phyir dang / dpyod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rtog tu rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam yin no //
translated: In the special meditative attainment, there is no investigation because there is no second investigation, and there is only analysis because it is associated with analysis.

original: lhag ma rnams ni gnyis ka spangs //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gnyis ka spangs //
translated: The rest are devoid of both.

original: lhag ma ni gzugs can gyi khams bcu po dag ste /
analyzed: lhag ma ni gzugs can gyi khams bcu po dag ste /
translated: The rest are the ten physical elements.

original: de dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir rtag tu rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir rtag tu rtog pa yang med la dpyod pa yang med pa dag yin no //
translated: They are always devoid of both investigation and analysis, because they are not associated with thought.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po rnams rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa dag yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga po rnams rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa dag yin na /
translated: If the five sensory consciousnesses are associated with vitarka and vicƒÅra,

original: ji ltar na rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces bya zhe na /üîΩnges par rtog dang rjes dran pa'i //
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces bya zhe na / nges par rtog dang rjes dran pa'i //
translated: how can they be called non-discursive?üîΩThey are non-discursive because of the non-discursive nature of the conceptualizations of determination and memory.

original: rnam par rtog pas rnam mi rtog / rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gsum mo zhes grag ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas rnam mi rtog / rnam par rtog pa ni rnam pa gsum mo zhes grag ste /
translated: It is well known that conceptualization is of three types:

original: ngo bo nyid dang res par rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang res par rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: conceptualization of essential nature, conceptualization of determination, and conceptualization of memory.

original: de bas na de dag la ngo bo nyid kyis rtog pa ni yod kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de dag la ngo bo nyid kyis rtog pa ni yod kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the five sensory consciousnesses have conceptualization of essential nature, but not the other two.

original: de bas na rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na rnam par rtog pa med pa dag ces bya ste /
translated: They are called non-discursive because of the absence of the other two types of conceptualization.

original: dper na rta rkang pa gcig pa la rkang med ces bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rta rkang pa gcig pa la rkang med ces bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, a horse with one leg is called legless.

original: yang @104b sems kyi rang bzhin ngo bo nyid dang / rjes su dran pa'i rtog pa dag / de dag yid kyi shes rab g-yeng //
analyzed: yang @104b sems kyi rang bzhin ngo bo nyid dang / rjes su dran pa'i rtog pa dag / de dag yid kyi shes rab g-yeng //
translated: Moreover, the conceptualizations of essential nature and memory are distractions of mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi dran pa thams cad nyid //
analyzed: yid kyi dran pa thams cad nyid //
translated: All memories are of mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ni yid kyi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab ni yid kyi zhes bya'o //
translated: The discernment associated with mental consciousness is called mental discernment.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa ni g-yeng ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa ni g-yeng ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Non-concentrated is called distracted.

original: de ni nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog ba'o //
analyzed: de ni nges par rtog pa'i rnam par rtog ba'o //
translated: This is the discernment of investigation.

original: yid kyi dran pa nyid mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i dran pa thams cad ni rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi dran pa nyid mnyam par gzhag pa dang mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i dran pa thams cad ni rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin no //
translated: All memory, whether concentrated or not, is the discernment of recollection.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many have an object?

original: dmigs pa med pa rnams ni du zhe na /üîΩdmigs bcas sems kyi khams bdun no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa rnams ni du zhe na / dmigs bcas sems kyi khams bdun no //
translated: How many do not have an object?üîΩThe seven elements of consciousness have an object.

original: sems kyi khams bdun po de dag ni yul 'dzin pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: sems kyi khams bdun po de dag ni yul 'dzin pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: The seven elements of consciousness have an object, because they grasp an object-field.

original: chos kyi phyed kyang /
analyzed: chos kyi phyed kyang /
translated: The other half of the element of mental objects.

original: gang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin chos kyi khams de ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gang sems las byung ba'i rang bzhin chos kyi khams de ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The part of the element of mental objects which is thought-concomitant has an object.

original: lhag ma gzugs can gyi khams bcu po dag dang chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig ldan pa ma yin pa ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya bar grub po //üîΩzin pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: lhag ma gzugs can gyi khams bcu po dag dang chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig ldan pa ma yin pa ni dmigs pa med pa zhes bya bar grub po // zin pa rnams ni du /
translated: The remaining ten elements which are material form and one part of the element of factors are not appropriated.üîΩHow many elements are appropriated?

original: ma zin pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: ma zin pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are not appropriated?

original: ma zin dgu /üîΩbrgyad po de dag rnams dang sgra //
analyzed: ma zin dgu / brgyad po de dag rnams dang sgra //
translated: Nine are not appropriated.

original: sems kyi khams bdun dang chos kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams rnams ni ma zin pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi khams bdun dang chos kyi khams dang / sgra'i khams rnams ni ma zin pa'o //
translated: The eight elements of consciousness and the element of factors are not appropriated.

original: dgu po gzhan ni rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: dgu po gzhan ni rnam pa gnyis //
translated: The other nine are of two kinds.

original: zin pa dag kyang yin ma zin pa dag kyang yin te /
analyzed: zin pa dag kyang yin ma zin pa dag kyang yin te /
translated: They are either appropriated or not appropriated.

original: de la mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus da ltar byung ba rnams ni zin pa yin no //
analyzed: de la mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus da ltar byung ba rnams ni zin pa yin no //
translated: The eye, ear, nose, tongue and body of the present are appropriated.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams ni ma zin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rnams ni ma zin pa yin no //
translated: The past and future are not appropriated.

original: gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i khams da ltar byung ba dbang po dang tha mi dad pa rnams ni zin pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i khams da ltar byung ba dbang po dang tha mi dad pa rnams ni zin pa yin no //
translated: The elements of form, smell, taste and the tangible of the present which are not distinct from the faculties are appropriated.

original: gzhan dag ni ma zin pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma zin pa rnams so //
translated: The others are not appropriated.

original: zin pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: zin pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term ‚Äúconjoined‚Äù?

original: phan pa dang gnod pa dag gis phan tshun mthun par byed pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi rten gyi dngos por nye bar bzung ba ste /
analyzed: phan pa dang gnod pa dag gis phan tshun mthun par byed pa'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi rten gyi dngos por nye bar bzung ba ste /
translated: The conjoined are so called because they are mutually supportive in the sense that they benefit or injure one another.

original: 'jig rten na sems pa dang bcas pa zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩ'byung ba'i rang bzhin du /
analyzed: 'jig rten na sems pa dang bcas pa zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o // 'byung ba'i rang bzhin du /
translated: They are the basis for the mind and mental factors, and they are called ‚Äúendowed with mind‚Äù in the world.üîΩThe primary elements are the cause of the derivative form.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa du yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa du yin zhe na /
translated: How many of the elements are derivative form?

original: reg bya rnam pa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: reg bya rnam pa gnyis yin te /
translated: There are two types of tactility:

original: 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
translated: primary elements and derivative form.

original: de la 'byung ba dag ni bzhi'o //üîΩ'byung ba las gyur pa ni 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa 'byung ba dag @105a * //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba dag ni bzhi'o // 'byung ba las gyur pa ni 'jam pa nyid la sogs pa 'byung ba dag @105a * //
translated: The primary elements are the four primary elements.üîΩThe derivative form of tactility is smoothness, roughness,

original: las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: etc., because they arise from the primary elements.

original: lhag ma gzugs can dgu po ni 'byung gyur te /
analyzed: lhag ma gzugs can dgu po ni 'byung gyur te /
translated: The remaining nine that have form are derivative form.

original: dbang po lnga'i khams dag dang yul bzhi'o //üîΩchos khams phyogs gcig kyang /
analyzed: dbang po lnga'i khams dag dang yul bzhi'o // chos khams phyogs gcig kyang /
translated: The five sense faculties and the four sense objects.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa ste /
translated: One part of the element of mental objects is also derivative form.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called nonindicative form.

original: lhag ma rnams ni gnyis ka ma yin pa'o //üîΩbsags pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gnyis ka ma yin pa'o // bsags pa rnams ni du /
translated: The other elements are neither.üîΩHow many elements are aggregated?

original: bsags pa ma yin pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: bsags pa ma yin pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are non-aggregated?

original: gzugs can bcu ni bsags pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can bcu ni bsags pa'o //
translated: Ten are aggregated.

original: dbang po'i khams lnga dang yul lnga dag ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir bsags pa dag go //
analyzed: dbang po'i khams lnga dang yul lnga dag ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir bsags pa dag go //
translated: The five sense faculties and the five objects are aggregated because they are aggregations of atoms.

original: khams bco brgyad po 'di dag las gcod par byed pa ni gang gcad par bya ba ni gang /üîΩsreg par byed pa ni gang /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po 'di dag las gcod par byed pa ni gang gcad par bya ba ni gang / sreg par byed pa ni gang /
translated: Among the eighteen elements, which are the cutting, which are the cut?üîΩWhich are the burning, which are the burned?

original: bsreg par bya ba ni gang /üîΩ'jal bar byed pa ni gang /üîΩgzhal bar bya ba ni gang zhe na /üîΩgcod byed gcad par bya ba nyid //
analyzed: bsreg par bya ba ni gang / 'jal bar byed pa ni gang / gzhal bar bya ba ni gang zhe na / gcod byed gcad par bya ba nyid //
translated: Which are the weighing, which are the weighed?üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.

original: phyi rol gyi ni khams bzhi yin //üîΩgzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ni khams bzhi yin // gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.

original: dgra sta dang / shing zhes bya ba la sogs ba'o //
analyzed: dgra sta dang / shing zhes bya ba la sogs ba'o //
translated: The four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and the cut.

original: gcod pa yang 'dus pa'i rgyun 'brel bar 'byung ba can rnam par 'byed pa skyed pa'o //
analyzed: gcod pa yang 'dus pa'i rgyun 'brel bar 'byung ba can rnam par 'byed pa skyed pa'o //
translated: The four external elements are the cutting and the cut.üîΩThe four external elements are the cutting and

original: dbang po rnams ni gcad par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni gcad par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The faculties are not that which is cut off,

original: gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not susceptible to being divided into two.

original: gcod par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcod par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not that which cuts off,

original: nor bu'i 'od bzhin du dang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od bzhin du dang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they are clear, like the light of a gem.

original: ji ltar gcod byed gcad par bya ba nyid phyi rol gyi khams bzhi yin pa ltar /üîΩde bzhin bsreg bya 'jal byed pa'o //üîΩde dag nyid bsreg par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar gcod byed gcad par bya ba nyid phyi rol gyi khams bzhi yin pa ltar / de bzhin bsreg bya 'jal byed pa'o // de dag nyid bsreg par bya ba yin la /
translated: Just as the four external elements are that which is cut off and that which cuts off,üîΩso too are they that which burns and that which is weighed.

original: de dag nyid 'jal bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid 'jal bar byed pa yin no //
translated: They are that which is burned and that which is weighed.

original: dbang po rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: The faculties are not that which is burned or weighed,

original: dang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are clear.

original: sgra yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra yang ma yin te /
translated: Sound is not that which is burned or weighed,

original: chad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbsreg dang gzhal la mi mthun smra //
analyzed: chad pa'i phyir ro // bsreg dang gzhal la mi mthun smra //
translated: because it is discontinuous.

original: kha cig na re khams bzhi po sreg par byed pa yang yin la gzhal bar bya ba yang yin no zhes brjod do //üîΩrnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i khams ni du /
analyzed: kha cig na re khams bzhi po sreg par byed pa yang yin la gzhal bar bya ba yang yin no zhes brjod do // rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i khams ni du /
translated: Some say that the elements are both that which is burned and that which weighs.üîΩHow many elements are born from retribution?

original: rgyas pa las byung ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba rnams ni du /
translated: How many are born from accumulation?

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba rnams ni du /
translated: How many are derived from natural outflow?

original: rdzas dang ldan pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: rdzas dang ldan pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many are substantial?

original: skad cig ma rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig ma rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are momentary?

original: smras pa / rnam par smin las skyes pa dang // rgyas las byung ba nang gi lnga //üîΩmig la sogs pa lnga po dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par smin las skyes pa dang // rgyas las byung ba nang gi lnga // mig la sogs pa lnga po dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang yin la /
translated: The five internal sense spheres are derived from the cause of retribution and from the cause of development.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba yang yin no //
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba yang yin no //
translated: The five internal sense spheres, i.e., the eye sense sphere, etc., are derived from the cause of retribution and from the cause of development.

original: rgyu mthun @105b par byung ba las ni med de /
analyzed: rgyu mthun @105b par byung ba las ni med de /
translated: They are not derived from the cause of natural outflow,

original: de dag las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni /
analyzed: de dag las ma gtogs pa'i rgyu mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro // de la rnam par smin pa'i rgyu las skyes pa ni /
translated: because there is no natural outflow outside of these two causes.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: Here, derived from the cause of retribution means derived from the cause of retribution.

original: zas dang legs par bya ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par dag gis rgyas par byas pa rnams ni rgyas pa las byung ba dag go //
analyzed: zas dang legs par bya ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par dag gis rgyas par byas pa rnams ni rgyas pa las byung ba dag go //
translated: Derived from the cause of development means developed by food, by action, by concentration, and by liberation.

original: sgra ni rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yod kyi /
analyzed: sgra ni rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yod kyi /
translated: Sound is derived from the cause of development and from the cause of natural outflow.

original: sgra ni rnam smin las skyes min //
analyzed: sgra ni rnam smin las skyes min //
translated: Sound is not born from retribution.üîΩBecause it is produced at will.

original: rang gi 'dod dgur 'byung ba'i phyir //üîΩrgyu mthun las byung rnam smin skyes //
analyzed: rang gi 'dod dgur 'byung ba'i phyir // rgyu mthun las byung rnam smin skyes //
translated: The others are of three types.

original: thogs pa med pa brgyad /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa brgyad /
translated: Eight elements are not capable of being retribution.üîΩThe seven elements of consciousness and the element of mental objects are born from the cause of equal outflow and the cause of universal dominance.

original: sems kyi khams bdun po dag dang chos kyi khams te skal pa mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed pa rnams ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag go //üîΩrnam par smin pa'i rgyus bskyed pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go //
analyzed: sems kyi khams bdun po dag dang chos kyi khams te skal pa mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed pa rnams ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag go // rnam par smin pa'i rgyus bskyed pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag go //
translated: The elements of sound and the ten elements of form are born from the cause of equal outflow and the cause of accumulation.

original: gzhan rnam gsum /
analyzed: gzhan rnam gsum /
translated: The other three are of three types.

original: lhag ma gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i khams dag ste /
analyzed: lhag ma gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i khams dag ste /
translated: The remaining elements, namely, the elements of odor, taste, and the tactile, are born from the cause of retribution, the cause of accumulation, and the cause of equal outflow.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.

original: de dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag kyang yin no //
translated: The unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.

original: rdzas dang lhan cig 'dus ma byas ni brtan pa'i phyir rdzas so //
analyzed: rdzas dang lhan cig 'dus ma byas ni brtan pa'i phyir rdzas so //
translated: The unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born from causes.üîΩThe unconditioned factors are not born, because they are not born

original: de yang chos kyi khams la yod pas chos kyi khams gcig pu rdzas dang ldan pa yin no //üîΩtha ma gsum /
analyzed: de yang chos kyi khams la yod pas chos kyi khams gcig pu rdzas dang ldan pa yin no // tha ma gsum /
translated: Since it exists in the element of mental objects, the element of mental objects alone is substantial.üîΩThe last three are momentary.

original: skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma ste /
translated: The last three are momentary.

original: tha ma de dag yid kyi khams la sogs pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i tshogs la skad cig ma gcig rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha ma de dag yid kyi khams la sogs pa sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i tshogs la skad cig ma gcig rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: The last three elements, i.e., the mental faculty, the mental object, and the mental consciousness, are momentary, because they are not derived from the elements of form and because they are not the result of accumulation.

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called momentary because they are not derived from the elements of form and because they are not the result of accumulation.

original: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni yid kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams yin no //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni yid kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams yin no //
translated: The mental faculty and the mental consciousness are the mental faculty and mental consciousness that are associated with the receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to suffering.

original: lhag ma de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ni chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: lhag ma de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba rnams ni chos kyi khams so //
translated: The mental objects that occur together with them are the element of mental objects.

original: 'di dpyad par bya ste gang mig gi khams dang mi ldan pa las ldan pa thob pa de mig gi rnam par shes pa dang yang yin nam /
analyzed: 'di dpyad par bya ste gang mig gi khams dang mi ldan pa las ldan pa thob pa de mig gi rnam par shes pa dang yang yin nam /
translated: This should be investigated: When one who does not possess the eye element obtains possession of it, does he also obtain possession of the eye consciousness?

original: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang yin pa de mig gi khams dang yang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang yin pa de mig gi khams dang yang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is one who obtains the eye constituent also one who obtains the eye consciousness constituent?

original: smras pa / mig dang ni /
analyzed: smras pa / mig dang ni /
translated: He says: There is acquisition of the eye and

original: rnam shes khams dag so so dang / lhan cig tu yang thob pa yod //
analyzed: rnam shes khams dag so so dang / lhan cig tu yang thob pa yod //
translated: the eye consciousness constituents individually and together.

original: re zhig so so ni mig gi khams dang yin la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ma yin pa yang yod @106a * //
analyzed: re zhig so so ni mig gi khams dang yin la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ma yin pa yang yod @106a * //
translated: First, there is acquisition of the eye constituent but not the eye consciousness constituent.

original: de ; 'dod pa'i khams na rim gyis mig gi dbang po thob pa'o //üîΩmig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yin la /
analyzed: de ; 'dod pa'i khams na rim gyis mig gi dbang po thob pa'o // mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yin la /
translated: That is to say, in the desire realm, one who gradually obtains the eye faculty.

original: mig gi khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: mig gi khams dang ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is acquisition of the eye consciousness constituent but not the eye constituent.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pas gzugs lta zhing mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du byed pa na'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pas gzugs lta zhing mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon du byed pa na'o //
translated: That is to say, one born in the second absorption and so on who sees form and manifests eye consciousness.

original: lhan cig tu yang ni gnyis ka dang ldan pa 'thob pa yang yod de /
analyzed: lhan cig tu yang ni gnyis ka dang ldan pa 'thob pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also acquisition of both together.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes pa na'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skyes pa na'o //
translated: That is to say, one who dies in the formless realm and is born in the desire realm or the Brahma world.

original: gnyis ka dang ma yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka dang ma yin pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The third alternative is the opposite of the first two.

original: nang gi khams dag ni du /
analyzed: nang gi khams dag ni du /
translated: How many internal elements are there?

original: phyi'i dag ni du zhe na /
analyzed: phyi'i dag ni du zhe na /
translated: How many external elements are there?

original: nang gi bcu gnyis gzugs la sogs ma gtogs pa rnam par shes pa drug dang rten drug go //
analyzed: nang gi bcu gnyis gzugs la sogs ma gtogs pa rnam par shes pa drug dang rten drug go //
translated: The twelve internal elements are the six sense faculties, eye, etc., and the six consciousnesses, the eye consciousness, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa ni sems kyi rten nyid du nye ba nyid kyi phyir nang gi'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni sems kyi rten nyid du nye ba nyid kyi phyir nang gi'o //
translated: The internal elements are so called because the eye, etc., are the immediate support of the mind.

original: sems ni ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pa'o//
analyzed: sems ni ngar 'dzin pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir bdag tu nye bar 'dogs pa'o//
translated: The mind is designated as the self because it is the support of the conception of self.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi khams drug po dag ni phyi'i yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi khams drug po dag ni phyi'i yin no //
translated: The six external elements are the six object-fields, visible form, etc.

original: rten pa dang bcas pa'i khams rnams ni du /
analyzed: rten pa dang bcas pa'i khams rnams ni du /
translated: How many elements are with support?

original: de dag dang mtshungs pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are similar to that?

original: re zhig mtha' gcig tu /
analyzed: re zhig mtha' gcig tu /
translated: First of all,

original: chos zhes bya ba ni rten pa dang bcas /
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni rten pa dang bcas /
translated: the element called dharma is with support.

original: rten dang brten par dmigs pa gang rang gi las byed pa de ni rten pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rten dang brten par dmigs pa gang rang gi las byed pa de ni rten pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: That which is perceived as a support or as supported and which performs its own function is with support.

original: gang la yid kyi rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa ma skyes pa'am /
analyzed: gang la yid kyi rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa ma skyes pa'am /
translated: The element of mental consciousness is with support because it is not produced without a support.

original: skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i chos kyi khams gang yin pa de dag ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i chos kyi khams gang yin pa de dag ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: There is no element of factors that is not a support.

original: de lta bas na chos kyi khams ni rtag tu brten pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na chos kyi khams ni rtag tu brten pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Thus the element of factors is always a support.

original: lhag ma ni de dag mtshungs pa dag kyang yin //
analyzed: lhag ma ni de dag mtshungs pa dag kyang yin //
translated: The rest are both supports and similar.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra brten pa dang bcas pa dag kyang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra brten pa dang bcas pa dag kyang yin pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that they are supports.

original: de dag mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de dag mtshungs pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is meant by ‚Äúsimilar‚Äù?

original: gang zhig rang gi las mi byed //
analyzed: gang zhig rang gi las mi byed //
translated: That which does not perform its own function.

original: gang rang gi las mi byed pa de ni brten pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang rang gi las mi byed pa de ni brten pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: That which does not perform its own function is a support.

original: de la mig la sogs pa dag ni gang gcig gi brten pa dang bcas pa de ni thams cad kyi yin la /
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa dag ni gang gcig gi brten pa dang bcas pa de ni thams cad kyi yin la /
translated: In this regard, the eye and so on are supports for all, since they are supports for one.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag ni gang kho na'i dmigs par gyur pa de kho na'i brten pa dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag ni gang kho na'i dmigs par gyur pa de kho na'i brten pa dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: Form and so on are supports only for those that have them as objects.

original: brten pa dang bcas pa ni dngos po'i byed pa la brten pa ste /
analyzed: brten pa dang bcas pa ni dngos po'i byed pa la brten pa ste /
translated: A support is that which performs the function of a basis.

original: de 'di dag la yod pas brten pa dang @106b bcas pa rnams sam /
analyzed: de 'di dag la yod pas brten pa dang @106b bcas pa rnams sam /
translated: They are called ‚Äúendowed with support‚Äù because they exist in relation to that.

original: 'bras bu la reg pa'i phyir brten pa dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: 'bras bu la reg pa'i phyir brten pa dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: Or else, they are called ‚Äúendowed with support‚Äù because they touch their result.

original: yang gang dag brten pa dang bcas pas ma yin pa de dag ni rigs mthun par 'dra ba'i phyir de dang mtshungs pa dag go //
analyzed: yang gang dag brten pa dang bcas pas ma yin pa de dag ni rigs mthun par 'dra ba'i phyir de dang mtshungs pa dag go //
translated: Those that are not endowed with support are called ‚Äúsimilar to that‚Äù because they are similar to those that are endowed with support.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i khams rnams ni du /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i khams rnams ni du /
translated: How many elements are to be abandoned by the path of seeing?

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i khams rnams ni du /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i khams rnams ni du /
translated: How many are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation?

original: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma yin pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are not to be abandoned?

original: re zhig gzugs can bcu ni bsgom pas spang bya yin /
analyzed: re zhig gzugs can bcu ni bsgom pas spang bya yin /
translated: Ten are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: lnga yang yin te /
analyzed: lnga yang yin te /
translated: Five are also to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga po dag go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga po dag go //
translated: The five elements of consciousness are also to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: tha ma gsum rnam gsum /
analyzed: tha ma gsum rnam gsum /
translated: The last three are of three types.

original: phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad dang // de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang ; de dag gi thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: phra rgyas brgyad cu rtsa brgyad dang // de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang ; de dag gi thob pa rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: The eighty-eight mental afflictions, that which arises simultaneously with them, and the obtainment of those that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing, together with their subsequent attributes, are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa lhag ma dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa lhag ma dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: The remaining impure factors are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: zag pa med pa ni spang bya ma yin pa'o //
