analyzed: zag pa med pa ni spang bya ma yin pa'o //
translated: The pure factors are not to be abandoned.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid dang / ngan song ba'i lus dang / ngag gi las dag kyang 'phags pa'i lam dang 'gal ba'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba gzhan yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid dang / ngan song ba'i lus dang / ngag gi las dag kyang 'phags pa'i lam dang 'gal ba'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba gzhan yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are there other factors to be abandoned by insight, such as the status of ordinary person, the bodily and vocal action of those in unfortunate planes of existence, which are in contradiction with the noble path?

original: de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: These factors are not to be abandoned by insight.

original: mdor bsdu ba ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: mdor bsdu ba ni 'di yin no //
translated: Here is a summary:

original: nyon mongs can min mthong spang min //
analyzed: nyon mongs can min mthong spang min //
translated: The factors that are not abandoned by insight are:

original: gzugs min drug pa min skyes min //
analyzed: gzugs min drug pa min skyes min //
translated: not defiled, not form, not of the sixth.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba cung zad kyang med la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba cung zad kyang med la /
translated: There are no defiled factors that are to be abandoned by insight.

original: gzugs kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor are the form factors.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
translated: The status of ordinary person is a non-defiled indeterminate factor.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who have cut off the wholesome roots and those who are free from attachment also possess it.

original: lus dang ngag gi las ni gzugs yin no //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las ni gzugs yin no //
translated: The actions of body and speech are form.

original: de lta bas na de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are not to be abandoned by the path of vision,

original: bden pa dag la log par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa dag la log par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not falsely imagine the truths.

original: drug pa ma yin pa las skyes pa ni dbang po lnga las skyes pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: drug pa ma yin pa las skyes pa ni dbang po lnga las skyes pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: That which is produced from the sixth is that which is produced from the five sense faculties.

original: de yang mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni med do //üîΩlta ba ni du /
analyzed: de yang mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni med do // lta ba ni du /
translated: That also is not to be abandoned by the path of vision.üîΩHow many are views?

original: lta ba ma yin pa ni du zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba ma yin pa ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are not views?

original: mig dang chos kyi khams phyogs ni /
analyzed: mig dang chos kyi khams phyogs ni /
translated: The eye and part of the element of mental objects

original: lta ba yin te /
analyzed: lta ba yin te /
translated: are views.

original: de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / rnam pa brgyad /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam pa brgyad /
translated: Eight kinds.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta ba lnga po dag dang / 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / slob pa'i lta ba dang / mi slob pa'i lta ba dang / chos kyi khams rnam pa @107a * //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta ba lnga po dag dang / 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / slob pa'i lta ba dang / mi slob pa'i lta ba dang / chos kyi khams rnam pa @107a * //
translated: The five views such as the afflicted view of the self,üîΩthe correct mundane view,üîΩthe view of the learner,üîΩthe view of the nonlearner,üîΩand the phenomena element.

original: brgyad po 'di dag ni lta ba yin no //
analyzed: brgyad po 'di dag ni lta ba yin no //
translated: The five views such as the view of the transitory collection, mundane right view, the view of the trainee, the view of the non-trainee, and the eight types of elements of dharmas are view.

original: lhag ma ni lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni lta ba ma yin no //
translated: The rest are not view.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Mundane right view is the virtuous, contaminated wisdom concomitant with mental consciousness.

original: slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i lta ba ni slob pa'i'o //
analyzed: slob pa'i zag pa med pa'i lta ba ni slob pa'i'o //
translated: The view of the trainee is the uncontaminated view of the trainee.

original: mi slob pa'i ni mi slob pa'i'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i ni mi slob pa'i'o //
translated: The view of the non-trainee is the view of the non-trainee.üîΩWhy is only that concomitant with mental consciousness called mundane right view?

original: yang ci'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na la 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar / rnam shes lnga dang mtshungs skyes blo //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na la 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya zhe na / 'di ltar / rnam shes lnga dang mtshungs skyes blo //
translated: Because it is said:

original: nges rtogs med phyir lta ba yin //
analyzed: nges rtogs med phyir lta ba yin //
translated: The mind that arises simultaneously with the five consciousnesses is not view because it does not ascertain its object.

original: rtog par byed pa ni lta ba yin te /
analyzed: rtog par byed pa ni lta ba yin te /
translated: The view is that which judges,

original: nges par sems pa la zhugs pa dag yin na /
analyzed: nges par sems pa la zhugs pa dag yin na /
translated: because it is the determination of what has been examined.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But the wisdom that is born with the five consciousnesses is not like that.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni lta ba ma yin no //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir shes rab nyon mongs pa can nam /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni lta ba ma yin no // de nyid kyi phyir shes rab nyon mongs pa can nam /
translated: Therefore, it is not a view.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa gzhan yang lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa gzhan yang lta ba ma yin no //
translated: For the same reason, other forms of wisdom, whether defiled or not, are not views.

original: 'o na mig kyang rtog par byed pa nyid med na ji ltar lta ba ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mig kyang rtog par byed pa nyid med na ji ltar lta ba ma yin zhe na /
translated: But if the eye does not judge, how can it be a view?

original: gzugs la lta ba'i don gyis te /
analyzed: gzugs la lta ba'i don gyis te /
translated: It is a view because it sees visible form.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: For it is said:

original: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong /
analyzed: mig gis gzugs rnams mthong /
translated: The eye sees visible form.

original: gal te mig gis gzugs rnams mthong bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te mig gis gzugs rnams mthong bar gyur na /
translated: If the eye sees visible form,

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan dang ldan pas kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan dang ldan pas kyang mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then one who possesses another consciousness would also see.

original: mig thams cad kyis mthong ba ni ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: mig thams cad kyis mthong ba ni ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: But not all eyes see.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rten bcas rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rten bcas rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the expression ‚Äúendowed with a support and consciousness‚Äù is that it is endowed with a support and consciousness.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa dang bcas par gyur pa de'i tshe mthong ngo //üîΩde lta na 'o na ni mig la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa de kho nas mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa dang bcas par gyur pa de'i tshe mthong ngo // de lta na 'o na ni mig la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa de kho nas mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: When it is endowed with consciousness, then it sees.üîΩIf that is so, then the eye consciousness alone, which is supported by the eye, sees.

original: de la brten pa'i rnam shes min //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i rnam shes min //
translated: The eye consciousness is not the seer,

original: mthong ngo zhes nges par bya ba'i nus pa ni med do //
analyzed: mthong ngo zhes nges par bya ba'i nus pa ni med do //
translated: because it is not tenable that it sees.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgang phyir bar du chod pa yi //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gang phyir bar du chod pa yi //
translated: Why is it not tenable?

original: gzugs ni mthong ba min phyir lo //
analyzed: gzugs ni mthong ba min phyir lo //
translated: Because a form that is obstructed is not seen.

original: gang gi phyir rtsig pa la sogs pas bar du chod pa'i gzugs mi mthong ngo zhes grag go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtsig pa la sogs pas bar du chod pa'i gzugs mi mthong ngo zhes grag go //
translated: It is well known that a form that is obstructed by a wall and so on is not seen.

original: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong bar gyur na de ni thogs pa med pa'i phyir rtsig pa la sogs pa la yang thogs pa med pas gzugs bsgribs pa yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pas mthong bar gyur na de ni thogs pa med pa'i phyir rtsig pa la sogs pa la yang thogs pa med pas gzugs bsgribs pa yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the eye consciousness sees, then since it is not obstructed, it would see even a form that is obstructed by a wall and so on.

original: mthong ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de bas na rnam par shes pas mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pas mi mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, consciousness does not see.

original: ji ltar yang mig gis mthong ba de bzhin du rna bas thos so //üîΩsnas tshor ro //
analyzed: ji ltar yang mig gis mthong ba de bzhin du rna bas thos so // snas tshor ro //
translated: As it is with seeing, so it is with hearing.üîΩThe nose smells.

original: lces @107b myong ngo //
analyzed: lces @107b myong ngo //
translated: The tongue tastes.

original: lus kyis reg go //
analyzed: lus kyis reg go //
translated: The body touches.

original: yid kyis rnam par shes so //üîΩci mig gcig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngam /
analyzed: yid kyis rnam par shes so // ci mig gcig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngam /
translated: The thinking-mind cognizes.

original: 'on te gnyis kas she na /
analyzed: 'on te gnyis kas she na /
translated: Does the eye see forms with one eye or with both eyes?

original: 'di la nges pa med de /
analyzed: 'di la nges pa med de /
translated: There is no certainty.

original: mig ni gnyis ka dag gis kyang //
analyzed: mig ni gnyis ka dag gis kyang //
translated: Sometimes with both eyes,

original: mthong ste gsal bar mthong phyir ro //üîΩmig ni gnyis kas kyang mthong ste /
analyzed: mthong ste gsal bar mthong phyir ro // mig ni gnyis kas kyang mthong ste /
translated: because seeing is clearer.

original: gnyis phye na gsal ba rab tu mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis phye na gsal ba rab tu mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Sometimes with both eyes, because seeing is clearer when the two eyes are open than when one is closed.

original: rten rnam par chad pas rnam par chad pa mthong ba yang med de /
analyzed: rten rnam par chad pas rnam par chad pa mthong ba yang med de /
translated: But it is not that seeing is interrupted when the support is interrupted,

original: rnam par shes pa ni yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩci mig la sogs pa rnams yul dang phrad pa zhig gam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro // ci mig la sogs pa rnams yul dang phrad pa zhig gam /
translated: because consciousness does not abide in the sense faculties.

original: 'on te ma phrad pa zhig yin zhe na //
analyzed: 'on te ma phrad pa zhig yin zhe na //
translated: Do the eye and the other sense faculties contact their objects or not?

original: mig dang yid dang rna ba ni //
analyzed: mig dang yid dang rna ba ni //
translated: The eye, the ear, and the mind

original: yul dang ma phrad /
analyzed: yul dang ma phrad /
translated: do not contact their objects.

original: 'di ltar gzugs rgyang ring po nas mthong zhing mig dang phrad pa'i mig sman mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs rgyang ring po nas mthong zhing mig dang phrad pa'i mig sman mi mthong ngo //
translated: One sees visible form at a distance, but one does not see eye salve applied to the eye.

original: sgra rgyang ring po nas thos so //
analyzed: sgra rgyang ring po nas thos so //
translated: One hears sounds at a distance.

original: yid ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir phrad pa nyid du mi nus so //üîΩlhag ma sna dang / lce dang / lus zhes bya ba /
analyzed: yid ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir phrad pa nyid du mi nus so // lhag ma sna dang / lce dang / lus zhes bya ba /
translated: The mental faculty, being non-material, cannot come into contact.

original: gsum gzhan du /
analyzed: gsum gzhan du /
translated: The remaining three faculties, nose, tongue and body,üîΩare of two types.

original: yul dang phrad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yul dang phrad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are called faculties that come into contact with their object-field.

original: yang ci mig la sogs pa dag gis bdag nyid kyi tshad dang mnyam pa'i don la 'dzin tam /üîΩ'on te mnyam pa'am mi mnyam pa zhig la 'dzin ce na /üîΩre zhig gang dag yul dang phrad par bshad pa /
analyzed: yang ci mig la sogs pa dag gis bdag nyid kyi tshad dang mnyam pa'i don la 'dzin tam / 'on te mnyam pa'am mi mnyam pa zhig la 'dzin ce na / re zhig gang dag yul dang phrad par bshad pa /
translated: Do the eye, etc., grasp an object-field of their own size, or of a different size?

original: sna la sogs pa gsum po de rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: sna la sogs pa gsum po de rnams kyis ni /
translated: The three faculties, nose, tongue and body,

original: yul ni mnyam par 'dzin par 'dod //
analyzed: yul ni mnyam par 'dzin par 'dod //
translated: grasp an object-field of their own size.

original: dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ji snyed pa de snyed kyi yul gyi rdul phra rab rnams dang phrad nas rnam par shes pa bskyed do //
analyzed: dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ji snyed pa de snyed kyi yul gyi rdul phra rab rnams dang phrad nas rnam par shes pa bskyed do //
translated: The atoms of the object-field come into contact with as many atoms of the faculty as there are atoms in the object-field.

original: mig dang rna ba dag gis ni ma nges so //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba dag gis ni ma nges so //
translated: The eye and ear are not determined.

original: yid ni lus can ma yin pas tshad yongs su ma chad pas mi dpyod do //
analyzed: yid ni lus can ma yin pas tshad yongs su ma chad pas mi dpyod do //
translated: The mental faculty is not analyzed because it is not material and its dimension is not determined.

original: da ni gang 'di dag rnam par shes pa'i khams drug bshad pa ji ltar de dag gi yul da ltar ba dang dus gsum yin pa ltar rten kyang de lta bu yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: da ni gang 'di dag rnam par shes pa'i khams drug bshad pa ji ltar de dag gi yul da ltar ba dang dus gsum yin pa ltar rten kyang de lta bu yin nam zhe na /
translated: Now, the six sense spheres of consciousness have been explained. Are their objects, like the sense spheres, present, past, or future?

original: smras pa ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa ma yin te /
translated: No, they are not.

original: tha ma'i rten 'das /
analyzed: tha ma'i rten 'das /
translated: The last is supported on the past.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten ni 'gags ma thag pa'i yid do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten ni 'gags ma thag pa'i yid do //
translated: The mental faculty is the immediately past mind.

original: lnga rnams ni /
analyzed: lnga rnams ni /
translated: The five are supported on the present.

original: de dag lhan cig skyes pa'ang yin //
analyzed: de dag lhan cig skyes pa'ang yin //
translated: They are also simultaneous.

original: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i rten ni mig nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang lus yin la /
analyzed: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i rten ni mig nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang lus yin la /
translated: The eye sense sphere is the support of the eye consciousness and so on up to the body sense sphere is the support of the body consciousness.

original: de dag gi 'das pa'i rten yid yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi 'das pa'i rten yid yin no //
translated: The support of the past five consciousnesses is the mental faculty.

original: yang rnam par shes pa ni gnyis ka la rag lus te skye na ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa kho na la brten ces bya ba'i gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /üîΩde dag @108a * //
analyzed: yang rnam par shes pa ni gnyis ka la rag lus te skye na ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa kho na la brten ces bya ba'i gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na / de dag @108a * //
translated: If consciousness arises in dependence on both, why is it said that it is supported by the eye, etc., and not by form, etc.?

original: gyur pas 'gyur nyid phyir //
analyzed: gyur pas 'gyur nyid phyir //
translated: Because consciousness changes when they change.

original: brten ni mig la sogs pa yin //
analyzed: brten ni mig la sogs pa yin //
translated: The eye, etc. are its support.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams gyur pas rnam par shes pa rnams 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams gyur pas rnam par shes pa rnams 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Consciousness changes when the eye, etc. change,

original: phan pa dang gnod pa dang / gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan pa dang gnod pa dang / gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows the changes in their helpfulness or harmfulness, and in their clarity or unclarity.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams gyur pas de dag 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams gyur pas de dag 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: It does not change when form, etc. change.

original: de'i phyir de kho na rten yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de kho na rten yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are its support.

original: yang de dag gis ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam par shes na /
analyzed: yang de dag gis ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam par shes na /
translated: If consciousness is aware of form, etc.,

original: ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa rnam par shes pa zhes bya la /
translated: why is it called eye consciousness, etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: and not form consciousness, etc.?

original: gang gi phyir de dag gi rten ni mig la sogs pa yin pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag gi rten ni mig la sogs pa yin pa /
translated: Because the eye, etc. are its support.

original: de phyir thun mong ma yin phyir //
analyzed: de phyir thun mong ma yin phyir //
translated: Therefore, because they are not common to all,

original: de dag gis ni rnam shes bstan //
analyzed: de dag gis ni rnam shes bstan //
translated: they are the basis for the designation of consciousness.

original: mig ni rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rten du 'gyur bar mi nus la /üîΩgzugs ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs par yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: mig ni rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi rten du 'gyur bar mi nus la / gzugs ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs par yang 'gyur la /
translated: The eye cannot be the basis of another consciousness.üîΩForm is the object of mental consciousness and also the object of eye consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs par yang 'gyur te /
translated: The body is the basis of tactile consciousness and also the object of tactile consciousness.

original: lus kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi bar du yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the other sense faculties up to the object of tactile consciousness.

original: de lta bas na rten du gyur pa'i phyir dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir de dag kho nas rnam par shes pa bstan gyi gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na rten du gyur pa'i phyir dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir de dag kho nas rnam par shes pa bstan gyi gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, because they are the basis and because they are not common to all, they are the basis for the designation of consciousness, but form and so on are not.

original: dper na rnga bo che'i sgra dang / nas kyi myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rnga bo che'i sgra dang / nas kyi myu gu bzhin no //
translated: For example, the sound of a drum and the sprout of barley.

original: yang lus gang la gnas te mig gis gzugs rnams la lta ba na /
analyzed: yang lus gang la gnas te mig gis gzugs rnams la lta ba na /
translated: Now, when the eye sees visible form, does it see the body on which it is based?

original: ci lus dang mig dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa de rnams sa gcig pa kho na zhig yin nam /
analyzed: ci lus dang mig dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa de rnams sa gcig pa kho na zhig yin nam /
translated: Are the body, eye, visible form, and consciousness all of the same level?

original: 'on te gzhan gyis pa yang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis pa yang yin zhe na /
translated: Or are they of different levels?

original: smras pa / thams cad la bye brag yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad la bye brag yod de /
translated: He says: There is a difference in all cases.

original: de la nges pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la nges pa 'di yin te /
translated: The rule is as follows:

original: lus la 'og gi mig ma yin //
analyzed: lus la 'og gi mig ma yin //
translated: The eye does not see what is below it.

original: las dang mig dang gzugs rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar sa lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: las dang mig dang gzugs rnams ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar sa lnga pa yin no //
translated: Karma, the eye, and form belong to five levels: the level of the realm of desire, and the four levels of the first, second, third, and fourth absorptions.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dang sa gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dang sa gnyis pa yin no //
translated: Eye consciousness belongs to two levels: the level of the realm of desire and the level of the first absorption.

original: de las gang sa'i lus yin pa'i sa de ba'am /üîΩsa gong ma'i yin gyi sa 'og ma'i ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gang sa'i lus yin pa'i sa de ba'am / sa gong ma'i yin gyi sa 'og ma'i ma yin no //
translated: The level of the body is the same as that of the eye or is higher.

original: 'di'i mig gi yul ni de'i sa pa 'am sa 'og ma'i gzugs yin gyi /üîΩmig gi gong ma'i gzugs ma yin /
analyzed: 'di'i mig gi yul ni de'i sa pa 'am sa 'og ma'i gzugs yin gyi / mig gi gong ma'i gzugs ma yin /
translated: The eye of a certain level sees the form of that level or a lower level.üîΩIt does not see the form of a higher level.

original: sa gong ma'i gzugs sa 'og ma'i mig gis mthong bar ni nam yang mi nus so //üîΩrnam par shes pa'ang /
analyzed: sa gong ma'i gzugs sa 'og ma'i mig gis mthong bar ni nam yang mi nus so // rnam par shes pa'ang /
translated: The eye of a lower level never sees the form of a higher level.

original: sa gong ma'i ma yin te /
analyzed: sa gong ma'i ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness is not of a higher level.

original: gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs bzhin no //
translated: It is like form.

original: de yi @108b gzugs /
analyzed: de yi @108b gzugs /
translated: The form of that level is seen by the eye of that level or a lower level.

original: lus kyi'ang gnyis ka thams cad du de'i zhes bya ba bshad ma thag pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul ni gong ma dang 'og ma dang rang gis pa'i gzugs thams cad du yin la /
analyzed: lus kyi'ang gnyis ka thams cad du de'i zhes bya ba bshad ma thag pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa'i yul ni gong ma dang 'og ma dang rang gis pa'i gzugs thams cad du yin la /
translated: Also, the body sense faculty is in all three realms.üîΩThe object of the body sense faculty is form of all three realms and the form element.

original: lus kyi'ang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa thams cad du yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi'ang gzugs dang rnam par shes pa thams cad du yin no //
translated: The object of the body sense faculty is form of all three realms and the form element.

original: ji ltar mig 'di rgyas par bshad pa ltar ;
analyzed: ji ltar mig 'di rgyas par bshad pa ltar ;
translated: Just as the eye is explained in detail,

original: rna ba'ang de bzhin /
analyzed: rna ba'ang de bzhin /
translated: the ear is also like that.

original: lus la gong ma'i rna ba min //
analyzed: lus la gong ma'i rna ba min //
translated: The body sense faculty is not of the higher realm.

original: rna bas gong ma'i sgra ma yin //
analyzed: rna bas gong ma'i sgra ma yin //
translated: The ear does not hear sounds of the higher realm.

original: rnam par shes pa'ang sgra ni 'di'i //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'ang sgra ni 'di'i //
translated: The consciousness is also sound.

original: lus kyi'ang gnyis ka thams cad du //
analyzed: lus kyi'ang gnyis ka thams cad du //
translated: Also, the body sense faculty is in all three realms.

original: gsum dag ni /
analyzed: gsum dag ni /
translated: The three

original: thams cad rang gi sa pa nyid //
analyzed: thams cad rang gi sa pa nyid //
translated: are of their own level.

original: sna dang lce dang lus kyi khams rnams kyi ni lus dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams rang gis pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: sna dang lce dang lus kyi khams rnams kyi ni lus dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams rang gis pa kho na yin no //
translated: The nose, tongue, and body sense faculties, their objects, and their consciousnesses are of their own level alone.

original: spyir bstan nas dmigs kyis bsal ba gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: spyir bstan nas dmigs kyis bsal ba gsungs pa ni /
translated: Having taught in general, the exception is stated:

original: lus kyi rnam shes 'og dang ni //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam shes 'og dang ni //
translated: The body consciousness is of the lower level.

original: rang gi sa pa lus dang lus kyi khams dang reg bya ni rtag tu rang gi sa pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa lus dang lus kyi khams dang reg bya ni rtag tu rang gi sa pa kho na yin no //
translated: The body, the body sense faculty, and tangibility always belong to one‚Äôs own level.

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni kha cig gi rang gi sa pa yin te 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa ni kha cig gi rang gi sa pa yin te 'di lta ste /
translated: The body consciousness belongs to one‚Äôs own level in some cases.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang por skyes pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang por skyes pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it belongs to the level of the desire realm and the first absorption when one is born in the desire realm and the first absorption.

original: kha cig ni sa 'og ma pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni sa 'og ma pa yin te /
translated: In some cases, it belongs to a lower level.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: it belongs to the second absorption and so on when one is born in the second absorption and so on.

original: yid ma nges te /
analyzed: yid ma nges te /
translated: The mental faculty is not definite.

original: res 'ga' ni lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / chos dag dang mtshungs pa'i sa pa'i yid yin la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / chos dag dang mtshungs pa'i sa pa'i yid yin la /
translated: Sometimes it is the same level as the body, the body sense faculty, and the mental consciousness and phenomena.

original: res 'ga' ni sa gong ma dang 'og ma pa yin te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni sa gong ma dang 'og ma pa yin te /
translated: Sometimes it is of a higher or lower level.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa lnga pa'i lus la yang snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba'i tshe yid la sogs pa'i sa thams cad pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa lnga pa'i lus la yang snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba'i tshe yid la sogs pa'i sa thams cad pa dag yin no //
translated: For that reason, when one enters meditative attainment and is born in the five levels, the mental faculty and so on are of all levels.

original: 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This should be analyzed.

original: khams bco brgyad po rnam par shes pa drug po rnams las gang gis shes par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad po rnam par shes pa drug po rnams las gang gis shes par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: Which of the eighteen elements are cognized by which of the six consciousnesses?

original: smras pa / gnyis kyi rnam shes phyi yi lnga //
analyzed: smras pa / gnyis kyi rnam shes phyi yi lnga //
translated: Two are cognized by two, the external five by the five.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams ni mig la sogs pa la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams ni mig la sogs pa la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pas shes par bya ba'o //
translated: The objects of form, etc., are cognized by the consciousnesses of the eye, etc., and by mental consciousness.

original: lhag ma khams bcu gsum dag ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid kyis shes par bya ba'o zhes brjod par 'gyur ro //üîΩkhams bco brgyad po de dag las rtag pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: lhag ma khams bcu gsum dag ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid kyis shes par bya ba'o zhes brjod par 'gyur ro // khams bco brgyad po de dag las rtag pa rnams ni du /
translated: The remaining thirteen elements are cognized by mental consciousness alone.

original: mi rtag pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: Among the eighteen elements, how many are permanent and how many are impermanent?

original: 'dus ma byas chos rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas chos rtag pa'o //
translated: The unconditioned is permanent.

original: des na chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig rtag la lhag ma rnams ni mi rtag pa yin no //üîΩdbang po rnams ni du /
analyzed: des na chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig rtag la lhag ma rnams ni mi rtag pa yin no // dbang po rnams ni du /
translated: Therefore, one part of the element of mental objects is permanent, and the rest are impermanent.

original: @109a * // dbang po ma yin pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: @109a * // dbang po ma yin pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are faculties and how many are not faculties?

original: chos kyi phyed dang gang dag ni //
analyzed: chos kyi phyed dang gang dag ni //
translated: Half of the element of mental objects and the three unconditioned things are not faculties.

original: bcu gnyis nang gir bshad dbang po //üîΩde la chos zhes bya ba'i phyed ni srog gi dbang po la sogs pa dbang po bcu gcig dang / mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa la sogs pa dbang po'i cha ste /
analyzed: bcu gnyis nang gir bshad dbang po // de la chos zhes bya ba'i phyed ni srog gi dbang po la sogs pa dbang po bcu gcig dang / mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa la sogs pa dbang po'i cha ste /
translated: The twelve internal faculties are explained in the Abhidharma.

original: chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnang gi bcu gnyis ni mig la sogs pa rang gi ming gis smos pa lnga dang / yid kyi dbang po ni sems kyi khams bdun no //
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir ro // nang gi bcu gnyis ni mig la sogs pa rang gi ming gis smos pa lnga dang / yid kyi dbang po ni sems kyi khams bdun no //
translated: The term dharma refers to the eleven faculties such as life force and the three uncontaminated faculties, because they are one part of the phenomena element.

original: pho dang mo'i dbang po dag ni lus kyi phyogs gcig go //
analyzed: pho dang mo'i dbang po dag ni lus kyi phyogs gcig go //
translated: The twelve internal faculties are the five faculties such as the eye that are mentioned by their own names, the mental faculty, which is the seven mental elements, the male and female faculties, which are one part of the body faculty, and the five faculties such as faith.

original: lhag ma khams lnga po de dag dang chos kyi khams kyi phyogs ni dbang po ma yin pa zhes bya bar grub po //üîΩphung po dang khams dang skye mched bstan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lhag ma khams lnga po de dag dang chos kyi khams kyi phyogs ni dbang po ma yin pa zhes bya bar grub po // phung po dang khams dang skye mched bstan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The remaining five elements and one part of the phenomena element are established as not being faculties.

original: mdzod kyi gnas dang po'o /üîΩ// / dbang po rnams bshad pa la /
analyzed: mdzod kyi gnas dang po'o / // / dbang po rnams bshad pa la /
translated: This has been part I: The Exposition of the Aggregates, Elements, and Bases.

original: dbang po'i don ni dbang phyug dam pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i don ni dbang phyug dam pa'o //
translated: The meaning of faculty is supreme power.

original: 'di dag las gang zhig gang la dbang byed ce na /
analyzed: 'di dag las gang zhig gang la dbang byed ce na /
translated: What do these faculties control?

original: lnga po rnams ni don bzhi la dbang byed /
analyzed: lnga po rnams ni don bzhi la dbang byed /
translated: Five control four objects.üîΩThe eye and ear each control four objects.üîΩThe eye and ear control the beauty of the body, since the blind and the deaf are not beautiful.

original: re zhig mig dang rna ba dag re re zhing don bzhi bzhi la dbang byed pa ni long ba dang 'on pa dag ni mi mdzes pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir lus mdzes par bya ba dang mthong ba dang thos nas yang ba yongs su spong ba'i phyir
analyzed: re zhig mig dang rna ba dag re re zhing don bzhi bzhi la dbang byed pa ni long ba dang 'on pa dag ni mi mdzes pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir lus mdzes par bya ba dang mthong ba dang thos nas yang ba yongs su spong ba'i phyir
translated: They control the protection of the body, since one sees and hears what is dangerous and one avoids it.üîΩThey control the generation of eye consciousness and ear consciousness and their concomitant states.

original: lus yongs su srung ba dang / mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa dag bskyed pa dang / gzugs la lta ba dang sgra nyan pa dag gi thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid la dbang byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus yongs su srung ba dang / mig dang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa dag bskyed pa dang / gzugs la lta ba dang sgra nyan pa dag gi thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid la dbang byed pa'o //
translated: They control the uncommon cause of seeing form and hearing sound.

original: sna dang / lce dang / lus ni snga ma bzhin du lus mdzes par bya ba la dbang byed pa dang / de dag gis kham gyi zas la yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir lus yongs su srung ba la dbang byed pa dang / rang la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa dang /
analyzed: sna dang / lce dang / lus ni snga ma bzhin du lus mdzes par bya ba la dbang byed pa dang / de dag gis kham gyi zas la yongs su longs spyod pa'i phyir lus yongs su srung ba la dbang byed pa dang / rang la brten pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa dang /
translated: The nose, tongue, and body faculties, as before, exercise controlling power with regard to the adornment of the body and the protection of the body by means of the enjoyment of material food.

original: rang gi lus nyams su myong ba la sngar bzhin du dbang byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi lus nyams su myong ba la sngar bzhin du dbang byed pa'o //
translated: They exercise controlling power with regard to the generation of the consciousnesses that are supported by them and with regard to the experience of one‚Äôs own body, as before.

original: bzhi rnams gnyis la'o //
analyzed: bzhi rnams gnyis la'o //
translated: The four faculties of form, etc., exercise controlling power with regard to the two.

original: re zhig pho dang mo'i dbang po dag ni sems can gyi bye brag dang / khyad par dag la dbang byed de /
analyzed: re zhig pho dang mo'i dbang po dag ni sems can gyi bye brag dang / khyad par dag la dbang byed de /
translated: The male and female faculties exercise controlling power with regard to the distinction of sentient beings and the distinction of sex.

original: de la sems can gyi bye brag ni mo dang pho zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la sems can gyi bye brag ni mo dang pho zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The distinction of sentient beings is the difference between male and female.

original: sems can gyi khyad par ni nu ma la sogs pa'i dbyibs dang nga ro dang spyod pa gzhan pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems can gyi khyad par ni nu ma la sogs pa'i dbyibs dang nga ro dang spyod pa gzhan pa nyid do //
translated: The distinction of sex is the difference in shape, voice, and behavior of the body.

original: gzhan dag na re ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bdag la dbang byed de /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bdag la dbang byed de /
translated: Others say that they exercise controlling power with regard to the defilement and purification of sentient beings.

original: de dang mi ldan pa la sdom pa ma yin pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mi ldan pa la sdom pa ma yin pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who do not possess these faculties do not possess the negative commitments and so on.

original: srog gi dbang po ni ris mthun par mtshams sbyor @109b ba dang / yang dag par 'dzin pa dag la dbang byed do //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ni ris mthun par mtshams sbyor @109b ba dang / yang dag par 'dzin pa dag la dbang byed do //
translated: The faculty of life force controls the connection to a homogeneous collection of parts and the holding of that connection.

original: yid kyi dbang po ni yang srid par mtshams sbyor ba dang / rang gi ngo bo dang mthun par byed pa dag la dbang byed do //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po ni yang srid par mtshams sbyor ba dang / rang gi ngo bo dang mthun par byed pa dag la dbang byed do //
translated: The mental faculty controls the connection to a new existence and the performance of actions consistent with its nature.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga gang yin pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa brgyad gang yin pa /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga gang yin pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa brgyad gang yin pa /
translated: The five faculties of pleasure and so on and the eight beginning with faith

original: lnga dang brgyad po de rnams ni ;
analyzed: lnga dang brgyad po de rnams ni ;
translated: are the five and eight

original: / kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang dang // go rims bzhin du dbang byed de //üîΩbde ba la sogs pa lnga po dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa la dbang byed de /
analyzed: / kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang dang // go rims bzhin du dbang byed de // bde ba la sogs pa lnga po dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa la dbang byed de /
translated: that control affliction and purification, respectively.

original: de dag la 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩdad pa la sogs pa rnams ni /
analyzed: de dag la 'dod chags la sogs pa rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // dad pa la sogs pa rnams ni /
translated: The five faculties of pleasure and so on control affliction because attachment and so on increase due to them.

original: rnam par byang ba la dbang byed de /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba la dbang byed de /
translated: The eight beginning with faith control purification because the path arises due to them.

original: de dag ni rnam par byang bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par byang bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the cause of purification.

original: gzhan dag na re /üîΩrang gi don dang thams cad la //üîΩdmigs par dbang byed phyir dbang drug / mig la sogs pa lnga po dag ni rang rang gi don la dmigs par bya ba la dbang byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re / rang gi don dang thams cad la // dmigs par dbang byed phyir dbang drug / mig la sogs pa lnga po dag ni rang rang gi don la dmigs par bya ba la dbang byed do //
translated: According to another opinion,üîΩthe six controlling faculties exercise controlling power with regard to the object-field, with regard to all, with regard to the specific and common cause.üîΩThe five sense faculties exercise controlling power with regard to the perception of their particular object-field: the eye sense faculty, with regard to visible form; the ear sense faculty, with regard to sound; the nose sense faculty, with regard to odor; the tongue sense faculty, with regard to taste; the body sense faculty, with regard to the tangible.

original: sgra thos pa yang med pa de'i phyir thun mong gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir yid ni don thams cad la dmigs pa la dbang byed de //
analyzed: sgra thos pa yang med pa de'i phyir thun mong gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir yid ni don thams cad la dmigs pa la dbang byed de //
translated: The mental faculty exercises controlling power with regard to the perception of all object-fields, because it is the common cause of the five sense consciousnesses.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni so sor dbang po'o //üîΩmo nyid pho nyid la dbang phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni so sor dbang po'o // mo nyid pho nyid la dbang phyir //
translated: That is why each of these six controlling faculties is a controlling faculty.

original: lus las mo dang pho dbang dag / rnam par bzhag ste /üîΩdon tha dad pa dag ni ma yin no //üîΩmo'i ngo bo ni mo nyid do //
analyzed: lus las mo dang pho dbang dag / rnam par bzhag ste / don tha dad pa dag ni ma yin no // mo'i ngo bo ni mo nyid do //
translated: The two sexual faculties exercise controlling power with regard to the distinction of male and female.üîΩThe two sexual faculties are established as controlling faculties because of their controlling power with regard to the distinction of male and female.

original: pho'i ngo bo ni pho nyid do //
analyzed: pho'i ngo bo ni pho nyid do //
translated: The nature of female is femininity; the nature of male is masculinity.

original: de la pho dang mo dag gi nga ro la sogs pa gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: de la pho dang mo dag gi nga ro la sogs pa gzhan pa'o //
translated: The voice, bodily form and manner of being are different for male and female.

original: ris gnas kun nas nyon mongs dang // rnam par byang la dbang byed phyir //
analyzed: ris gnas kun nas nyon mongs dang // rnam par byang la dbang byed phyir //
translated: The controlling faculties exercise controlling power with regard to the distinction of the realms of existence, the stages, defilement and purification.

original: srog dang tshor ba rnams dang ni //
analyzed: srog dang tshor ba rnams dang ni //
translated: The faculty of life force, the five faculties of sensation,

original: dad sogs lnga yang dbang por 'dod //
analyzed: dad sogs lnga yang dbang por 'dod //
translated: and the five beginning with faith are faculties.

original: srog gi dbang po ni ris mthun par gnas par bya ba dang / tshor ba rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs la dang / dad pa la sogs pa lnga po dag ni rnam par byang ba la dbang byed de /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ni ris mthun par gnas par bya ba dang / tshor ba rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs la dang / dad pa la sogs pa lnga po dag ni rnam par byang ba la dbang byed de /
translated: The faculty of life force is the dominant condition for the duration of a class affiliate nikƒÅyasabhƒÅga. The five faculties of sensation are the dominant condition for the afflicted state. The five faculties beginning with faith are the dominant condition for the pure state.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyang rnam par gnon la lam yang 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyang rnam par gnon la lam yang 'dren par byed do //
translated: Thus they are the dominant condition for the afflicted state because they suppress the afflictions and they are the dominant condition for the pure state because they attract the path.üîΩThe faculties of producing complete knowledge, complete knowledge,üîΩand possessing complete knowledge are the dominant conditions

original: mya ngan 'das sogs gong nas gong //üîΩthob pa la ni dbang byed phyir //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das sogs gong nas gong // thob pa la ni dbang byed phyir //
translated: for attaining nirvana and so on.

original: kun shes byed dang kun shes dang // de bzhin kun shes ldan dbang po //
analyzed: kun shes byed dang kun shes dang // de bzhin kun shes ldan dbang po //
translated: The faculty of producing complete knowledge is the dominant condition for attaining the first result, the faculty of complete knowledge is the dominant condition for attaining the second and third results and the faculty of possessing complete knowledge is the dominant condition for attaining the fourth result.

original: de la kun shes byed pa'i dbang po ni kun shes pa'i dbang po thob par bya ba la dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po thob par bya ba la dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba la dbang byed do //
analyzed: de la kun shes byed pa'i dbang po ni kun shes pa'i dbang po thob par bya ba la dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po thob par bya ba la dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba la dbang byed do //
translated: The faculty producing complete knowledge controls the obtainment of the faculty of complete knowledge, the faculty of complete knowledge controls the obtainment of the faculty possessing complete knowledge and the faculty possessing complete knowledge controls the obtainment of nirvana.

original: @110a * // sogs pa'i sgra ni rnam grangs gzhan du bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: @110a * // sogs pa'i sgra ni rnam grangs gzhan du bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicate that they are also taught as synonyms.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po gsum dag go //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po gsum dag go //
translated: There are three faculties that control the abandonment of affliction to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation and the control of abiding happily in this life.

original: dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po nyid yin na go //
analyzed: dbang byed pa'i phyir dbang po nyid yin na go //
translated: If something controls, it is a faculty.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa kha bskang dgos pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa kha bskang dgos pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not necessary to add ignorance and so on to this list.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar 'di ni sems kyi brten dang de'i bye brag / gnas dang kun nas nyon mongs nyid //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar 'di ni sems kyi brten dang de'i bye brag / gnas dang kun nas nyon mongs nyid //
translated: The six sense bases are the basis of the substance of sentient beings.üîΩThe male and female faculties distinguish sentient beings as male and female.üîΩThe life faculty causes the body to abide.üîΩThe five beginning with faith cause the accumulation of the equipment of purification.

original: tshogs dang rnam byang ji snyed pa //
analyzed: tshogs dang rnam byang ji snyed pa //
translated: The three beginning with the faculty of understanding what has not been understood cause purification.

original: dbang po rnams kyang de snyed du //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyang de snyed du //
translated: Therefore, ignorance and so on are not considered to be faculties.üîΩThe faculties are considered to be as many as the bases of the mind and its specific states, the states of abiding, affliction, and purification.

original: 'dod de / de la sems kyi rten ni dbang po drug dag yin te /
analyzed: 'dod de / de la sems kyi rten ni dbang po drug dag yin te /
translated: The six sense faculties are the basis of the mind and its specific states.

original: skye mched drug po yang sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi yin no //
analyzed: skye mched drug po yang sems can gyi rdzas kyi gzhi yin no //
translated: The six sense bases are the basis of the substance of sentient beings.

original: mo dang pho'i dbang po dag gis ni de mo dang phor bye brag tu 'byed do //
analyzed: mo dang pho'i dbang po dag gis ni de mo dang phor bye brag tu 'byed do //
translated: The male and female faculties distinguish sentient beings as male and female.

original: srog gi dbang pos ni gnas par byed do //üîΩtshor ba rnams kyis ni kun nas nyon mongs par byed do //
analyzed: srog gi dbang pos ni gnas par byed do // tshor ba rnams kyis ni kun nas nyon mongs par byed do //
translated: The life faculty causes the body to abide.üîΩThe five beginning with faith cause the accumulation of the equipment of purification.üîΩThe three beginning with the faculty of understanding what has not been understood cause purification.

original: dad pa la sogs pa lngas ni rnam par byang ba la sogs pa'i tshogs sogs par byed do //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa lngas ni rnam par byang ba la sogs pa'i tshogs sogs par byed do //
translated: Therefore, ignorance and so on are not considered to be faculties.üîΩThe faculties are considered to be as many as the bases of the mind and its specific states, the states of abiding, affliction, and purification.üîΩThe six sense faculties are the basis of the mind and its specific states.üîΩThe six sense bases are the basis of the substance of sentient beings.üîΩThe male and female faculties distinguish sentient beings as male and female.üîΩThe life faculty causes the body to abide.üîΩThe five beginning with faith cause the accumulation of the equipment of purification.

original: gsum gyis ni rnam par byang bar byed de /
analyzed: gsum gyis ni rnam par byang bar byed de /
translated: The three beginning with the faculty of understanding what has not been understood cause purification.üîΩTherefore, ignorance and so on are not considered to be faculties.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa ni dbang po nyid du mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa ni dbang po nyid du mi 'dod do //
translated: The faculties are considered to be as many as the bases of the mind and its specific states, the states of abiding, affliction, and purification.

original: yang na 'jug pa'i rten dang ni //
analyzed: yang na 'jug pa'i rten dang ni //
translated: The six sense faculties are the basis of the mind and its specific states.üîΩThe six sense bases are the basis of the substance of sentient beings.üîΩThe male and female faculties distinguish sentient beings as male and female.üîΩThe life faculty causes the body to abide.

original: skye dang gnas dang nyer spyod las //
analyzed: skye dang gnas dang nyer spyod las //
translated: Birth, abiding, and activity.üîΩ

original: bcu bzhi de bzhin ldog pa la //
analyzed: bcu bzhi de bzhin ldog pa la //
translated: The fourteen faculties are the basis of birth, of abiding, and of enjoyment.

original: dbang po rnams ni gzhan yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni gzhan yin no //
translated: The reverse is the case for the other faculties.

original: 'jug pa'i rten ni dbang po drug yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rten ni dbang po drug yin no //
translated: The six sense faculties are the basis of engagement.

original: skye ba ni mo dang po'i dbang po dag las te /
analyzed: skye ba ni mo dang po'i dbang po dag las te /
translated: The two sex faculties are the basis of birth,

original: de las skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because birth occurs through them.

original: gnas pa ni srog gi dbang po ste /
analyzed: gnas pa ni srog gi dbang po ste /
translated: The life faculty is the basis of abiding,

original: des gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩtshor ba rnams kyis ni nye bar spyod par byed de /
analyzed: des gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro // tshor ba rnams kyis ni nye bar spyod par byed de /
translated: because it causes abiding.üîΩThe five feeling faculties are the basis of enjoyment,

original: de'i phyir de dag ni dbang po bcu bzhi yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni dbang po bcu bzhi yin no //
translated: because one enjoys objects through them.

original: rnam pa de nyid kyis gzhan dag ni ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de nyid kyis gzhan dag ni ldog pa yin no //
translated: The reverse is the case for the other faculties.

original: gang gi phyir ldog pa'i rten ni dad pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ldog pa'i rten ni dad pa la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The five faculties of faith and so on are the basis of the reverse of engagement, because they are the basis of the reverse of engagement.

original: skye ba ni kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po yin no //
analyzed: skye ba ni kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po yin no //
translated: The faculty of producing complete knowledge is the basis of birth.

original: gnas pa ni kun shes pa'i dbang po yin no //üîΩkun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang pos ni nye bar spyod par byed do //
analyzed: gnas pa ni kun shes pa'i dbang po yin no //üîΩkun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang pos ni nye bar spyod par byed do //
translated: The faculty of complete knowledge is the basis of abiding.üîΩThe faculty of possessing complete knowledge is the basis of enjoyment.

original: de'i phyir dbang po dag ni de snyed cig yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po dag ni de snyed cig yin la /
translated: Therefore, there are just these many faculties.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag gi go rims kyang de yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag gi go rims kyang de yin no //
translated: And this is the order of the faculties.

original: de la dbang po gang dag gzhan du ma bstan pa de dag bstan te /üîΩlus tshor sim pa ma yin gang //
analyzed: de la dbang po gang dag gzhan du ma bstan pa de dag bstan te / lus tshor sim pa ma yin gang //
translated: Among them, those faculties that have not been explained elsewhere are explained here.

original: sdug bsngal dbang po'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dbang po'o //
translated: The unpleasant bodily feeling is the faculty of pain.

original: sim pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sim pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: Unpleasant means harmful.

original: sim pa ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: sim pa ni bde ba'o //
translated: Pleasant means happiness.

original: lus kyi tshor ba sim pa ni bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: lus kyi tshor ba sim pa ni bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: Pleasant bodily feeling is the faculty of pleasure.

original: sim pa zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: sim pa zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa ste /
translated: Pleasant means beneficial.

original: @110b bsam gtan gsum pa na /
analyzed: @110b bsam gtan gsum pa na /
translated: In the third meditation,

original: sems kyi de ni bde dbang po //
analyzed: sems kyi de ni bde dbang po //
translated: that mental feeling is the faculty of pleasure.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa ni sems kyi tshor ba sim pa de nyid bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa ni sems kyi tshor ba sim pa de nyid bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: In the third meditation, that mental feeling of pleasure is the faculty of pleasure.

original: gzhan na de yid bde ba yin //
analyzed: gzhan na de yid bde ba yin //
translated: In other stages, it is the faculty of mental satisfaction.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa las gzhan pa 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa na ni sems kyi tshor ba sim pa gang yin pa de ni yid bde ba'i dbang po yin no //üîΩsems kyi tshim pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa las gzhan pa 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa na ni sems kyi tshor ba sim pa gang yin pa de ni yid bde ba'i dbang po yin no // sems kyi tshim pa ma yin pa //
translated: In the realm of desire and in the first and second meditation, the pleasant mental sensation is satisfaction.

original: yid mi bde ba'o btang snyoms ni //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'o btang snyoms ni //
translated: The unpleasant mental sensation is dissatisfaction.üîΩNeutral sensation is equanimity.

original: bar ma'o // sems pa yang ma yin sim pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa ni bar ma zhes brjod de btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: bar ma'o // sems pa yang ma yin sim pa ma yin pa yang ma yin pa ni bar ma zhes brjod de btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
translated: Neither pleasant nor unpleasant mental sensation is called neutral, and is the faculty of equanimity.

original: ci lus kyi'am sems kyi zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci lus kyi'am sems kyi zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Is it bodily or mental?

original: smras pa ; gnyis ga'i yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ; gnyis ga'i yin no //
translated: It is both.

original: ci'i phyir 'di bsdus nas dbang po gcig tu byas she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di bsdus nas dbang po gcig tu byas she na /
translated: Why is it combined into one faculty?

original: mi rtog phyir /
analyzed: mi rtog phyir /
translated: Because it is non-determining.

original: sems kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba ni phal cher rnam par rtog pa las skye'i lus kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba ni phal cher rnam par rtog pa las skye'i lus kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Bodily or mental pleasure or pain is generally produced by imagination, but not so neutral sensation.

original: yul gyi dbang gis ni dgra bcom pa rnams la yang skye bas de'i phyir de dag dbang po nyid du tha dad kyi lus kyi dang sems kyi btang snyoms ni rnam par mi rtog pa kho nar rang gi ngang gis skye bas lus kyi dang sems kyi zhes
analyzed: yul gyi dbang gis ni dgra bcom pa rnams la yang skye bas de'i phyir de dag dbang po nyid du tha dad kyi lus kyi dang sems kyi btang snyoms ni rnam par mi rtog pa kho nar rang gi ngang gis skye bas lus kyi dang sems kyi zhes
translated: Since they arise due to the power of the object, even arhats generate them. Therefore they are differentiated as faculties.üîΩBut physical and mental equanimity arise by their own power alone, without conception.

original: bya ba dbang po gcig tu byas so //
analyzed: bya ba dbang po gcig tu byas so //
translated: Therefore they are combined into one faculty, called the faculty of equanimity.

original: mthong bsgom mi slob lam la dgu //
analyzed: mthong bsgom mi slob lam la dgu //
translated: Nine faculties are on the paths of seeing, meditation, and no learning.üîΩThe mental faculty, pleasure, mental satisfaction, equanimity, the five beginning with faith, and the three without attachment, are the nine faculties.

original: gsum yin / yid dang bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms rnams dang / dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang / dbang po dgu po de dag ni mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam dag la dbang po gsum du brjod do //
analyzed: gsum yin / yid dang bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms rnams dang / dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang / dbang po dgu po de dag ni mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam dag la dbang po gsum du brjod do //
translated: On the paths of seeing, meditation, and no learning, they are called three faculties.

original: mthong ba'i lam la ni mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la ni mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: On the path of seeing, they are called the faculty producing complete knowledge of the unknown.

original: sgom pa'i lam la ni kun shes pa yin te /
analyzed: sgom pa'i lam la ni kun shes pa yin te /
translated: On the path of meditation, they are called the faculty of complete knowledge.

original: phra rgyas lhag ma spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra rgyas lhag ma spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they abandon the remaining afflictions.üîΩOn the path of no learning, they are called the faculty of possessing complete knowledge.

original: mi slob pa'i lam la ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po yin te /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam la ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po yin te /
translated: On the path of no learning, it is the faculty of final and perfect knowledge.

original: de'i ngang tshul nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩdbang po de dag la zag pa dang bcas pa ni du /
analyzed: de'i ngang tshul nyid kyi phyir ro // dbang po de dag la zag pa dang bcas pa ni du /
translated: Because it is the nature of that path.

original: zag pa med pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: How many of these faculties are contaminated and how many are uncontaminated?

original: gsum ni dri ma med /
analyzed: gsum ni dri ma med /
translated: Three are stainless.

original: kun shes byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa gsum bshad ma thag pa de ni zag pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: kun shes byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa gsum bshad ma thag pa de ni zag pa med pa yin te /
translated: The three faculties just explained‚Äîthe faculty of final and perfect knowledge, etc.‚Äîare uncontaminated.

original: dri ma rnams ni zag pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzugs can srog dang sdug bsngal dag / zag pa dang bcas /
analyzed: dri ma rnams ni zag pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro // gzugs can srog dang sdug bsngal dag / zag pa dang bcas /
translated: Because defilements are synonyms for contamination.üîΩThe seven material faculties, life force, and the two of pain and mental pain are contaminated.

original: dbang po gzugs can bdun dang / srog gi dbang po dang / sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dag ni gcig tu zag @111a * //üîΩpa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can bdun dang / srog gi dbang po dang / sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dag ni gcig tu zag @111a * // pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The seven material faculties, the life faculty, and the faculties of pain and mental pain are solely contaminated.

original: dgu rnam gnyis /
analyzed: dgu rnam gnyis /
translated: Nine are of two types.

original: yid dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dag dang / dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang / dbang po dgu po de dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dag go //üîΩrnam par smin pa yin pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: yid dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dag dang / dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang / dbang po dgu po de dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dag go // rnam par smin pa yin pa rnams ni du /
translated: the mental faculty, pleasure, mental pleasure, equanimity, the five beginning with faith, and the ninth, the vitality faculty.üîΩHow many faculties are results of retribution?

original: ma yin pa rnams ni du zhe na /üîΩri zhig gcig tu /
analyzed: ma yin pa rnams ni du zhe na / ri zhig gcig tu /
translated: How many are not results of retribution?

original: srog ni rnam smin bcu gnyis gnyis //
analyzed: srog ni rnam smin bcu gnyis gnyis //
translated: The vitality faculty is a result of retribution.üîΩThe vitality faculty is a result of retribution.

original: bcu gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: Which twelve?

original: tha ma brgyad dang yid mi bde /
analyzed: tha ma brgyad dang yid mi bde /
translated: The last eight and the mental faculty,

original: ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: with the exception of dissatisfaction.üîΩThe vitality faculty is a result of retribution.

original: dad pa la sogs pa tha ma brgyad dang / yid mi bde ba ma gtogs pa srog gi dbang po las gzhan bcu gnyis ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa tha ma brgyad dang / yid mi bde ba ma gtogs pa srog gi dbang po las gzhan bcu gnyis ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The other twelve faculties are of two kinds:

original: rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang / rnam par smin pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: they are either results of retribution or not results of retribution.

original: de la mig la sogs pa bdun rgyas pa las byung ba rnams ni rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la mig la sogs pa bdun rgyas pa las byung ba rnams ni rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
translated: The seven material faculties, eye, etc., when they are produced by retribution are not results of retribution.

original: lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The rest are results of retribution.

original: yid dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams ni dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can rnams dang / spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa rnams ni ci rigs par rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yid dang sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams ni dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can rnams dang / spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa rnams ni ci rigs par rnam par smin pa ma yin no //
translated: The mental faculty, the sensation of displeasure, the sensation of pleasure, the sensation of satisfaction, and the sensation of equanimity can be wholesome, unwholesome, or non-defined.üîΩThe wholesome, unwholesome, and non-defined sensations of the realm of desire are, respectively, agreeable, disagreeable, and neither agreeable nor disagreeable.

original: lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa yin pa'o //üîΩdbang po rnams la rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa ni du /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa yin pa'o // dbang po rnams la rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa ni du /
translated: The wholesome, unwholesome, and non-defined sensations of the realm of fine-materiality are, respectively, agreeable, disagreeable, and neither agreeable nor disagreeable.

original: rnam par smin pa med pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa med pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: The wholesome, unwholesome, and non-defined sensations of the realm of immateriality are, respectively, agreeable, disagreeable, and neither agreeable nor disagreeable.

original: gang 'di yid mi bde bar bshad ma thag pa /üîΩde gcig ni /
analyzed: gang 'di yid mi bde bar bshad ma thag pa / de gcig ni /
translated: The sensation of displeasure is always non-defined.

original: rnam par smin bcas /
analyzed: rnam par smin bcas /
translated: The other sensations are of two types.üîΩThe other sensations, i.e., the sensation of pleasure, the sensation of satisfaction, and the sensation of equanimity, are of two types: wholesome and unwholesome.

original: de gcig pu ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no //üîΩni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kho na zhes bya ba'i don dang / rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar rig par bya'o //üîΩbcu rnam gnyis /
analyzed: de gcig pu ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa kho na yin no // ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni kho na zhes bya ba'i don dang / rim pa bzhin du sbyar bar rig par bya'o // bcu rnam gnyis /
translated: The sensation of pleasure exists in the realm of desire and in the first meditation.

original: rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa dag kyang yin /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa dag kyang yin /
translated: The sensation of satisfaction exists in the realm of desire and in the first two meditations.üîΩThe sensation of equanimity exists in all three realms.

original: rnam par smin pa med pa dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa med pa dag kyang yin no //
translated: They are also without retribution.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: Which ten?

original: yid dang tshor gzhan dad la sogs //
analyzed: yid dang tshor gzhan dad la sogs //
translated: The mental faculty, the other sensations, faith, etc.

original: tshor gzhan zhes smos pas ni yid mi bde ba las gzhan pa'i gzung ngo //
analyzed: tshor gzhan zhes smos pas ni yid mi bde ba las gzhan pa'i gzung ngo //
translated: The other sensations refers to the sensations other than mental sensation.

original: de la yid dang bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms mi dge ba dang ; dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de la yid dang bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms mi dge ba dang ; dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa dag yin no //
translated: Among them, the mental faculty, the sensations of pleasure, satisfaction and equanimity, when they are unwholesome or wholesome and impure, are with retribution.

original: zag pa med pa rnams dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams dang lung du ma bstan pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa med pa dag yin no //
translated: When they are pure or non-defined, they are without retribution.

original: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ni dge ba dang mi dge ba ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ni dge ba dang mi dge ba ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The faculty of suffering, when it is wholesome or unwholesome, is with retribution.

original: lung du ma bstan pa ni rnam par smin @111b pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ni rnam par smin @111b pa med pa yin no //
translated: When it is non-defined, it is without retribution.

original: dad pa la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa dag yin no //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa dag yin no //
translated: Faith, etc., when they are impure, are with retribution.

original: zag pa med pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa med pa dag yin no //
translated: The pure factors are not susceptible to being ripened.

original: gzhan ni rnam par smin pa med pa dag yin zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam par smin pa med pa dag yin zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: The other factors are not susceptible to being ripened.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i dri ba la /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i dri ba la /
translated: The question of the wholesome, etc.

original: dge ba brgyad /
analyzed: dge ba brgyad /
translated: Eight are wholesome.üîΩFaith, diligence, etc.

original: dad pa la sogs pa gcig tu dge ba rnams so //üîΩyid mi bde ba /üîΩrnam gnyis / dge ba yang yin /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa gcig tu dge ba rnams so // yid mi bde ba / rnam gnyis / dge ba yang yin /
translated: are wholesome in their intrinsic nature.üîΩDiscontentedness is twofold.

original: mi dge ba yang ngo //
analyzed: mi dge ba yang ngo //
translated: It is wholesome or unwholesome.

original: yid dang tshor gzhan ni /
analyzed: yid dang tshor gzhan ni /
translated: The mental faculty and the other sensationsüîΩare threefold.

original: rnam gsum / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dag go //
analyzed: rnam gsum / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dag go //
translated: They are wholesome, unwholesome, or nondefined.üîΩThe other factors are of one single type.

original: gzhan ni rnam pa gcig / brgyad po dag ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na'o ;
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam pa gcig / brgyad po dag ni lung du ma bstan pa kho na'o ;
translated: The eight wholesome material factors are wholesome in their intrinsic nature.

original: / khams kyi dri ba la /
analyzed: / khams kyi dri ba la /
translated: The question of the realm.

original: dri med ma gtogs 'dod par gtogs //üîΩgcig tu zag pa med pa ma gtogs pa'i lhag ma ni srid pas 'dod par gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dri med ma gtogs 'dod par gtogs // gcig tu zag pa med pa ma gtogs pa'i lhag ma ni srid pas 'dod par gtogs pa'o //
translated: The eighteen elements that are not pure are of the realm of desire.

original: pho mo'i dbang dang sdug bsngal dag / ma gtogs gzugs gtogs /
analyzed: pho mo'i dbang dang sdug bsngal dag / ma gtogs gzugs gtogs /
translated: The two sexual faculties and the two disagreeable sensations,

original: dri ma med pa yang ma gtogs zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: dri ma med pa yang ma gtogs zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: with the exception of the pure ones, belong to the realm of desire.üîΩThe other material factors belong to the realm of fine-materiality.

original: sdug bsngal dag / ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dag / ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dag go //
translated: Suffering and dissatisfaction are the two sensations of pain and mental pain.

original: gzugs can dang / bde ba'ang ma gtogs gzugs med gtogs //
analyzed: gzugs can dang / bde ba'ang ma gtogs gzugs med gtogs //
translated: The formless realm is not included in the form realm, nor is it included in the realm of pleasure.

original: ji skad bshad pa ma gtogs pa'i lhag ma ci zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa ma gtogs pa'i lhag ma ci zhe na /
translated: What remains that is not included in the above?

original: yid dang / srog dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po dag dang / dad pa la sogs pa lnga po yang ngo //
analyzed: yid dang / srog dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po dag dang / dad pa la sogs pa lnga po yang ngo //
translated: The mental faculty, the life faculty, the faculty of equanimity, and the five beginning with faith.

original: spong ba'i dri ba la /üîΩyid dang tshor ba gsum rnam gsum //
analyzed: spong ba'i dri ba la / yid dang tshor ba gsum rnam gsum //
translated: The question of the faculties to be abandonedüîΩThe mental faculty and the three sensations are of three kinds.

original: tshor ba gsum ni bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms rnams so //
analyzed: tshor ba gsum ni bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms rnams so //
translated: The three sensations are pleasure, mental pleasure, and equanimity.

original: gnyis kyis spang bya yid mi bde //
analyzed: gnyis kyis spang bya yid mi bde //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is to be abandoned by both.

original: yid mi bde ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa gnyis kyis spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa gnyis kyis spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is to be abandoned by both the path of seeing and the path of cultivation.

original: dgu ni bsgom pas spang bar bya zhes pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: dgu ni bsgom pas spang bar bya zhes pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: Nine are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: mig la sogs pa dang brgyad pa srog dang sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag kho na yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dang brgyad pa srog dang sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag kho na yin no //
translated: The eight beginning with the eye faculty and the life faculty and the faculty of pain are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: lnga po ni spang bar bya ba yin yang /
analyzed: lnga po ni spang bar bya ba yin yang /
translated: The five are objects to be abandoned.üîΩ

original: dad pa la sogs pa lnga ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag ma yin pa yang ngo //üîΩgsum min gzhan gsum ni spang bya ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa lnga ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag ma yin pa yang ngo // gsum min gzhan gsum ni spang bya ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: The five faculties of faith, etc., are not susceptible to being abandoned by cultivation, because they are either impure or pure.

original: zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other three faculties are not susceptible to being abandoned, because they are pure.

original: rnam pa'i bye brag bshad zin nas rnyed pa brjod par bya ste /üîΩ'dod par dang po rnam smin gnyis //
analyzed: rnam pa'i bye brag bshad zin nas rnyed pa brjod par bya ste / 'dod par dang po rnam smin gnyis //
translated: Having explained the different types of faculties, we must now explain the acquisition of the faculties.üîΩIn the desire realm, one newly acquires two faculties that are results of the causes of karmic maturation.

original: rnyed de / lus kyi dbang po dang / srog gi dbang po'o //
analyzed: rnyed de / lus kyi dbang po dang / srog gi dbang po'o //
translated: The body faculty and the life faculty.

original: de dag kyang /üîΩrdzus te @112a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang / rdzus te @112a * //
translated: These are

original: skye bas min /
analyzed: skye bas min /
translated: not acquired by those who are born supernaturally.

original: rdzus te skye ba bkag pas sgo nga las skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba dang / drod gsher las skyes ba dag gis rnyed bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba bkag pas sgo nga las skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba dang / drod gsher las skyes ba dag gis rnyed bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Since those born supernaturally are excluded, it should be understood that those born from eggs, wombs, and heat and moisture acquire them.

original: yid dang btang snyoms dag kyang nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa las byung bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: yid dang btang snyoms dag kyang nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa las byung bdag ma yin no //
translated: The mental faculty and the sensation of equanimity are not of retribution when they are defiled, as is the case at conception.

original: yang rdzus te skye ba dag gis du zhig 'thob ce na /
analyzed: yang rdzus te skye ba dag gis du zhig 'thob ce na /
translated: How many controlling faculties are possessed by those who are born supernaturally?

original: de yis drug gam /
analyzed: de yis drug gam /
translated: They possess six.

original: gal te mtshan ma med pa zhig yin na ste /
analyzed: gal te mtshan ma med pa zhig yin na ste /
