translated: If they are sexless,

original: 'di ltar bskal pa dang po pa rnams lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bskal pa dang po pa rnams lta bu'o //
translated: like the beings of the first eon.

original: de dag gis mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / srog gi dbang po rnams 'thob bo //
analyzed: de dag gis mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / srog gi dbang po rnams 'thob bo //
translated: They possess the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and vital organs.

original: bdun nam ni /
analyzed: bdun nam ni /
translated: They possess seven,

original: gal te mtshan gcig pa zhig yin na ste /üîΩ'di ltar lta la sogs pa dag na'o //
analyzed: gal te mtshan gcig pa zhig yin na ste / 'di ltar lta la sogs pa dag na'o //
translated: if they are hermaphrodites.üîΩThey possess eight,

original: brgyad ni gal te mtshan gnyis pa zhig yin na'o //
analyzed: brgyad ni gal te mtshan gnyis pa zhig yin na'o //
translated: if they possess two sexual organs.

original: ji ltar ngan song dag na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ngan song dag na'o //
translated: As in the unfortunate destinies.

original: re zhig 'dod pa'i khams na ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'dod pa'i khams na ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is the case in the realm of desire.

original: gzugs na drug go //
analyzed: gzugs na drug go //
translated: In the realm of fine-materiality, six.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na mtshan ma med pa dag gis rnyed pa gang dag yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na mtshan ma med pa dag gis rnyed pa gang dag yin pa nyid do //
translated: In the realm of desire, the faculties of one who is without sexual organs or with two sexual organs obtain two.

original: gong mar gcig / gzugs med pa'i khams su dang po nyid du srog gi dbang po gcig kho na rnam par smin pa thob bo //
analyzed: gong mar gcig / gzugs med pa'i khams su dang po nyid du srog gi dbang po gcig kho na rnam par smin pa thob bo //
translated: In the realm of fine-materiality, one obtains only one, the vitality faculty, at the very beginning.

original: rnyed pa bshad zin nas gtong ba brjod pa /
analyzed: rnyed pa bshad zin nas gtong ba brjod pa /
translated: The faculties have been discussed.

original: gzugs med dag tu 'chi ba ni //
analyzed: gzugs med dag tu 'chi ba ni //
translated: The faculties are lost through death in the realm of immateriality,

original: srog dang yid dang btang snyoms nyid //
analyzed: srog dang yid dang btang snyoms nyid //
translated: the faculties of vitality, of mental faculty and of equanimity are lost.

original: 'gag par 'gyur ro gzugs na brgyad //
analyzed: 'gag par 'gyur ro gzugs na brgyad //
translated: In the realm of fine-materiality, eight faculties are lost at death.

original: gzugs kyi khams su 'chi ba na gsum po de dag dang / mig la sogs pa lnga dang dbang po brgyad 'gag go //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su 'chi ba na gsum po de dag dang / mig la sogs pa lnga dang dbang po brgyad 'gag go //
translated: In the realm of fine-materiality, the same three faculties and the five material faculties are lost.

original: 'dod par bcu'am dgu'am brgyad //
analyzed: 'dod par bcu'am dgu'am brgyad //
translated: In the realm of desire, ten, nine or eight faculties remain.

original: mtshan gnyis pa'i ni brgyad po de dag dang pho dang mo'i dbang po dang bcu 'gag go //
analyzed: mtshan gnyis pa'i ni brgyad po de dag dang pho dang mo'i dbang po dang bcu 'gag go //
translated: When one who possesses two sexual organs dies, ten faculties cease: the above-mentioned eight, the sexual organs and the vitality faculty.

original: mtshan gcig pa zhig yin na dgu'o //
analyzed: mtshan gcig pa zhig yin na dgu'o //
translated: When one who possesses one sexual organ dies, nine faculties cease.

original: mtshan med pa zhig yin na brgyad do //
analyzed: mtshan med pa zhig yin na brgyad do //
translated: When one who does not possess a sexual organ dies, eight faculties cease.

original: rim gyis 'chi ba dag la bzhi /
analyzed: rim gyis 'chi ba dag la bzhi /
translated: When death is gradual, four faculties cease at the very end.

original: rim gyis 'chi na lus dang srog dang yid dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po dag 'gag go //
analyzed: rim gyis 'chi na lus dang srog dang yid dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po dag 'gag go //
translated: If death is gradual, the body sensefaculty, the vitality faculty, the mental faculty and the faculty of equanimity cease.üîΩIf death is through a wholesome thought, then the five faculties of faith, etc., are added.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis 'chi ba la ni tshul de'o //üîΩdge ba'i sems kyis kyang /üîΩdge la thams cad dag tu lnga //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyis 'chi ba la ni tshul de'o // dge ba'i sems kyis kyang / dge la thams cad dag tu lnga //
translated: If death is through a defiled or nondefined thought, then the faculties cease in the manner that has been described.üîΩIf death is through a wholesome thought, then the five faculties of faith, etc., are added.

original: thams cad du ji skad bshad pa'i dbang po rnams dang lhag par dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni dge ba'i sems kyis 'chi ba la rig bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du ji skad bshad pa'i dbang po rnams dang lhag par dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga ni dge ba'i sems kyis 'chi ba la rig bar bya'o //
translated: In all cases, the five faculties of which the first is faith, are added to the faculties that have been mentioned in the above three paragraphs.

original: dbang po'i skabs su dbang po'i chos thams cad dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i skabs su dbang po'i chos thams cad dpyad par bya ste /
translated: In the chapter on the faculties, all the questions concerning the faculties should be examined.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu gang zhig dbang po du dag gis 'thob ce na /üîΩ'bras bu @112b tha ma gnyis dgus 'thob //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu gang zhig dbang po du dag gis 'thob ce na / 'bras bu @112b tha ma gnyis dgus 'thob //
translated: By how many controlling faculties are the fruits of the life of a religious practitioner obtained?üîΩThe last two fruits are obtained by nine controlling faculties.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu dag ni dbang po dgus thob bo //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu dag ni dbang po dgus thob bo //
translated: The fruits of the once-returner and of the perfected being are obtained by nine controlling faculties.

original: de la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni dad pa la sogs pa dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ma gtogs pa dang / yid dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po dag dang dgus 'thob po ;
analyzed: de la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni dad pa la sogs pa dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po ma gtogs pa dang / yid dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po dag dang dgus 'thob po ;
translated: The result of stream entry is obtained by nine faculties: the five such as faith, the mental faculty, the faculty of equanimity and either pleasure or mental satisfaction.

original: / zag pa med pa gnyis kyang bral bas thob pa 'dren pa dang gnas par byed pa nyid kyi phyir rim pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / zag pa med pa gnyis kyang bral bas thob pa 'dren pa dang gnas par byed pa nyid kyi phyir rim pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The two uncontaminated faculties are respectively known as the faculty of final knowledge and the faculty of having final knowledge because they respectively induce and maintain the obtainment of separation from defilements.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid ni dad pa la sogs pa dang / kun shes byed pa'i dbang po ma gtogs pa dag dang / yid kyi dbang po dang / bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig dang / dgus 'thob bo //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid ni dad pa la sogs pa dang / kun shes byed pa'i dbang po ma gtogs pa dag dang / yid kyi dbang po dang / bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig dang / dgus 'thob bo //
translated: The state of an arhat is obtained by nine faculties: the five such as faith, the mental faculty, the faculty of equanimity and either the faculty of pleasure, mental satisfaction or mental dissatisfaction.

original: gnyis ni bdun dang brgyad dang dgus //üîΩde la re zhig gal te /
analyzed: gnyis ni bdun dang brgyad dang dgus // de la re zhig gal te /
translated: Two are obtained by seven, eight and nine.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mthar gyis thob la /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mthar gyis thob la /
translated: First, if the result of once return is obtained in stages,üîΩit is obtained by seven faculties: the five such as faith, the mental faculty and the faculty of equanimity.

original: de yang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob na ni dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang / btang snyoms dang / yid kyi dbang po dang dbang po bdun dag gis 'thob po //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob na ni dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang / btang snyoms dang / yid kyi dbang po dang dbang po bdun dag gis 'thob po //
translated: If the fruit of non-returner is obtained by the mundane path, it is obtained by seven controlling faculties, as in the case of the fruit of stream-enterer.

original: 'on te 'jig rten las 'das pas ni kun shes pa'i dbang po brgyad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te 'jig rten las 'das pas ni kun shes pa'i dbang po brgyad pa yin no //
translated: If it is obtained by the supramundane path, it is obtained by eight controlling faculties, as in the case of the fruit of oncereturner.

original: ci ste phal cher la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig gis 'thob na ni de dgus 'thob ste /üîΩde gang dag kho nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa kho na bzhin no //üîΩgal te phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mthar gyis thob la /
analyzed: ci ste phal cher la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig gis 'thob na ni de dgus 'thob ste / de gang dag kho nas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa kho na bzhin no // gal te phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mthar gyis thob la /
translated: If the fruit of non-returner is obtained by a person who is detached from the realm of desire, it is obtained by nine controlling faculties, as in the case of the fruit of stream-enterer.üîΩIf the fruit of non-returner is obtained by a person who is not detached from the realm of desire, it is obtained by seven controlling faculties, as in the case of the fruit of oncereturner.

original: de 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dag gis thob na lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu bzhin du bdun dang brgyad kyis 'thob bo //üîΩci ste 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig gis thob na ni de dgus 'thob ste /
analyzed: de 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dag gis thob na lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu bzhin du bdun dang brgyad kyis 'thob bo // ci ste 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig gis thob na ni de dgus 'thob ste /
translated: If the fruit of non-returner is obtained by a person who is detached from the realm of desire, it is obtained by eight controlling faculties, as in the case of the fruit of oncereturner.üîΩIf the fruit of non-returner is obtained by a person who is detached from the realm of desire, it is obtained by nine controlling faculties, as in the case of the fruit of stream-enterer.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: If the fruit of perfected being is obtained by a person who is detached from the realm of desire, it is obtained by nine controlling faculties, as in the case of the fruit of stream-enterer.üîΩIf the fruit of perfected being is obtained by a person who is not detached from the realm of desire, it is obtained by ten controlling faculties, namely, the last eight controlling faculties, the faculty of coming to know what is as yet unknown and the faculty of perfect knowledge.

original: yang 'dir rten gyi bye brag las bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig yin no //
analyzed: yang 'dir rten gyi bye brag las bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig yin no //
translated: Also, in this context, any of the faculties of pleasure, mental satisfaction, or equanimity is a faculty of a specific basis.

original: 'o na chos mngon pa las dbang po du zhig gis dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob ce na /
analyzed: 'o na chos mngon pa las dbang po du zhig gis dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob ce na /
translated: How many faculties does one obtain when one obtains the state of an arhat?

original: smras pa / bcu gcig gis zhes bshad pa ji ltar dgu dag gis she na /
analyzed: smras pa / bcu gcig gis zhes bshad pa ji ltar dgu dag gis she na /
translated: It was said that one obtains it through eleven, but how is it obtained through nine?

original: de ni dgu kho nas 'thob ste /
analyzed: de ni dgu kho nas 'thob ste /
translated: It is obtained through nine.

original: bcu gcig dag gis dgra bcom nyid //
analyzed: bcu gcig dag gis dgra bcom nyid //
translated: The state of an arhat is obtained through eleven.

original: 'ga' zhig srid phyir bshad pa yin //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig srid phyir bshad pa yin //
translated: But it is explained that it is possible for some.

original: gang zag 'ga' zhig gis yongs su nyams shing yongs su nyams nas bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po @113a * //
analyzed: gang zag 'ga' zhig gis yongs su nyams shing yongs su nyams nas bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po @113a * //
translated: It is possible that some individuals obtain the state of an arhat through the faculties of pleasure, mental satisfaction, or equanimity, having regressed from the faculty of perfect knowledge.

original: dag gis dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa srid pa yod pas de'i phyir bcu gcig dag gis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dag gis dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa srid pa yod pas de'i phyir bcu gcig dag gis zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is said that it is obtained through eleven.

original: dbang po gang zhig dang ldan na gdon mi za bar dbang po du dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po gang zhig dang ldan na gdon mi za bar dbang po du dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: When one possesses a certain faculty, how many faculties must one possess?

original: de la / btang snyoms dang ni srog dang ni //
analyzed: de la / btang snyoms dang ni srog dang ni //
translated: The faculties of equanimity, life,

original: yid dang ldan la nges gsum ldan //
analyzed: yid dang ldan la nges gsum ldan //
translated: mind, and the two pure faculties are necessarily possessed together.

original: de ni gdon mi za bar gsum kho na ste /
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar gsum kho na ste /
translated: One who possesses these three faculties necessarily possesses three faculties.üîΩThese faculties are not possessed separately from each other.

original: 'di dag ni phan tshun med na mi ldan pa yin gyi lhag ma rnams dang ni ma nges te /üîΩldan pa yang yod /
analyzed: 'di dag ni phan tshun med na mi ldan pa yin gyi lhag ma rnams dang ni ma nges te / ldan pa yang yod /
translated: But the other faculties are not necessarily possessed together.

original: mi ldan pa yang yod do //
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang yod do //
translated: One may or may not possess them.üîΩOne who possesses the faculty of pleasure possesses four.

original: bde lus ldan la bzhi dag dang // gang bde ba dang lus dag dang ldan pa de ni dbang po bzhi ste /üîΩde gsum dang 'di dag gi gcig lhag pas so //üîΩmig sogs ldan pa lnga dang ldan //
analyzed: bde lus ldan la bzhi dag dang // gang bde ba dang lus dag dang ldan pa de ni dbang po bzhi ste / de gsum dang 'di dag gi gcig lhag pas so // mig sogs ldan pa lnga dang ldan //
translated: One who possesses the faculty of pleasure necessarily possesses four faculties:üîΩthe faculty of pleasure itself, the faculty of life force, the faculty of equanimity, and the faculty of mind.üîΩOne who possesses the eye faculty possesses five.üîΩOne who possesses the eye faculty necessarily possesses five faculties:

original: gang zhig mig gi dbang po ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar btang snyoms dang / srog dang / yid dang / lus kyi dbang po dag dang de dang dbang po lnga dang ldan te /
analyzed: gang zhig mig gi dbang po ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar btang snyoms dang / srog dang / yid dang / lus kyi dbang po dag dang de dang dbang po lnga dang ldan te /
translated: the faculty of equanimity, the faculty of life force, the faculty of mind, the faculty of the body, and the eye faculty itself.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce'i dbang po dag dang ldan pa yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //üîΩyid bde ldan yang /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce'i dbang po dag dang ldan pa yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o // yid bde ldan yang /
translated: The same applies to those who possess the ear, nose and tongue faculties.üîΩThose who possess the faculty of mental satisfaction also possess five faculties.

original: gang zhig yid bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa de yang gdon mi za bar btang snyoms dang / srog dang / yid dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / dbang po lnga dang ldan no //üîΩsdug bsngal ldan /
analyzed: gang zhig yid bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa de yang gdon mi za bar btang snyoms dang / srog dang / yid dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / dbang po lnga dang ldan no // sdug bsngal ldan /
translated: Those who possess the faculty of mental satisfaction definitely possess five faculties: the faculties of mental satisfaction, life force, mind and the faculty of equanimity and one of the faculties of pleasure or pain.

original: bdun dang / gang zhig sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar lus dang / srog dang / yid dag dang / tshor ba'i dbang po bzhi dang bdun dang ldan no //üîΩmo'i dbang sogs ldan /
analyzed: bdun dang / gang zhig sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar lus dang / srog dang / yid dag dang / tshor ba'i dbang po bzhi dang bdun dang ldan no // mo'i dbang sogs ldan /
translated: Those who possess the faculty of pain definitely possess seven faculties: the body, life force, mind, four faculties of feeling and the faculty of pain.

original: brgyad dang / gang zhig mo'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar bdun po de dag dang mo'i dang brgyad dang ldan no //
analyzed: brgyad dang / gang zhig mo'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar bdun po de dag dang mo'i dang brgyad dang ldan no //
translated: Those who possess the female faculty definitely possess eight faculties: the seven mentioned previously and the female faculty.üîΩThose who possess the male faculty definitely possess eight faculties: the seven mentioned previously and the male faculty.

original: sogs zhes bya ba'i sgras ni pho'i dbang po dang / yid mi bde ba dang / dad pa la sogs pa gzung ste /
analyzed: sogs zhes bya ba'i sgras ni pho'i dbang po dang / yid mi bde ba dang / dad pa la sogs pa gzung ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to the male faculty, the mental faculty, and the faculty of mental pleasure.

original: de dag dang ldan pa ni re re zhing yang brgyad dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa ni re re zhing yang brgyad dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Those who possess these faculties also possess eight faculties:

original: bdun po de dag dang / pho'i dbang po dang ldan no //
analyzed: bdun po de dag dang / pho'i dbang po dang ldan no //
translated: the seven faculties of sensation, plus the male faculty.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Those who possess the faculty of mental pleasure also possess these eight faculties.üîΩThose who possess the faculty of faith also possess five faculties:

original: dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni lnga po de dag dang / btang snyoms dang / srog dang / yid dang ldan no //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa ni lnga po de dag dang / btang snyoms dang / srog dang / yid dang ldan no //
translated: the faculty of pleasure, the faculty of mental pleasure, the faculty of indifference, the vital faculty, and the mental faculty.

original: kun shes ldan pa yi //
analyzed: kun shes ldan pa yi //
translated: Those who possess the faculty of perfect knowledge

original: dbang po ldan la bcu gcig ldan //
analyzed: dbang po ldan la bcu gcig ldan //
translated: possess eleven faculties.üîΩThose who possess the faculty of perfect knowledge also possess eleven faculties: the five faculties of sensation, the vital faculty, the mental faculty, the faculty of perfect knowledge, and the faculty of final and perfect knowledge.

original: gang zhig kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang / srog dang / yid dang dad pa la sogs pa dag dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang /
analyzed: gang zhig kun shes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa de ni gdon mi za bar bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang / srog dang / yid dang dad pa la sogs pa dag dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang /
translated: Those who possess the faculty of final and perfect knowledge

original: bcu gcig dang ldan no //
analyzed: bcu gcig dang ldan no //
translated: possess eleven faculties.üîΩThose who possess the faculty of final and perfect knowledge also possess eleven faculties: the five faculties of sensation, the vital faculty, the mental faculty, the faculty of final and perfect knowledge, and the faculty of perfect knowledge.

original: de bzhin du kun @113b shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa yang bcu po de dag nyid dang kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang ldan no //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun @113b shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa yang bcu po de dag nyid dang kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang ldan no //
translated: Likewise, one who possesses the faculty of perfect knowledge possesses the above ten faculties and the faculty of perfect knowledge.

original: kun shes byed pa'i dbang ldan la //
analyzed: kun shes byed pa'i dbang ldan la //
translated: One who possesses the faculty of producing complete knowledge

original: bcu gsum ngag dang ldan pa yin //
analyzed: bcu gsum ngag dang ldan pa yin //
translated: possesses thirteen faculties.

original: yid dang / srog dang / lus kyi dbang po dag dang / tshor ba'i dbang po bzhi dag dang / dad pa la sogs pa dang ; kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang ldan no //
analyzed: yid dang / srog dang / lus kyi dbang po dag dang / tshor ba'i dbang po bzhi dag dang / dad pa la sogs pa dang ; kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang ldan no //
translated: He possesses the mental faculty, the life faculty, the body faculty, the four controlling faculties of sensation, the five faculties of faith, etc., and the faculty of producing complete knowledge.

original: gang zhig nang na nyung ba dang ldan pa de dbang po ji snyed cig dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig nang na nyung ba dang ldan pa de dbang po ji snyed cig dang ldan zhe na /
translated: How many faculties does one possess who possesses the least number of faculties?

original: dge med nang na nyung ldan pa //
analyzed: dge med nang na nyung ldan pa //
translated: One who possesses the least number of pure faculties

original: lus tshor srog yid brgyad dang ldan //
analyzed: lus tshor srog yid brgyad dang ldan //
translated: possesses eight: body, sensation, life, and mind.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa ste /
translated: One who has cut off the wholesome roots possesses the least number of pure faculties.

original: de nang na nyung ba dag dang ldan na tshor ba lnga dag dang / lus dang / yid dang / srog dang / dbang po brgyad dang ldan no //
analyzed: de nang na nyung ba dag dang ldan na tshor ba lnga dag dang / lus dang / yid dang / srog dang / dbang po brgyad dang ldan no //
translated: When he possesses the least number of faculties, he possesses eight faculties: the five sensations, the body faculty, the mind faculty, and the life faculty.

original: ji ltar dge ba med pa ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar dge ba med pa ltar //
translated: Just as there is no virtue,üîΩso too there is no formless realm for the immature.üîΩThe formless realm is not a realm of the immature bƒÅla, just as there is no virtue.üîΩThe formless realm is not a realm of the immature bƒÅla, just as there is no virtue.

original: gzugs med byis pa'ang de bzhin te //üîΩbtang snyoms srog yid dge rnams dang // so so'i skye bo btang snyoms dang // srog dang / yid dang / dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang ldan no //üîΩyang gang zhig nang na dbang po mang po dang ldan pa de ji snyed cig dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs med byis pa'ang de bzhin te // btang snyoms srog yid dge rnams dang // so so'i skye bo btang snyoms dang // srog dang / yid dang / dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang ldan no // yang gang zhig nang na dbang po mang po dang ldan pa de ji snyed cig dang ldan zhe na /
translated: The formless realm is not a realm of the immature bƒÅla, just as there is no virtue.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.

original: mang por ldan na bcu dgu ste //üîΩdri ma med rnams ma gtogs so //
analyzed: mang por ldan na bcu dgu ste // dri ma med rnams ma gtogs so //
translated: One who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.

original: mtshan gnyis / zag pa med pa gsum ma gtogs pa mtshan gnyis pa ni bcu dgu dang ldan no //üîΩgzhan yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: mtshan gnyis / zag pa med pa gsum ma gtogs pa mtshan gnyis pa ni bcu dgu dang ldan no // gzhan yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: One who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.

original: 'phags pa chags bcas te /
analyzed: 'phags pa chags bcas te /
translated: One who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.

original: mtshan gcig dri med gnyis ma gtogs //
analyzed: mtshan gcig dri med gnyis ma gtogs //
translated: One who possesses the most among the controlling faculties possesses nineteen.üîΩOne who possesses the most among the controlling faculties

original: slob pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba mtshan gcig pa kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang gnyis po las gang yang rung ba gcig dang ldan pa ma gtogs pa bcu dgu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba mtshan gcig pa kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po dang gnyis po las gang yang rung ba gcig dang ldan pa ma gtogs pa bcu dgu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Those in training who are not detached from the realm of desire possess nineteen controlling faculties, with the exception of one of the two controlling faculties of those who are not learners and who are not perfected beings.

original: dbang po rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rgyas par bshad zin nas /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba rgyas par bshad zin nas /
translated: The detailed explanation of the controlling faculties is completed.

original: 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: We must now examine the following question:

original: kyi 'dus byas kyi chos 'di dag ji ltar mtshan nyid tha dad pa de bzhin du tha dad par skye ba zhig yin nam /
analyzed: kyi 'dus byas kyi chos 'di dag ji ltar mtshan nyid tha dad pa de bzhin du tha dad par skye ba zhig yin nam /
translated: Do all conditioned factors arise in the same way that they are defined?

original: 'on te kha cig nges par lhan cig skye ba yang yod ce na /üîΩsmras pa / yod de /
analyzed: 'on te kha cig nges par lhan cig skye ba yang yod ce na / smras pa / yod de /
translated: Or, are some of them necessarily generated together?

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba dag dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni gzugs dang / sems dang sems las byung ba dag dang / sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: All conditioned factors are included in five groups: material form, thought, thought concomitants, factors not directly associated with thought, and the unconditioned factors.

original: de la 'dus ma byas la ni skye ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la 'dus ma byas la ni skye ba med pa nyid do //
translated: The unconditioned factors are not generated.

original: chos gzugs can rnams kyi nges pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: chos gzugs can rnams kyi nges pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The material factors are subject to the following rule:

original: 'dod na dbang po med pa dang / sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad //üîΩthams cad las phra ba'i gzugs ni bsags @114a * //
analyzed: 'dod na dbang po med pa dang / sgra med phra rab rdul rdzas brgyad // thams cad las phra ba'i gzugs ni bsags @114a * //
translated: If it is without faculties, it is an atom of the desire realm.üîΩThe most subtle form is called the most subtle particle.

original: pa'i rdul phra rab ces bya ste /
analyzed: pa'i rdul phra rab ces bya ste /
translated: The most subtle form is called the most subtle particle paramƒÅ·πáu.

original: de 'dod pa'i khams na sgra yang med dbang po yang med pa zhig yin na ni rdzas brgyad dang ldan par skye ste /
analyzed: de 'dod pa'i khams na sgra yang med dbang po yang med pa zhig yin na ni rdzas brgyad dang ldan par skye ste /
translated: If it is without sound and without faculties in the desire realm, it arises with eight substances.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams so //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams so //
translated: It arises with the four great elements and form, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: lus dbang ldan la rdzas dgu'o //
analyzed: lus dbang ldan la rdzas dgu'o //
translated: If it possesses the body faculty, it arises with nine substances.

original: gang rdzas brgyad dang / lus kyi dbang po yod pa de ni de nyid dang dgu'o //
analyzed: gang rdzas brgyad dang / lus kyi dbang po yod pa de ni de nyid dang dgu'o //
translated: If it possesses eight substances and the body faculty, it arises with nine substances.

original: dbang po gzhan ldan rdzas bcu'o //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan ldan rdzas bcu'o //
translated: If it possesses other faculties, it arises with ten substances.

original: gang la mig la sogs pa gang yang rung ba zhig yod pa de kho na dang bcu pa'o //
analyzed: gang la mig la sogs pa gang yang rung ba zhig yod pa de kho na dang bcu pa'o //
translated: If it possesses any of the faculties of the eyes and so on, it arises with ten substances.

original: de dag sgra dang bcas pa zhig tu skye na yang rdzas dgu dang / bcu dang / bcu gcig dang ldan no //
analyzed: de dag sgra dang bcas pa zhig tu skye na yang rdzas dgu dang / bcu dang / bcu gcig dang ldan no //
translated: If it arises with sound, it arises with nine, ten, or eleven substances.

original: rdzas kyi sgra yang 'dir 'gyur ba'i rigs kyi don to ;
analyzed: rdzas kyi sgra yang 'dir 'gyur ba'i rigs kyi don to ;
translated: The term substance here means a class of things.

original: / de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa so sor 'byung ba bzhi la brten par 'dod do //
analyzed: / de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa so sor 'byung ba bzhi la brten par 'dod do //
translated: Similarly, form and so on are asserted to be supported on the four primary elements.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rdzas kyi sgra ni skye mched kyi don can no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rdzas kyi sgra ni skye mched kyi don can no //
translated: The term substance in the phrase ‚Äúform is the substance of the eye‚Äù means the sense base.

original: de lta na yang dbyibs la sogs par grub bo //
analyzed: de lta na yang dbyibs la sogs par grub bo //
translated: Thus form and so on are established as shape and so on.

original: gzugs can rnams kyi nges par lhan cig 'byung ba bshad zin nas lhag ma rnams kyi brjod par bya ste /üîΩsems dang sems byung nges lhan cig / thams cad 'dus byas mtshan nyid dang // thob pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs can rnams kyi nges par lhan cig 'byung ba bshad zin nas lhag ma rnams kyi brjod par bya ste / sems dang sems byung nges lhan cig / thams cad 'dus byas mtshan nyid dang // thob pa'am /
translated: The specific and general characteristics of conditioned states and the characteristics of the unconditioned have already been explained.üîΩThe specific and general characteristics of the primary elements and so on have not yet been explained.

original: thob pa dang ni sems can du ston pa kho na dang lhan cig skye'i gzhan dang ni ma yin no zhes bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //üîΩsems las byung ba rnams zhes brjod pa sems las byung ba de dag gang zhe na /

original: sems byung rnam lnga ste /
analyzed: sems byung rnam lnga ste /
translated: The specific and general characteristics of the primary elements and so on

original: sa mang la sogs tha dad phyir //
analyzed: sa mang la sogs tha dad phyir //
translated: Because the great grounds and so on are different.üîΩ

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: because the universal mental factors and so on are different.üîΩWhat are they?

original: sa mang po dag dang / dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa rnams dang / mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa pa rnams so //
analyzed: sa mang po dag dang / dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa rnams dang / mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa rnams dang / nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa pa rnams so //
translated: The universal mental factors, the beneficial mental factors, the afflictive mental factors, the nonvirtuous mental factors, and the small afflictive mental factors.

original: tshor dang sems pa 'du shes dang// 'dun dang reg dang blo gros dran //
analyzed: tshor dang sems pa 'du shes dang// 'dun dang reg dang blo gros dran //
translated: Feeling, volition, perception, aspiration, contact, understanding, mindfulness,

original: yid la byed dang mos pa dang // ting nge 'dzin sems thams cad la //
analyzed: yid la byed dang mos pa dang // ting nge 'dzin sems thams cad la //
translated: attention, resolve, and concentration are in all minds.

original: de la tshor ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la tshor ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: Feeling has already been explained.

original: sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa ni sems mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: Volition is the mental factor that activates the mind.

original: 'du shes ni brjod zin to //
analyzed: 'du shes ni brjod zin to //
translated: Perception has already been explained.

original: 'dun pa ni byed 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa ni byed 'dod pa'o //
translated: Aspiration is the desire to act.

original: reg pa ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa 'dun pa las skyes pa'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa 'dun pa las skyes pa'i reg pa'o //
translated: Contact is the contact that arises from the convergence of the object, the sense faculty, and consciousness.

original: blo gros ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: blo gros ni shes rab ste /
translated: Understanding is wisdom.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: It is the discernment of phenomena.

original: dran pa ni dmigs pa ma brjed pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni dmigs pa ma brjed pa'o //
translated: Mindfulness is the nondisappearance of the object.

original: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi 'jug pa'o //
translated: Mental attention is the engagement of the mind.

original: mos pa ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Faith is the desire for the real nature of things.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Concentration is the one-pointedness of the mind.

original: 'di dag ni sa thams cad la 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di dag ni sa thams cad la 'byung ngo //
translated: These are found in all stages.

original: dad dang @114b bag yod shin tu sbyangs //
analyzed: dad dang @114b bag yod shin tu sbyangs //
translated: Faith, heedfulness, serenity,

original: btang snyoms ngo tsha shes khrel yod //
analyzed: btang snyoms ngo tsha shes khrel yod //
translated: equanimity, shame, embarrassment,

original: rtsa ba gnyis rnam mi 'tshe dang // brtson 'grus rtag tu dge la 'byung //
analyzed: rtsa ba gnyis rnam mi 'tshe dang // brtson 'grus rtag tu dge la 'byung //
translated: nonviolence, and vigor always occur in the virtuous.

original: de la dad pa ni sems dang ba'o //
analyzed: de la dad pa ni sems dang ba'o //
translated: Among these, faith is the clarity of mind.

original: bag yod pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: bag yod pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa ste /
translated: Heedfulness is the cultivation of virtuous dharmas.

original: de dag la gces su 'dzin pas kun du srung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag la gces su 'dzin pas kun du srung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is called complete protection because it cherishes them.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid do //
translated: Serenity is the serviceability of mind.

original: btang snyoms ni sems mnyam pa nyid dang sems lhun gyis grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni sems mnyam pa nyid dang sems lhun gyis grub pa nyid do //
translated: Equanimity is the equality of mind and the spontaneity of mind.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Shame and embarrassment will be explained below.

original: rtsa ba gnyis ni chags pa med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dag go //
analyzed: rtsa ba gnyis ni chags pa med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dag go //
translated: The two roots are non-greed and non-hatred.

original: gti mug med pa yang yod mod kyi de yang shes rab ste /
analyzed: gti mug med pa yang yod mod kyi de yang shes rab ste /
translated: Non-delusion also exists, but it is wisdom.

original: sa mang po par bshad do //
analyzed: sa mang po par bshad do //
translated: It is explained as a universal.

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'o //
translated: Non-violence is non-harmfulness.

original: brtson 'grus ni dge ba la sems mngon par spro ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni dge ba la sems mngon par spro ba'o //
translated: Vigor is the mental factor that is the opposite of laziness.

original: 'di dag ni dge ba'i sems thams cad la 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni dge ba'i sems thams cad la 'byung ba'o //
translated: These ten are the virtuous mental factors that occur in all virtuous minds.

original: rmongs dang bag med le lo dang // ma dad pa dang rmugs dang rgod //
analyzed: rmongs dang bag med le lo dang // ma dad pa dang rmugs dang rgod //
translated: Sloth, non-faith, and lethargy

original: nyon mongs can la rtag tu 'byung //üîΩde la rmongs pa ni mi shes pa dang mi gsal ba'o //üîΩbag med pa ni bag yod ba'i mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs can la rtag tu 'byung // de la rmongs pa ni mi shes pa dang mi gsal ba'o // bag med pa ni bag yod ba'i mi mthun pa'o //
translated: always occur in afflicted minds.

original: le lo ni brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun ba'i phyogs so //
analyzed: le lo ni brtson 'grus kyi mi mthun ba'i phyogs so //
translated: Sloth is the opposite of vigor.

original: ma dad pa ni dad pa'i mi mthun pa'o //üîΩrmugs pa ni sems las su mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: ma dad pa ni dad pa'i mi mthun pa'o // rmugs pa ni sems las su mi rung ba'o //
translated: Non-faith is the opposite of faith.üîΩLethargy is the opposite of pliancy.

original: rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba ste /
analyzed: rgod pa ni sems rnam par ma zhi ba ste /
translated: Excitement is the opposite of mental stability.

original: 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sems thams cad la 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa can gyi sems thams cad la 'byung ngo //
translated: These mental factors occur in all defiled minds.

original: mi dge la ni khrel med dang // ngo tsha med pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge la ni khrel med dang // ngo tsha med pa'o //
translated: Non-modesty and shamelessness are in the unwholesome.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid ni 'og nas 'chad do //üîΩkhro ba dang / khon du 'dzin dang g-yo dang ni //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid ni 'og nas 'chad do // khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin dang g-yo dang ni //
translated: Their characteristics will be explained later.üîΩAnger, enmity, dissimulation,

original: phrag dog 'tshig 'chab ser sna dang // sgyu dang rgyags dang rnam 'tshe ni //
analyzed: phrag dog 'tshig 'chab ser sna dang // sgyu dang rgyags dang rnam 'tshe ni //
translated: Jealousy, spite, concealment, avarice, deceit, intoxication, harmfulness,

original: nyon mongs chung ngu'i sa pa rnams /
analyzed: nyon mongs chung ngu'i sa pa rnams /
translated: are the secondary defilements.

original: 'di dag ni ma rig pa tsam dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / yid kyi sa pa kho na dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa par brjod do //
analyzed: 'di dag ni ma rig pa tsam dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / yid kyi sa pa kho na dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i sa par brjod do //
translated: They are called secondary defilements because they are associated only with the primary defilement of ignorance, because they are abandoned by the path of cultivation, and because they are on the level of the mental faculty alone.

original: 'di dag gi rgyas par bshad pa ni phyis 'chad do //
analyzed: 'di dag gi rgyas par bshad pa ni phyis 'chad do //
translated: Their detailed explanation will come later.

original: sems gang zhig la sems las byung ba du zhig gdon mi za bar 'byung ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sems gang zhig la sems las byung ba du zhig gdon mi za bar 'byung ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: We must now explain how many mental factors are necessarily associated with each kind of mind.

original: re zhig 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems ni rnam pa lnga ste dge ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems ni rnam pa lnga ste dge ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the realm of desire, there are five kinds of minds: wholesome, unwholesome, obscured-non-defined, unobscured-non-defined, and undefined.

original: de la / 'dod pa'i dge ba'i sems la ni //
analyzed: de la / 'dod pa'i dge ba'i sems la ni //
translated: In the desire realm, in a virtuous mind,üîΩthere are twenty-two mental factors,

original: rtog dang dpyod dang bcas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rtog dang dpyod dang bcas pa'i phyir //
translated: because it possesses investigation and analysis.

original: sems las byung ba nyi shu gnyis //üîΩsa mang po pa @115a * //
analyzed: sems las byung ba nyi shu gnyis // sa mang po pa @115a * //
translated: The ten universal mental states,

original: bcu dang / dge ba'i mang po pa bcu dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dag go //
analyzed: bcu dang / dge ba'i mang po pa bcu dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dag go //
translated: the ten virtuous mental states, and both investigation and analysis.

original: la la dag tu 'gyod pa bsnan //
analyzed: la la dag tu 'gyod pa bsnan //
translated: In some, regret is added.

original: de la gang dge ba ma byas pa dang / mi dge ba byas nas gdung ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la gang dge ba ma byas pa dang / mi dge ba byas nas gdung ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: In this regard, regret is remorse about something nonvirtuous that one has done or about something virtuous that one has not done.

original: de ni mi dge ba byas pa la dmigs pa'i yid la gcags pa dge ba la 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mi dge ba byas pa la dmigs pa'i yid la gcags pa dge ba la 'gyod pa'o //
translated: It is virtuous regret that focuses on nonvirtuous actions that have been done.

original: de ni gang la yod pa de la sems las byung ba nyi shu rtsa gsum 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni gang la yod pa de la sems las byung ba nyi shu rtsa gsum 'byung ngo //
translated: When it exists, there are twenty-three mental factors.üîΩIn nonvirtuous minds and in those possessing view,

original: mi dge la ni ma 'dres dang // lta dang ldan pa'ang nyi shu 'byung //
analyzed: mi dge la ni ma 'dres dang // lta dang ldan pa'ang nyi shu 'byung //
translated: there are twenty.

original: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni sems gang lam rig pa 'ba' zhig pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni sems gang lam rig pa 'ba' zhig pa ste /
translated: Unmixed means a mind that is only nonvirtuous.

original: de la sa mang po pa bcu dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa drug dang / mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa gnyis dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la sa mang po pa bcu dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa drug dang / mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa gnyis dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa'o //
translated: There are ten universal mental activities, six root and secondary afflictions, two unwholesome mental activities, and initial and sustained thought.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.

original: mi dge ba'i lta ba dang ldan pa yang nyi shu 'byung ste /üîΩgang kho na ma 'dres pa la'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i lta ba dang ldan pa yang nyi shu 'byung ste / gang kho na ma 'dres pa la'o //
translated: When there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.

original: lta ba yang mi dge ba 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pas bsnan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba yang mi dge ba 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pas bsnan pa ma yin no //
translated: When there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.

original: nyon mongs bzhi dang khro sogs dang // 'gyod pa dang ni nyi shu gcig / de la nyon mongs pa bzhi ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / the tshom mo //üîΩkhro ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: nyon mongs bzhi dang khro sogs dang // 'gyod pa dang ni nyi shu gcig / de la nyon mongs pa bzhi ni 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / nga rgyal dang / the tshom mo // khro ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: When there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.üîΩWhen there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.

original: 'gyod pa ni mi dge ba ste dge ba las bzlog pas so //
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni mi dge ba ste dge ba las bzlog pas so //
translated: When there is an unwholesome view, there are twenty mental activities.

original: 'di dag gang la yod pa de ni nyi shu rtsa gcig yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag gang la yod pa de ni nyi shu rtsa gcig yin te /
translated: When there is an un

original: 'di dag kho na las gang yang rung ba cig lhag par byas nas so //üîΩbsgribs la bco brgyad /üîΩ'dod pa'i khams na 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni bsgribs pa ste /üîΩde la sems las byung ba bco brgyad 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di dag kho na las gang yang rung ba cig lhag par byas nas so // bsgribs la bco brgyad / 'dod pa'i khams na 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni bsgribs pa ste / de la sems las byung ba bco brgyad 'byung ste /
translated: When one of these is predominant, the mind is said to be associated with it.üîΩThe obscured mind is associated with eighteen mental factors in the desire realm.

original: sa mang po pa bcu dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa drug dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa'o //üîΩlung ma bstan /
analyzed: sa mang po pa bcu dang / nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa drug dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa'o // lung ma bstan /
translated: The obscured mind in the desire realm is associated with eighteen mental factors: the ten universal mental states, the six root afflictions, and both investigation and analysis.

original: gzhag la bcu gnyis dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: gzhag la bcu gnyis dag tu 'dod //
translated: The indeterminate mind is associated with twelve mental factors in the desire realm.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i sems la sa mang po pa bcu dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa zhes bya ba bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'i sems la sa mang po pa bcu dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa zhes bya ba bcu gnyis so //
translated: The indeterminate mind in the desire realm is associated with twelve mental factors: the ten universal mental states, investigation, and analysis.

original: gnyid ni kun la mi 'gal phyir //
analyzed: gnyid ni kun la mi 'gal phyir //
translated: Sleep is not contradictory to any mind.

original: gang la yod pa des bsnan to ;
analyzed: gang la yod pa des bsnan to ;
translated: Therefore, wherever it exists, it is added to that.

original: / gnyid ni ji skad bshad pa thams cad dang mi 'gal te /
analyzed: / gnyid ni ji skad bshad pa thams cad dang mi 'gal te /
translated: Sleep is not contradictory to any of the minds that have been explained.

original: de'i phyir gang la yod pa de la des bsnan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang la yod pa de la des bsnan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, wherever it exists, it is added to that.

original: gang de ltar 'dod pa'i khams la sems byung nges par bshad pa /
analyzed: gang de ltar 'dod pa'i khams la sems byung nges par bshad pa /
translated: Those who assert that the mental factors are definitely explained in that way in the desire realm

original: de las 'gyod gnyid mi dge rnams //
analyzed: de las 'gyod gnyid mi dge rnams //
translated: Regret, sleep, and the nonvirtuous mental factors

original: bsam gtan dang po dag na med //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dag na med //
translated: do not exist in the first absorption.

original: bsam gtan dang po na ni @115b ji skad bshad pa de las 'gyod pa dang / gnyid dang / gang yang cung zad mi dge ba g-yob la sogs pa thams cad du med de /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po na ni @115b ji skad bshad pa de las 'gyod pa dang / gnyid dang / gang yang cung zad mi dge ba g-yob la sogs pa thams cad du med de /
translated: In the first absorption, regret kauk·πõtya, sleep middha and whatever nonvirtuous mental factors exist in the desire realm, such as agitation auddhatya, do not exist there.

original: gzhan thams cad ni de dang 'dra'o //üîΩbsam gtan dang po na med pa gang dag yin pa de dag kho na dang / rtog pa'ang bsam gtan khyad par can //
analyzed: gzhan thams cad ni de dang 'dra'o // bsam gtan dang po na med pa gang dag yin pa de dag kho na dang / rtog pa'ang bsam gtan khyad par can //
translated: All other mental factors are similar to that.üîΩIn the first absorption, those that do not exist are investigation and analysis.

original: de'i gang na dpyod pa yang med de lhag ma ni de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de'i gang na dpyod pa yang med de lhag ma ni de dang 'dra'o //
translated: In the second absorption and above, investigation does not exist and analysis also does not exist.

original: da ni gzhung las byung ba kha cig gi tha dad du bya ba 'byung ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gzhung las byung ba kha cig gi tha dad du bya ba 'byung ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, I will explain the differences that occur in some of the texts.

original: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between shamelessness and nonembarrassment?

original: ma gus ngo tsha med /
analyzed: ma gus ngo tsha med /
translated: Nonembarrassment is disrespect.

original: yon tan rnams dang yon tan can rnams la ma gus pa nyid ni bkur pa med pa nyid de ngo tsha med pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan rnams dang yon tan can rnams la ma gus pa nyid ni bkur pa med pa nyid de ngo tsha med pa'o //
translated: Lack of respect for the qualities and those who possess the qualities is lack of consideration, which is shamelessness.

original: khrel med / kha na ma tho 'jigs mi lta //
analyzed: khrel med / kha na ma tho 'jigs mi lta //
translated: One does not see what is objectionable as objectionable, nor does one fear it.

original: kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba ni dam pa rnams kyis smad pa ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba ni dam pa rnams kyis smad pa ste /
translated: What is objectionable is that which is censured by the wise.

original: de la 'jig par mi lta ba ni khrel med pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig par mi lta ba ni khrel med pa'o //
translated: Not seeing it as objectionable is shamelessness.

original: 'dir 'jigs pa ni mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'jigs pa ni mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: Here, fear is the undesirable result.

original: 'di las 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las 'jigs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one fears it, one is afraid of it.

original: bzlog pa ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that shame and embarrassment are the opposites of shamelessness and disregard.

original: dga' ba dang gus pa la tha dang du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: dga' ba dang gus pa la tha dang du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between joy and respect?üîΩJoy is of two kinds:

original: dga' dang / dga' ba ni rnam pa gnyis dang // nyon mongs pa can ni sred pa ste /
analyzed: dga' dang / dga' ba ni rnam pa gnyis dang // nyon mongs pa can ni sred pa ste /
translated: Afflicted joy is craving.

original: dper na bu dang chung ma la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bu dang chung ma la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, joy in a son, wife, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni dad pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni dad pa ste /
translated: Non-afflicted joy is faith.

original: dper na ston pa dang bla ma dang yon tan can rnams la bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ston pa dang bla ma dang yon tan can rnams la bya ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the respect that one has for a master, a teacher, a person who possesses qualities.

original: gus nyid ngo tsha shes /
analyzed: gus nyid ngo tsha shes /
translated: Respect is the same as shame.

original: gus pa ni ngo tsha shes pa ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gus pa ni ngo tsha shes pa ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: Respect is the same as shame as it has been explained above.üîΩThese two, shame and respect,

original: de gnyis 'dod dang gzugs dag na //
analyzed: de gnyis 'dod dang gzugs dag na //
translated: exist in the realm of desire and in the realm of fine-materiality.

original: gzugs med pa yi khams na ni //
analyzed: gzugs med pa yi khams na ni //
translated: In the realm of immateriality,

original: gang zag la dmigs pa'i dga' ba dang gus pa dag med do //
analyzed: gang zag la dmigs pa'i dga' ba dang gus pa dag med do //
translated: there is no affection and no respect which have for their object a person.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dag la tha dad du bya ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dag la tha dad du bya ba ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between initial inquiry and investigation?

original: rtog dang dpyod pa rtsing zhib nyid //
analyzed: rtog dang dpyod pa rtsing zhib nyid //
translated: Initial inquiry and investigation are grossness and subtleness of the mind.

original: sems kyi'o zhes 'og nas 'chad de /
analyzed: sems kyi'o zhes 'og nas 'chad de /
translated: The following verse is stated in order to explain this.

original: rtog pa ni sems rtsing ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa ni sems rtsing ba'o //
translated: Initial inquiry is the grossness of the mind.

original: dpyod pa ni sems zhib pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa ni sems zhib pa'o //
translated: Investigation is the subtleness of the mind.

original: nga rgyal dang rgyags pa dag la tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na /üîΩnga rgyal khengs pa rgyags pa ni //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang rgyags pa dag la tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na / nga rgyal khengs pa rgyags pa ni //
translated: What is the difference between pride and arrogance?

original: rang gi chos la chags pa yi //
analyzed: rang gi chos la chags pa yi //
translated: Arrogance is the swelling up of the mind due to attachment to one‚Äôs own qualities.

original: sems ni yongs su gtugs pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni yongs su gtugs pa'o //
translated: It is the mind‚Äôs inflation.

original: pha rol po las gang yang rung ba'i khyad par zhig yongs su btags nas sems khengs pa ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: pha rol po las gang yang rung ba'i khyad par zhig yongs su btags nas sems khengs pa ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: Pride is the swelling up of the mind through esteeming self on the basis of some excellence that one attributes to oneself.

original: rgyags pa ni rang gi chos kho na la chags pa'i sems yongs su gtugs pa @116a * //üîΩgang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyags pa ni rang gi chos kho na la chags pa'i sems yongs su gtugs pa @116a * // gang yin pa'o //
translated: Arrogance is the swelling up of the mind through attachment to one's own qualities.üîΩThe mind is said to be elevated when it is swollen up with pride.

original: sems las byung ba rnams sems dang bcas te bshad zin to //
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams sems dang bcas te bshad zin to //
translated: The mind and mental factors have been discussed along with the mind.

original: gsung rab las 'di dag gi tha snyad du 'dogs pa'i phyir de dag gi ming 'di dag brjod de /
analyzed: gsung rab las 'di dag gi tha snyad du 'dogs pa'i phyir de dag gi ming 'di dag brjod de /
translated: The names of these are mentioned in the scriptures in order to designate them.

original: sems dang yid dang rnam shes ni //üîΩdon gcig 'byed pas na sems so //
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam shes ni // don gcig 'byed pas na sems so //
translated: The mind, the mental organ, and consciousnessüîΩhave the same meaning.

original: go bas na yid do ;
analyzed: go bas na yid do ;
translated: The mind is so called because it accumulates.üîΩThe mental organ is so called because it cognizes.

original: / rnam par shes pas na rnam par shes pa'o //üîΩsems dang sems byung dang / rten dang dmigs dang rnam bcas dang // mtshungs par ldan pa'ang don gcig ste //
analyzed: / rnam par shes pas na rnam par shes pa'o // sems dang sems byung dang / rten dang dmigs dang rnam bcas dang // mtshungs par ldan pa'ang don gcig ste //
translated: Consciousness is so called because it is conscious of an object.üîΩThe mind, the mental factors, the support, the object, the aspect, and the state of association have the same meaning.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba de dag nyid dbang po la brten pa'i phyir rten dang bcas pa dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba de dag nyid dbang po la brten pa'i phyir rten dang bcas pa dag ces bya'o //
translated: The mind and mental factors are said to be associated because they are supported on the same faculty, have the same object, the same aspect, and occur simultaneously.

original: yul la 'dzin pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: yul la 'dzin pa'i phyir dmigs pa dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: They are associated with an object because they grasp an object-field.

original: dmigs pa de nyid la sems rnam pa re re nas bye brag tu gcod pa'i phyir rnam pa dang bcas pa dag go //
analyzed: dmigs pa de nyid la sems rnam pa re re nas bye brag tu gcod pa'i phyir rnam pa dang bcas pa dag go //
translated: They are associated with an aspect because they distinguish the object-field in a certain manner.

original: mnyam par ldan pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa dag go //
analyzed: mnyam par ldan pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa dag go //
translated: They are associated with a state of equilibrium because they are in a state of equilibrium.

original: rnam pa gang dag gis mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang dag gis mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
translated: By what aspects are they associated?

original: gsungs pa / rnam pa lnga /
analyzed: gsungs pa / rnam pa lnga /
translated: They are associated by five aspects.

original: mtshungs pa rnam pa lnga po rten dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa dag gis mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa rnam pa lnga po rten dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa dag gis mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: They are associated by five types of equality: equality of basis, of object-field, of aspect, of time, and of substance.

original: rdzas mtshungs pa yang ji ltar sems gcig kho na yin pa de kho na bzhin du sems las byung ba rnams kyang re re yin pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas mtshungs pa yang ji ltar sems gcig kho na yin pa de kho na bzhin du sems las byung ba rnams kyang re re yin pa'o //
translated: Equality of substance means that, just as the mind is single, so too are the mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dag bshad zin to //üîΩmi ldan pa yi 'du byed rnams //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dag bshad zin to //üîΩmi ldan pa yi 'du byed rnams //
translated: The mind and its activities have been discussed.üîΩThe formations dissociated from the mind are:

original: thob dang ma thob skal mnyam dang // 'du shes med snyoms 'jug dag dang // srog dang mtshan nyid rnams dang ni //
analyzed: thob dang ma thob skal mnyam dang // 'du shes med snyoms 'jug dag dang // srog dang mtshan nyid rnams dang ni //
translated: The possession of what is obtained and not obtained, the similarity of types, the two meditative attainments, the vital faculty, the characteristics,

original: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa yang //üîΩ'du byed 'di dag ni sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs la sogs pa yang // 'du byed 'di dag ni sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin la /
translated: and also the groups of names, etc.üîΩThese formations are neither associated with the mind nor are they by nature form.

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin yang ma yin pas sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin yang ma yin pas sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dag ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called not associated with the mind.üîΩAmong them, first,

original: de la re zhig / thob pa rnyed dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig / thob pa rnyed dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Obtainment is acquisition and possession.

original: thob pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: thob pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Obtainment is twofold:

original: ma thob pa dang / rnam par nyams pa las rnyed pa dang / thob nas ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa dang / rnam par nyams pa las rnyed pa dang / thob nas ldan pa'o //
translated: acquisition from not obtaining and possession after obtaining.

original: bzlog pa ni ma thob pa'o zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ma thob pa'o zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: The opposite of that is nonobtainment.

original: 'di dag kyang gang gi yin zhe na /üîΩthob dang ma thob rang rgyud du //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang gang gi yin zhe na / thob dang ma thob rang rgyud du //
translated: Now, whose are these?

original: gtogs pa rnams kyi'o //üîΩgzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gtogs pa rnams kyi'o // gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: Obtainment and nonobtainment belong to one‚Äôs own mindstream.üîΩThey do not belong to the mindstreams of others.

original: gzhan dag dang ni 'ga' yang ldan pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan dag dang ni 'ga' yang ldan pa med do //
translated: No one possesses the dharmas of other sentient beings.

original: rgyud du ma gtogs pa rnams kyi ni yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyud du ma gtogs pa rnams kyi ni yang ma yin te /
translated: Those not included in the class of sentient beings do not possess it.

original: sems can du mi bgrang bdag ni 'ga' yang ldan pa med do //üîΩslar yang thob pa dang ma @116b thob pa dag ni /
analyzed: sems can du mi bgrang bdag ni 'ga' yang ldan pa med do // slar yang thob pa dang ma @116b thob pa dag ni /
translated: No one possesses nonpossession.üîΩObtainment and nonobtainment are again:

original: 'gog gnyis kyi /
analyzed: 'gog gnyis kyi /
translated: Obtained through both cessations.

original: so sor brtags pha ma yin pas 'gog pa ni sems can thams cad dang ldan no //
analyzed: so sor brtags pha ma yin pas 'gog pa ni sems can thams cad dang ldan no //
translated: Cessation through analytical meditation is possessed by all sentient beings.

original: so sor brtags pa dang ni 'ga' zhig go //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa dang ni 'ga' zhig go //
translated: Cessation not attained through analytical meditation is possessed by some.

original: thob pa de yang ni /
analyzed: thob pa de yang ni /
translated: Obtainment and nonobtainment are:

original: dus gsum pa yi rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: dus gsum pa yi rnam pa gsum //
translated: Of three types in the three times.

original: chos 'das pa rnams kyi thob pa 'das pa yang yod /üîΩma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba yang yod la /
analyzed: chos 'das pa rnams kyi thob pa 'das pa yang yod / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba yang yod la /
translated: Obtainment of past phenomena is past,üîΩobtainment of future and present phenomena is also past.üîΩObtainment of future phenomena is future,üîΩobtainment of past and present phenomena is also future.üîΩObtainment of present phenomena is present,

original: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams kyi yang so sor rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams kyi yang so sor rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: obtainment of past and future phenomena is also present.

original: dge la sogs kyi dge la sogs //
analyzed: dge la sogs kyi dge la sogs //
translated: Obtainment of virtue and so on is virtue and so on.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi thob pa ni rim pa bzhin du dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa de kho na yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyi thob pa ni rim pa bzhin du dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa de kho na yin no //
translated: The possession of wholesome, unwholesome, and non-defined factors is, respectively, wholesome, unwholesome, and non-defined.

original: der gtogs rnams kyi rang khams pa //
analyzed: der gtogs rnams kyi rang khams pa //
translated: The possession of factors belonging to a certain realm is of this realm.

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi thob pa ni rang gi khams pa kho na'o //üîΩma gtogs rnams kyi rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi thob pa ni rang gi khams pa kho na'o // ma gtogs rnams kyi rnam pa bzhi //
translated: The possession of factors of the realm of desire, of the realm of fine-materiality, of the realm of immateriality, is, respectively, of the realm of desire, of the realm of fine-materiality, of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThe possession of factors not included in the realms is of four types.

original: zag pa med pa rnams kyi thob pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste ;
analyzed: zag pa med pa rnams kyi thob pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste ;
translated: The possession of factors free from fluxes is of four types.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i ni gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'ang yin la /
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'i ni gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'ang yin la /
translated: The possession of cessation resulting from deliberation is of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality.

original: zag pa med pa'ang yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'ang yin te /
translated: It is also free from fluxes.üîΩIt is free from fluxes when it is obtained through the path of insight into the truths.

original: lam gyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: lam gyi dbang gis so //
translated: It is of the realm of desire when it is obtained through the path of cultivation.

original: lam gyi bden pa'i ni zag pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i ni zag pa med pa nyid do //
translated: The possession of the truth of the path is free from fluxes.

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i ni khams gsum pa ma yin te skye ba'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i ni khams gsum pa ma yin te skye ba'i dbang gis so //
translated: The possession of cessation not resulting from deliberation is not of the three realms, for it is obtained through the power of the arising of the factors.

original: de ni bsdus nas rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni bsdus nas rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: It is thus of four types.

original: slob pa rnams kyi thob pa ni thob pa'i slob pa kho na yin no //üîΩmi slob pa rnams kyi thob pa ni mi slob pa nyid do //
analyzed: slob pa rnams kyi thob pa ni thob pa'i slob pa kho na yin no // mi slob pa rnams kyi thob pa ni mi slob pa nyid do //

original: slob dang mi slob min gyi gsum //üîΩde dag kyang zag pa dang bcas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: slob dang mi slob min gyi gsum // de dag kyang zag pa dang bcas pa dang 'dus ma byas pa'o //
