analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang lung du ma bstan pa gnyis dang sprul pa'i sems ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: cessation not attained through preceptualüîΩcessation not

original: de dag ni sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis 'grub pas stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir sngar dang phyis dang lhan cig skyes pa yang yod do //
analyzed: de dag ni sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis 'grub pas stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir sngar dang phyis dang lhan cig skyes pa yang yod do //
translated: Since they are established by the specific application of the power of the mind, they are strong and can arise prior to, simultaneously with, or subsequent to the mind.

original: ci ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na'i thob pa dang lhan cig skyes pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na'i thob pa dang lhan cig skyes pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Do only unobscured-neutral obtainments arise simultaneously with the mind?

original: smras pa bsgribs pa'i gzugs kyi thob pa ni lhan cig skyes pa kho na'o//
analyzed: smras pa bsgribs pa'i gzugs kyi thob pa ni lhan cig skyes pa kho na'o//
translated: Obscured form obtainment arises simultaneously with the mind.

original: chen pos kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa mi slong bas stobs chung bar grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen pos kyang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa mi slong bas stobs chung bar grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the great elements do not generate nonindicative form, it is established that it is weak.üîΩObtainment of past and future states

original: dus gsum pa yi rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: dus gsum pa yi rnam pa gsum //
translated: is of three types.

original: zhes bya ba'i dmigs bsal ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i dmigs bsal ni /
translated: The exception is

original: 'dod pa na /
analyzed: 'dod pa na /
translated: in the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi sngar ni skye ba med //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sngar ni skye ba med //
translated: Form does not arise prior to it.

original: lhan cig skye ba dang / dus phyis skye ba ni yod do //
analyzed: lhan cig skye ba dang / dus phyis skye ba ni yod do //
translated: It can arise simultaneously with and after it.

original: thob pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag ni bshad zin to //üîΩma thob ma bsgribs lung ma bstan //
analyzed: thob pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag ni bshad zin to // ma thob ma bsgribs lung ma bstan //
translated: The specific types of obtainment have already been explained.üîΩNonobtainment is unobscured-neutral.

original: ma thob pa thams cad ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ma thob pa thams cad ni ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: All nonobtainment is only unobscured-neutral.

original: 'das ma skyes kyi de rnam gsum //
analyzed: 'das ma skyes kyi de rnam gsum //
translated: The past and future of these is threefold.

original: da ltar byung ba ma thob pa ni med de /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ma thob pa ni med de /
translated: The nonobtainment of the present does not exist.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dag ni dus gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dag ni dus gsum pa yin no //
translated: The past and future of these is threefold.

original: 'dod sogs gtogs dang dri med kyi'ang //
analyzed: 'dod sogs gtogs dang dri med kyi'ang //
translated: The past and future of those associated with desire and so on and the uncontaminated

original: rnam pa gsum zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: is threefold.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa rnams kyi ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i yin te /
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa rnams kyi ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i yin te /
translated: Those associated with desire are the three realms of desire, form and formlessness.

original: rigs pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: rigs pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: They are so by the power of the type.

original: gzugs dang / gzugs med par gtogs pa rnams dang / zag pa rnams kyi yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / gzugs med par gtogs pa rnams dang / zag pa rnams kyi yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Those associated with form and formlessness and those that are contaminated are also like that.

original: ma thob pa zag pa med pa ni med de /üîΩ'di ltar / lam ma thob pa so so yi //
analyzed: ma thob pa zag pa med pa ni med de / 'di ltar / lam ma thob pa so so yi //
translated: The nonobtainment of the uncontaminated does not exist.üîΩThus it is said:

original: skye bor 'dod do //
analyzed: skye bor 'dod do //
translated: The nonobtainment of the path is the state of an ordinary being.

original: gang gi phyir so so'i skye bo nyid ni zag pa med pa yin par mi 'os so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir so so'i skye bo nyid ni zag pa med pa yin par mi 'os so //
translated: Because it is not suitable that the state of an ordinary being is uncontaminated.

original: yang ma thob pa ni ji @117b ltar nyams she na /
analyzed: yang ma thob pa ni ji @117b ltar nyams she na /
translated: How is nonobtainment lost?

original: chos gang gi ma thob pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: chos gang gi ma thob pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The nonobtainment of any phenomenonüîΩis lost through obtaining it.

original: de thob pa dang / sa 'phos nas ni rnam nyams 'gyur //üîΩre zhig 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de thob pa dang / sa 'phos nas ni rnam nyams 'gyur // re zhig 'di lta ste /
translated: When one obtains it and when one passes to another stage, one loses it.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi ma rnyed pa ni so so'i skye bo nyid de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi ma rnyed pa ni so so'i skye bo nyid de /
translated: In fact, the state of ordinary worldling is the non-acquisition of the noble path.

original: de ni rnyed pa dang / sa 'phos pa las rnam par nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni rnyed pa dang / sa 'phos pa las rnam par nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: One loses it when one acquires it and when one passes to another stage.

original: gzhan dag gi yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same holds for the other states.

original: yang skal ba mnyam pa 'di ci zhe na /üîΩskal mnyam sems can 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang skal ba mnyam pa 'di ci zhe na / skal mnyam sems can 'dra ba'o //
translated: What is homogeneity?

original: skal ba mnyam pa nyid ni sems can rnams kyi 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa nyid ni sems can rnams kyi 'dra ba yin te /
translated: Homogeneity is the similarity of sentient beings.

original: de yang tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: de yang tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / tha dad pa ste /
translated: It is not different from the aggregates, but it is also not the aggregates.

original: de dag kho na'i sa dang / khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: de dag kho na'i sa dang / khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas la sogs pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: It is the aggregates themselves, distinguished by their specific realm, stage, destiny, rebirth, etc.

original: yang 'du shes med ba pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /üîΩ'du shes med pa pa 'du shes //
analyzed: yang 'du shes med ba pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na / 'du shes med pa pa 'du shes //
translated: What is the state of non-perception?

original: med par sems dang sems byung rnams //
analyzed: med par sems dang sems byung rnams //
translated: The state of non-perception is the non-perception of the mind and mental activities.

original: 'gog pa'o // gang gis ma 'ongs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa de ni 'du shes med pa pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas so //
analyzed: 'gog pa'o // gang gis ma 'ongs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa de ni 'du shes med pa pa zhes bya ba'i rdzas so //
translated: It is a real entity called the attainment of non-perception.

original: de yang gcig tu rnam smin /
analyzed: de yang gcig tu rnam smin /
translated: It is exclusively a ripened effect.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i'o //
translated: It is the effect of the meditative attainment of non-perception.

original: gang dag na 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams 'khod pa'i sems can de dag gang zhe na /üîΩde 'bras che /
analyzed: gang dag na 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams 'khod pa'i sems can de dag gang zhe na / de 'bras che /
translated: What sentient beings are the sentient beings who are situated in the realm of sentient beings devoid of conception?üîΩThey are the MahƒÅbrahmans.

original: lha de dag ni 'bras bu che ba zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: lha de dag ni 'bras bu che ba zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: These gods are called MahƒÅbrahmans.

original: de dag gi phyogs gcig ni 'du shes med pa pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi phyogs gcig ni 'du shes med pa pa yin te /
translated: One part of them is the sentient beings who are situated in the realm of sentient beings devoid of conception.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can bzhin no //
translated: Like the special meditative attainment of the fourth meditation.

original: 'du shes med pa pa bshad zin to //üîΩji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa la 'du shes med par bshad pa /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa bshad zin to // ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa la 'du shes med par bshad pa /
translated: The attainment of non-perception has been discussed.üîΩJust as the cessation of thought and thought concomitants is called the attainment of non-perception,

original: de bzhin 'du shes med snyoms 'jug / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi 'gog pa zhes bya ba tsam ste /
analyzed: de bzhin 'du shes med snyoms 'jug / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi 'gog pa zhes bya ba tsam ste /
translated: so too is the cessation of thought and thought concomitants called the attainment of the cessation of conception and feeling.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras 'dren to //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgras 'dren to //
translated: The word ‚Äútoo‚Äù is used to include the attainment of non-perception.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa de ni /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa de ni /
translated: This attainment is

original: bsam gtan tha mar /üîΩ'di bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan tha mar / 'di bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: in the last dhyƒÅna.üîΩThis attainment is in the fourth dhyƒÅna.

original: de la yang snyoms par 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: de la yang snyoms par 'jug pa ni /
translated: The attainment of nonperception is

original: 'byung 'dod pas /
analyzed: 'byung 'dod pas /
translated: in the desire realm.

original: 'di la nges par 'byung 'dod cing snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: 'di la nges par 'byung 'dod cing snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: One enters this attainment with the desire to escape from the fourth dhyƒÅna.

original: 'du shes med pa pa ni rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir lung ma bstan pa zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa pa ni rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir lung ma bstan pa zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: The attainment of nonperception is indeterminate because it is karmically neutral.

original: 'di ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dge ba'o //
translated: This attainment is virtuous.

original: dge ba yin yang /
analyzed: dge ba yin yang /
translated: Although it is virtuous,

original: skyes nas myong gyur nyid /
analyzed: skyes nas myong gyur nyid /
translated: it is experienced after rebirth.

original: mthong ba'i chos dang lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos dang lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not experienced in this life or in a third life.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not indeterminate.

original: de yang so so'i skye bo kho na'i yin par 'dod kyi /üîΩ'phags @118a * //
analyzed: de yang so so'i skye bo kho na'i yin par 'dod kyi / 'phags @118a * //
translated: It is also asserted to be only for ordinary beings.

original: pa'i ma yin /
analyzed: pa'i ma yin /
translated: It is not for ƒÅryas.

original: 'phags pa rnams ni 'di la ltung ba'i gnas lta bur gzigs pas snyoms par mi 'jug go //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni 'di la ltung ba'i gnas lta bur gzigs pas snyoms par mi 'jug go //
translated: ƒÄryas do not enter this attainment because they view it as a state of downfall.

original: 'di ni sems med pa yin yang mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni sems med pa yin yang mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Although this attainment is mindless, it is accomplished through great effort.

original: dus gcig thob /
analyzed: dus gcig thob /
translated: It is obtained in one time period.

original: da ltar gyi dus kho na thob po //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus kho na thob po //
translated: It is obtained in the present alone.

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs par ni ji srid du thob pa 'das pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs par ni ji srid du thob pa 'das pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: In the second moment and so on, it is possessed in the past.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ji lta bar /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ji lta bar /
translated: Just as the meditative attainment of nondiscernment

original: 'gog pa zhes pa'ang de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: 'gog pa zhes pa'ang de bzhin nyid //
translated: is so too cessation.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba tsam dang 'brel bar bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba tsam dang 'brel bar bya'o //
translated: It is merely related by the statement: ‚ÄúIt is the cessation of mind and mental factors.‚Äù

original: khyad par du /üîΩ'di gnas don du /
analyzed: khyad par du / 'di gnas don du /
translated: In particular,

original: zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes mngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas 'di la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: zhi bar gnas pa'i 'du shes mngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas 'di la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: this meditative attainment is generated by the attention that manifests the discernment of peaceful abiding.

original: yang de ni bsam gtan bzhi ba'i sa pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang de ni bsam gtan bzhi ba'i sa pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, that meditative attainment is on the level of the fourth absorption.

original: 'di ni srid rtser skyes /
analyzed: 'di ni srid rtser skyes /
translated: This meditative attainment is generated on the summit of existence.

original: 'di ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dge ba'o //
translated: It is virtuous.

original: dge ba kho na yin gyi nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin la lung du ma bstan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba kho na yin gyi nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin la lung du ma bstan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is virtuous alone, it is not afflicted and it is not neutral.

original: dge ba yin yang /üîΩgnyis su myong 'gyur dang / ma nges /
analyzed: dge ba yin yang / gnyis su myong 'gyur dang / ma nges /
translated: Even though it is virtuous,üîΩit is not definite in terms of time, because it is experienced in two times and not experienced.

original: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan las myang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dus gnyis su 'gyur ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i phyir ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba dang / lan grangs gzhan las myang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dus gnyis su 'gyur ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i phyir ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is experienced in two times because it is experienced after rebirth and experienced in another life, and it is not indefinite because it is experienced.

original: de yang mtha' gcig tu 'phags pa'i /
analyzed: de yang mtha' gcig tu 'phags pa'i /
translated: Moreover, it is definitely that of an ƒÅrya.

original: 'phags pa'i yang 'di ni 'dod chags dang bral bas thob par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i yang 'di ni 'dod chags dang bral bas thob par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: This is not obtained through freedom from attachment.

original: 'on kyang sbyor bas 'thob /üîΩ'di ni sbyor bas thob par bya ba kho na yin pas 'das pa yang mi thob la ma 'ongs pa yang mi thob ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang sbyor bas 'thob / 'di ni sbyor bas thob par bya ba kho na yin pas 'das pa yang mi thob la ma 'ongs pa yang mi thob ste /
translated: However, it is obtained through preparation.

original: de ni sems kyi stobs kyis thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sems kyi stobs kyis thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is obtained only through preparation. Therefore it is not obtained in the past or obtained in the future because it is obtained through the power of the mind.

original: ci bcom ldan 'das kyi yang sbyor ba las byung ba yin na ma zhe na /
analyzed: ci bcom ldan 'das kyi yang sbyor ba las byung ba yin na ma zhe na /
translated: If it arises from preparation in the BhagavƒÅn, does it not arise from preparation?

original: smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma yin no //
translated: It is said it does not.

original: 'on kyang / thub pa'i byang chub kyis thob bya //
analyzed: 'on kyang / thub pa'i byang chub kyis thob bya //
translated: The Buddha obtained it through enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ni 'di zad pa mkhyen pa dang / dus mnyam du brnyes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ni 'di zad pa mkhyen pa dang / dus mnyam du brnyes so //
translated: The Buddhas, Blessed Ones, obtain the knowledge of exhaustion and the knowledge of nonarising at the same time.

original: nub phyogs pa dag na re de ni dang po kho nar byang chub sems dpa' slob pa'i gnas skabs na skyed par byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nub phyogs pa dag na re de ni dang po kho nar byang chub sems dpa' slob pa'i gnas skabs na skyed par byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas of the West say that the knowledge of exhaustion is produced first, in the state of training of the Bodhisattva.

original: kha che ba rnams na re /
analyzed: kha che ba rnams na re /
translated: The Ka≈õmƒ´reans say:

original: dang por ma yin /
analyzed: dang por ma yin /
translated: It is not produced first.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩskad cig ma /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / skad cig ma /
translated: Why?

original: sum cu rtsa bzhis thob phyir ro //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa bzhis thob phyir ro //
translated: Because it is obtained through thirty-four moments.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems kyi skad cig ma sum cu rtsa bzhis byang chub rjes su thob ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems kyi skad cig ma sum cu rtsa bzhis byang chub rjes su thob ste /
translated: The Bodhisattva obtains Bodhi through thirty-four moments of thought:

original: bden pa mngon par @118b rtogs pa na bcu drug dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba na nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu spong bar byed pa'i bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu dgu skye ba'i phyir bco brgyad de /
analyzed: bden pa mngon par @118b rtogs pa na bcu drug dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'dod chags dang bral ba na nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu spong bar byed pa'i bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu dgu skye ba'i phyir bco brgyad de /
translated: sixteen moments in the direct realization of the truths, and eighteen moments in the detachment from the summit of cyclic existence, for the path of immediate succession and the path of liberation arise in regard to the abandonment of the nine categories of defilements of the summit of cyclic existence.

original: de'i phyir bar skabs 'dir mi 'dra ba'i sems mi srid pas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir bar skabs 'dir mi 'dra ba'i sems mi srid pas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, in this state, there is no possibility of a different mind. Consequently, the attainment of cessation is not possible.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gnyis kyi rnam pa'i bye brag mang po zhig yod mod kyi /üîΩgnyis ka 'dod dang gzugs rten can //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gnyis kyi rnam pa'i bye brag mang po zhig yod mod kyi / gnyis ka 'dod dang gzugs rten can //
translated: There are many varieties of these two attainments.üîΩThese two attainments exist in the realm of desire and the realm of form.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gnyis ka yang 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams su bskyed do //üîΩyang / 'gog pa dang por mi'i nang du /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa 'di gnyis ka yang 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams su bskyed do // yang / 'gog pa dang por mi'i nang du /
translated: These two attainments are produced in the realm of desire and the realm of form.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni dang por mi dag gi nang du skyed do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni dang por mi dag gi nang du skyed do //
translated: The attainment of cessation is produced for the first time among humans.

original: phyis ni sngar yongs su nyams pa de dag gis gzugs kyi khams su yang skyed do //
analyzed: phyis ni sngar yongs su nyams pa de dag gis gzugs kyi khams su yang skyed do //
translated: Later, those who have already retrogress from it produce it in the realm of form.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dag bshad zin to //üîΩsrog ni tshe yin /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dag bshad zin to // srog ni tshe yin /
translated: The two attainments have been discussed.üîΩLife force is the life faculty.

original: tshe zhes bya ba'i chos de gang yin pa de yang mi shes pas /üîΩdrod dang ni /
analyzed: tshe zhes bya ba'i chos de gang yin pa de yang mi shes pas / drod dang ni /
translated: The life faculty is the factor that is called life force.

original: rnam shes rten gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes rten gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the support of heat and consciousness.üîΩIt is the support of heat and consciousness.

original: gang drod dang rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa'i chos gnas pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni tshe yin no //
analyzed: gang drod dang rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa'i chos gnas pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni tshe yin no //
translated: Life force is the cause of the endurance of the entity that is the support of heat and consciousness.

original: srog bshad zin to //
analyzed: srog bshad zin to //
translated: Life force has been explained.üîΩThe characteristics are origination,

original: mtshan nyid dag ni skye ba dang // rga dang gnas dang mi rtag nyid //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dag ni skye ba dang // rga dang gnas dang mi rtag nyid //
translated: aging, duration, and impermanence.

original: bzhi po 'di rnams ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin te /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di rnams ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dag yin te /
translated: These four are the characteristics of conditioned entities.

original: gang la 'di dag yod pa'i chos de ni 'dus byas su mngon no //
analyzed: gang la 'di dag yod pa'i chos de ni 'dus byas su mngon no //
translated: The entity in which they exist is a conditioned entity.

original: bzlog pa ni 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: The opposite is an unconditioned entity.

original: skye ba la sogs pa de dag kyang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa gzhan yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa de dag kyang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa gzhan yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Since origination, etc., are also conditioned entities, there would be other origination, etc., of origination, etc.

original: yod pa de kho na ste /
analyzed: yod pa de kho na ste /
translated: There are only those that exist.üîΩThe origination of those is the origination of origination,

original: de dag skye ba'i skye la sogs //
analyzed: de dag skye ba'i skye la sogs //
translated: and so on.

original: de dag la yang skye ba'i skye ba dang / rga ba'i rga ba dang / gnas pa'i gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bya ba rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi yod do //
analyzed: de dag la yang skye ba'i skye ba dang / rga ba'i rga ba dang / gnas pa'i gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bya ba rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi yod do //
translated: There are four characteristics that are compatible with them: the origination of origination, the aging of aging, the duration of duration, and the impermanence of impermanence.

original: re re la yang mtshan nyid bzhi pa dang / mthar thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: re re la yang mtshan nyid bzhi pa dang / mthar thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that each of these has four characteristics, then there would be an infinite regress.

original: mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te /
translated: There is no infinite regress.

original: 'di ltar / de chos brgyad dang gcig la 'jug / chos bdag nyid gtogs par mtshan nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid brgyad dang lhan cig tu dgu skye la /
analyzed: 'di ltar / de chos brgyad dang gcig la 'jug / chos bdag nyid gtogs par mtshan nyid dang rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid brgyad dang lhan cig tu dgu skye la /
translated: Thus, nine things arise together: the entity itself, eight characteristics, and the characteristics of those characteristics.

original: de la skye bas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa chos gzhan brgyad skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de la skye bas ni bdag nyid ma gtogs pa chos gzhan brgyad skyed par byed do //
translated: The arising of arising generates eight things: the seven other characteristics and itself.

original: skye ba'i skye bas ni de kho na skyed par byed do //üîΩde bzhin du gnas pa la sogs pas gnas pa dang / skyed @119a * //
analyzed: skye ba'i skye bas ni de kho na skyed par byed do // de bzhin du gnas pa la sogs pas gnas pa dang / skyed @119a * //
translated: The arising of the arising of arising generates only the arising of arising.üîΩSimilarly, endurance, etc., generate endurance, etc.

original: pa dang nyams par byed pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: pa dang nyams par byed pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The arising of arising generates the arising of endurance, etc.

original: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba bskyed par bya ba skyed pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i skye ba bskyed par bya ba skyed pa yin na /
translated: If the arising of the future is generated by the arising of arising,

original: ma 'ongs pa thams cad cig car ci'i phyir mi skyed ce na /üîΩ'di ltar rgyu dang rkyen dag med par ni /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa thams cad cig car ci'i phyir mi skyed ce na / 'di ltar rgyu dang rkyen dag med par ni /
translated: why does it not generate all future things simultaneously?üîΩThus, the future is not generated

original: skye ba bskyed bya skyed byed min //
analyzed: skye ba bskyed bya skyed byed min //
translated: because it lacks the power to generate.

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa med par ni skye ba skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa med par ni skye ba skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For arising does not generate that which is to be generated without the convergence of causes and conditions.

original: mtshan nyid dag ni bshad zin to //üîΩming gi tshogs la sogs pa ni //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dag ni bshad zin to // ming gi tshogs la sogs pa ni //
translated: The characteristics have been explained.üîΩThe collections of names, etc.

original: ming dang ngag dang yi ge'i tshogs //
analyzed: ming dang ngag dang yi ge'i tshogs //
translated: The collections of names, assertions, and syllables.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the collections of words and syllables.

original: de la ming byed pas ni ming ste /
analyzed: de la ming byed pas ni ming ste /
translated: Among them, that which causes the designation of a name is a name.

original: dper na gzugs sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚Äúform,‚Äù ‚Äúsound,‚Äù etc.

original: ngag ni tshig ste ji tsam gyis don yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngag ni tshig ste ji tsam gyis don yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: An assertion is a word, that is, a collection of syllables that expresses a complete meaning.

original: yi ge ni yi ge ste /
analyzed: yi ge ni yi ge ste /
translated: A syllable is a phoneme.

original: ming la sogs pa de dag gi tshogs ni ming la sogs pa'i tshogs dag yin te /
analyzed: ming la sogs pa de dag gi tshogs ni ming la sogs pa'i tshogs dag yin te /
translated: The collections of those names, etc. are the collections of names, etc.

original: mang ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mang ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúcollection‚Äù is ‚Äúa multitude.‚Äù

original: yang ci ming gi tshogs la sogs pa 'di dag ldan pa'am /üîΩsems can du ston pa'am /
analyzed: yang ci ming gi tshogs la sogs pa 'di dag ldan pa'am / sems can du ston pa'am /
translated: Are these collections of names, etc. associated with sentient beings?üîΩAre they indicative of sentient beings?

original: sems can ma yin par ston pa'am /üîΩrnam par smin pa las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: sems can ma yin par ston pa'am / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'am /
translated: Are they nonindicative of sentient beings?üîΩAre they arisen from the cause of karmic maturation?

original: rgyas pa las byung ba'am /
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba'am /
translated: Are they arisen from the cause of enhancement?

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba 'am /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba 'am /
translated: Is it derived from the cause of natural outcome?

original: dge ba'am / mi dge ba'am /
analyzed: dge ba'am / mi dge ba'am /
translated: Is it wholesome, unwholesome, or nondefined?

original: lung du ma bstan pa gcig ces brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa gcig ces brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: It should be said that it is derived from the cause of natural outcome, and it is nondefined.

original: smras pa / 'dod dang gzugs gtogs sems can ston//
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod dang gzugs gtogs sems can ston//
translated: The teaching of sentient beings belongs to the realm of desire and the realm of form.

original: rgyu mthun lung bstan min /
analyzed: rgyu mthun lung bstan min /
translated: It is derived from the cause of natural outcome and is nondefined.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa dang / gzugs su gtogs pa 'di dag ni ston pa'o //üîΩgang zhig rjod par byed pa de dag dang ldan gyi brjod par bya ba gang yin pa dang ni ma yin no //

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no //

analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa yin na //
translated: They are of the realm of desire, the realm of fine-materiality, and the realm of immateriality.

analyzed: thob rnam gnyis /

analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dag yin no // mtshan nyid rnams kyang /

original: rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The characteristics of the factors of existence are also of two types.

original: thob pa bzhin no //
analyzed: thob pa bzhin no //

analyzed: snyoms 'jug dang / mi ldan pa dag rgyu mthun pa //
translated: The meditative attainment and the non-possession are of the homogeneous cause.

analyzed: sems med pa'i snyoms par 'jug @119b pa gnyis dang mi ldan pa rnams ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba dag kho na yin no /

original: zhes gang bshad pa de dag gis rgyu dang rkyen rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa de dag gis rgyu dang rkyen rnams gang zhe na /
translated: The rest have been explained.üîΩThe rest have been

original: byed rgyu lhan cig 'byung ba dang / skal mnyam mtshungs par ldan pa dang // kun du 'gro dang rnam smin dang // rgyu ni rnam pa drug tu 'dod //üîΩde la rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu /
analyzed: byed rgyu lhan cig 'byung ba dang / skal mnyam mtshungs par ldan pa dang // kun du 'gro dang rnam smin dang // rgyu ni rnam pa drug tu 'dod // de la rang las gzhan pa byed rgyu'i rgyu /
translated: 3. The homogeneous cause is the factor that is similar to the factor under consideration.üîΩ4. The pervasive cause is the pervasive proclivities.üîΩ5. The ripening cause is the wholesome or unwholesome factor that produces an effect that is a ripened, i.e., a homogeneous, effect.üîΩ6. The dominant cause is the factor that is not an obstacle to the arising of the factor under consideration.üîΩThe efficient cause is the five causes, with the exception of the homogeneous cause.

original: rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad ni chos 'dus byas kyi byed rgyu ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa chos thams cad ni chos 'dus byas kyi byed rgyu ste /
translated: All factors, with the exception of the factor itself, are the efficient cause of a conditioned factor.

original: skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩlhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras //
analyzed: skye ba la gegs mi byed pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro // lhan cig 'byung gang phan tshun 'bras //
translated: They are the efficient cause because they do not make an obstacle to the arising of the factor under consideration.

original: chos gang dag phan tshun gyi 'bras bu yin pa de dag ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: chos gang dag phan tshun gyi 'bras bu yin pa de dag ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: Simultaneous cause; factors that are the effect of one another are a simultaneous cause.

original: dpe ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩ'byung bzhin sems kyi rjes 'jug dang // sems dang mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi bzhin //
analyzed: dpe ji lta bu zhe na / 'byung bzhin sems kyi rjes 'jug dang // sems dang mtshan nyid mtshan gzhi bzhin //
translated: What factors are the effect of one another?üîΩThe primary elements are a simultaneous cause of one another, as are the four characteristics of the conditioned.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //üîΩsems ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i chos rnams kyi yin la /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag ni phan tshun lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //üîΩsems ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i chos rnams kyi yin la /
translated: The primary elements are a simultaneous cause of thought and thought concomitants, and vice versa.

original: de dag kyang de'i'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang de'i'o //
translated: They are also its.üîΩ

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams ni mtshan gzhi'i yin la de yang de dag gi yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid rnams ni mtshan gzhi'i yin la de yang de dag gi yin no //
translated: The characteristics of the conditioned factors are also the characteristics of the factors that are their basis.

original: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i chos de dag kyang gang zhe na /üîΩsems las byung dang sdom gnyis dang // sems dang de dag gi mtshan nyid //
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i chos de dag kyang gang zhe na / sems las byung dang sdom gnyis dang // sems dang de dag gi mtshan nyid //
translated: What are the factors that are associated with thought?üîΩThe factors that are associated with thought are: the mental factors, the two restraints, thought itself and their characteristics.

original: sems kyi rjes 'jug / sems las byung ba thams cad dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dang / de dag dang / sems kyi skye ba la sogs pa gang yin pa'i chos de dag ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya'o//
analyzed: sems kyi rjes 'jug / sems las byung ba thams cad dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dang / de dag dang / sems kyi skye ba la sogs pa gang yin pa'i chos de dag ni sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya'o//
translated: The mental factors, the two restraints, thought itself and the characteristics of the mental factors, the two restraints and thought are called factors that are associated with thought.

original: de dag ji ltar sems kyi rjes su 'jug ce na /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar sems kyi rjes su 'jug ce na /
translated: How are they associated with thought?

original: mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: dus dang ni /
analyzed: dus dang ni /
translated: by means of time,

original: 'bras sogs dge la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'bras sogs dge la sogs pas so //
translated: by means of result, etc., by means of virtue, etc.

original: re zhig dus las ni /
analyzed: re zhig dus las ni /
translated: By means of time.

original: sems dang lhan cig skye ba dang // gnas pa dang / 'gag pa gcig pa nyid dang / dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sems dang lhan cig skye ba dang // gnas pa dang / 'gag pa gcig pa nyid dang / dus gcig tu gtogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: They are associated with thought by means of the sameness of arising, enduring and ceasing, and by means of the sameness of possession in a single present, etc.

original: 'bras bu la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu la sogs pas ni /
translated: The result, etc.,

original: 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa gcig pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa gcig pa nyid kyis te /
translated: are homogeneous causes by reason of the identity of result, of outflow, and of action.

original: dge ba la sogs pas ni dge ba la sogs pa'i sems la dge ba la sogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pas ni dge ba la sogs pa'i sems la dge ba la sogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The wholesome, etc., are homogeneous causes of the wholesome, etc., by reason of the identity of wholesome, etc.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu bshad zin to //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu bshad zin to //
translated: The simultaneous cause has been explained.

original: skal mnyam rgyu ni 'dra ba'o //üîΩchos 'dra ba rnams ni @120a * //
analyzed: skal mnyam rgyu ni 'dra ba'o // chos 'dra ba rnams ni @120a * //
translated: The homogeneous cause is similar.

original: chos 'dra ba rnams kyi skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos 'dra ba rnams kyi skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Dharmas similar to it are the homogeneous cause of similar dharmas.

original: dge ba'i phung po lnga po dag ni dge ba rnams kyi yin no /
analyzed: dge ba'i phung po lnga po dag ni dge ba rnams kyi yin no /
translated: The five aggregates of the realm of desire are the homogeneous cause of the five aggregates of the realm of desire.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa dag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa dag go //
translated: The same for the aggregates of the realms of finemateriality and immateriality.

original: ci thams cad yin nam zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: ci thams cad yin nam zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: Are all similar dharmas homogeneous causes of similar dharmas?üîΩNo.

original: rang ris sa pa'o //
analyzed: rang ris sa pa'o //
translated: They are of the same category and stage.

original: ris ni lnga ste /
analyzed: ris ni lnga ste /
translated: There are five categories:

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: to be abandoned by insight into the truth of unsatisfactoriness, to be abandoned by insight into the truth of the origin, into the truth of cessation, into the truth of the path, and to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: sa ni dgu ste /
analyzed: sa ni dgu ste /
translated: There are nine stages:

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa brgyad do //üîΩ'di dag ni rang gi ris dag dang rang gi sa pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa brgyad do // 'di dag ni rang gi ris dag dang rang gi sa pa yin te /
translated: The desire realm and the eight absorptions and formless states.üîΩThey are homogeneous causes of those of their own type and of their own level.

original: rang gi ris rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: rang gi ris rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: They are homogeneous causes of those of their own type.

original: de dag kyang thams cad ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang thams cad ma yin no //
translated: But not of all those of their own type.üîΩHowever,

original: 'on kyang / sngar skyes pa rnams sngar skyes pa rnams ni phyi ma skyes pa dang ma skyes pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin na //
analyzed: 'on kyang / sngar skyes pa rnams sngar skyes pa rnams ni phyi ma skyes pa dang ma skyes pa rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin na //
translated: those arisen previously are homogeneous causes of those arisen previously, those arisen later, and those not yet arisen.

original: ma 'ongs pa kho na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa kho na skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: But future states are not homogeneous causes.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rang gi sa pa yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ji ltar nges sam zhe na /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni rang gi sa pa yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de ji ltar nges sam zhe na /
translated: How is it ascertained that homogeneous causes are of the same level?

original: de zag pa dang bcas pa ni nges so //üîΩsa dgu'i lam ni phan tshun du /
analyzed: de zag pa dang bcas pa ni nges so // sa dgu'i lam ni phan tshun du /
translated: It is ascertained that contaminated states are of the same level.üîΩThe path of the nine levels is a homogeneous cause of each other.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: This is applied to the context.

original: mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa gsum dag gi lam gyi bden pa ni phan tshun du skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa gsum dag gi lam gyi bden pa ni phan tshun du skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The truth of the path of the stage of preliminary concentration, the special stage of meditative stabilization, the four meditative stabilizations, and the three formless meditative attainments are homogeneous causes of each other.

original: 'di ni sa de dag tu glo bur du 'ongs pa yin la khams de dag tu gtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni sa de dag tu glo bur du 'ongs pa yin la khams de dag tu gtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: They are adventitious to those stages, they are not included in those realms.üîΩThey are also:

original: de yang / mnyam dang khyad par can gyi yin //
analyzed: de yang / mnyam dang khyad par can gyi yin //
translated: The cause of the equal and superior.

original: chung ngu'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chung ngu'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: Not the cause of the inferior.

original: ci lam kho na mnyam pa dang khyad par can dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci lam kho na mnyam pa dang khyad par can dag gi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are only paths homogeneous causes of equal and superior states?

original: smras pa / ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin te /
translated: They reply: No.

original: 'jig rten pa dag kyang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dag kyang /
translated: Also mundane

original: sbyor byung de gnyis kho na'i yin //
analyzed: sbyor byung de gnyis kho na'i yin //
translated: are only the cause of those two.

original: thos dang bsams byung la sogs pa //
analyzed: thos dang bsams byung la sogs pa //
translated: Arisen from hearing and contemplation.

original: thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba sbyor ba las byung ba'i yon tan de dag kyang mnyam pa dang khyad par can dag kho na'i rgyu yin gyi dman pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba sbyor ba las byung ba'i yon tan de dag kyang mnyam pa dang khyad par can dag kho na'i rgyu yin gyi dman pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: These qualities derived from hearing, reflection, and meditation are the causes of similar and superior qualities, but not of inferior ones.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu bshad zin to //üîΩmtshungs ldan rgyu ni sems dag dang // sems byung rten mtshungs can rnams so //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu bshad zin to // mtshungs ldan rgyu ni sems dag dang // sems byung rten mtshungs can rnams so //
translated: Homogeneous causes have been explained.üîΩThe associated cause is the mind and mental factorsüîΩthat have a common support and object.

original: gang dag la rten mtshungs pa tha mi dad par yod pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba de dag ni phan tshun mtshungs par @120b ldan pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gang dag la rten mtshungs pa tha mi dad par yod pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba de dag ni phan tshun mtshungs par @120b ldan pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Those minds and mental factors that have a common support and object are reciprocally associated causes.

original: kun 'gro zhes bya nyon mongs can //üîΩrnams kyi rang sar kun 'gro lnga //
analyzed: kun 'gro zhes bya nyon mongs can // rnams kyi rang sar kun 'gro lnga //
translated: The pervasive cause is the afflicted view of the selfüîΩand the five that arise simultaneously with it.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i chos sngar skyes pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i chos phyi ma rnams kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i chos sngar skyes pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i chos phyi ma rnams kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The pervasive cause is the afflicted view of the self and the five mental factors that arise simultaneously with it.

original: de dag kyang 'og tu bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'og tu bshad par bya'o //
translated: They will be explained below.

original: 'di ni nyon mongs ba can gyi chos kyi thun mong gi rgyu yin pas na /
analyzed: 'di ni nyon mongs ba can gyi chos kyi thun mong gi rgyu yin pas na /
translated: It is the common cause of defiled factors.

original: skal ba ma nyam pa'i rgyu logs shig tu rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: skal ba ma nyam pa'i rgyu logs shig tu rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: It is presented as a separate cause, the cause of the nonuniversal,

original: ris gzhan dag gi yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ris gzhan dag gi yang rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the other classes.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu bshad zin to //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu bshad zin to //
translated: The universal cause has been explained.

original: rnam smin rgyu ni mi dge dang // dge ba zag bcas rnams kho na //
analyzed: rnam smin rgyu ni mi dge dang // dge ba zag bcas rnams kho na //
translated: The cause of retribution is only bad and good with outflows.

original: lung ma bstan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lung ma bstan pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not neutral,

original: stobs chung ba'i phyir sa bon rul ba bzhin no //
analyzed: stobs chung ba'i phyir sa bon rul ba bzhin no //
translated: because it is weak, like a rotten seed.

original: zag pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not pure,

original: sred pas mngon par ma brlan pa'i phyir mngon par ma brlan pa'i sa bon drung po bzhin no //
analyzed: sred pas mngon par ma brlan pa'i phyir mngon par ma brlan pa'i sa bon drung po bzhin no //
translated: because it is not moistened by craving, like a seed placed in ashes.

original: rgyu rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyu rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The causes have been explained.

original: dus nges pa ma bshad pas de brjod pa /
analyzed: dus nges pa ma bshad pas de brjod pa /
translated: The time periods have not been explained.

original: kun 'gro skal mnyam dus gnyis pa //
analyzed: kun 'gro skal mnyam dus gnyis pa //
translated: The universal and the similar cause are of two time periods.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba kho na'o //
translated: They are past and present.

original: gsum po dag ni dus gsum pa //
analyzed: gsum po dag ni dus gsum pa //
translated: The other three are of three time periods.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dag ni dus gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dag ni dus gsum pa yin no //
translated: Coemergent causes and homogeneous causes and the ripening cause are of three times.

original: rgyu de dag gang yin pa'i 'bras bu de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu de dag gang yin pa'i 'bras bu de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the effects of these causes?

original: 'dus byas bral bcas 'bras bu yin //
analyzed: 'dus byas bral bcas 'bras bu yin //
translated: The conditioned and the disconnection are effects.

original: de lta na 'o na ni 'dus ma byas 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de dag gi 'bras bu yin pa'i rgyur yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni 'dus ma byas 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de dag gi 'bras bu yin pa'i rgyur yang 'gyur la /
translated: If that is so, then unconditioned factors would be an effect and thus would have a cause.

original: rgyu yin pa'i phyir de dag gi rgyu yin pa'i 'bras bur yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu yin pa'i phyir de dag gi rgyu yin pa'i 'bras bur yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And since they are a cause, they would have an effect.

original: 'dus byas kho na la rgyu dang 'bras bu yod kyi /
analyzed: 'dus byas kho na la rgyu dang 'bras bu yod kyi /
translated: Only conditioned factors have causes and effects.

original: 'dus ma byas la de dag med //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la de dag med //
translated: Unconditioned factors do not have these.

original: rgyu rnam pa drug mi srid pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu rnam pa lnga mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa drug mi srid pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu rnam pa lnga mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the six types of causes are impossible and because the five types of effects are impossible.

original: yang 'bras bu 'di dag las 'bras bu gang zhig rgyu gang gi yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'bras bu 'di dag las 'bras bu gang zhig rgyu gang gi yin zhe na /
translated: What effect among these effects is related to what cause?

original: rnam smin 'bras bu tha ma'i yin //
analyzed: rnam smin 'bras bu tha ma'i yin //
translated: The ripened effect is the last.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The cause of retribution is the effect of retribution.üîΩThe first is the effect of dominance.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu dang po'i yin //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu dang po'i yin //
translated: The efficient cause is the effect of dominance.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.

original: byed rgyu'i ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //üîΩrgyu mthun skal mnyam kun 'gro ba'i //üîΩ'di gnyis dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o // rgyu mthun skal mnyam kun 'gro ba'i // 'di gnyis dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.

original: skyes bu pa ni gnyis kyi yin //üîΩskyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag gi yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu pa ni gnyis kyi yin // skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag gi yin no //
translated: The effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.

original: yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu @121a * //üîΩ'di ci yin /
analyzed: yang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu @121a * // 'di ci yin /
translated: The effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu'i bar du yang ci zhig yin zhe na /üîΩrnam smin lung du ma bstan chos //üîΩsems can brjod lung bstan phyis 'byung //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu'i bar du yang ci zhig yin zhe na / rnam smin lung du ma bstan chos // sems can brjod lung bstan phyis 'byung //
translated: The effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.

original: ci'i phyir sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'i don las las skyes pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'i don las las skyes pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: The effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of human action.

original: thun mong ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: thun mong ba'i phyir ro//
translated: The effect of human action is the effect of human action.üîΩThe

original: lung bstan phyis 'byung ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lung bstan phyis 'byung ba ni dge ba dang mi dge ba las 'byung ba'o //
translated: The future effect of human action is either good or bad.

original: rgyu mthun rgyu dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun rgyu dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The effect of equal outflow is similar to its cause.

original: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i chos gang yin pa de ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //üîΩbral ba blo yis zad pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i chos gang yin pa de ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o // bral ba blo yis zad pa'o //
translated: Any effect similar to its cause is an effect of equal outflow.üîΩThe effect of disconnection is the exhaustion of the effect of the object of the act of elimination.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //üîΩgang gi stobs kyis gang skye ba'i ;
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni bral ba'i 'bras bu'o // gang gi stobs kyis gang skye ba'i ;
translated: The effect of disconnection is the effect of the act of elimination.

original: /'bras de skyes bu'i byed las skyes //üîΩdper na sa 'og ma'i sbyor ba'i sems kyis sa gong ma'i ting nge 'dzin dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: /'bras de skyes bu'i byed las skyes // dper na sa 'og ma'i sbyor ba'i sems kyis sa gong ma'i ting nge 'dzin dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: The effect of human action is the effect of the act of a human agent.üîΩThe effect of the act of a human agent is the effect of the act of a human agent.üîΩFor example, the concentration of a higher stage is the effect of the act of a human agent of the thought of application of a lower stage.

original: zag pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩsngon byung ma yin 'dus byas ni //üîΩ'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras //
analyzed: zag pa med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // sngon byung ma yin 'dus byas ni // 'dus byas kho na'i bdag po'i 'bras //
translated: The same holds for the effect of the act of a human agent of a pure thought with regard to a pure concentration, and so on.üîΩThe effect of dominance is the effect of a conditioned factor that is not a homogeneous cause.üîΩThe effect of dominance is the effect of a conditioned factor that is not a homogeneous cause.

original: sngar byung ba las gzhan pa'i 'dus byas kyi chos ni 'dus byas thams cad kyi bdag po'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: sngar byung ba las gzhan pa'i 'dus byas kyi chos ni 'dus byas thams cad kyi bdag po'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Any conditioned factor is the effect of dominance of all conditioned factors, with the exception of itself.

original: yang rgyu 'di dag las gang zhig dus gang du 'bras bu 'dzin tam 'byin ce na /
analyzed: yang rgyu 'di dag las gang zhig dus gang du 'bras bu 'dzin tam 'byin ce na /
translated: Which of these causes hold or give their effect?

original: lnga po da lta 'bras bu 'dzin //
analyzed: lnga po da lta 'bras bu 'dzin //
translated: Five hold their effect in the present.

original: yongs su bzung zin pa'i phyir 'das pa rnams kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: yongs su bzung zin pa'i phyir 'das pa rnams kyang ma yin la /
translated: Past causes do not hold their effect, because the effect has already been acquired.

original: skyes bu byed pa med pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa rnams kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa med pa'i phyir ma 'ongs pa rnams kyang ma yin no //
translated: Future causes do not hold their effect, because personal effort is absent.

original: gnyis ni rab tu 'byin par byed //
analyzed: gnyis ni rab tu 'byin par byed //
translated: Two give their effect.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni da ltar 'bras bu 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag ni da ltar 'bras bu 'byin par byed do //
translated: The co-existent cause and the associated cause give their effect when they are in the present.üîΩTwo give their effect in the present and in the past.

original: da ltar gyi dang 'das pa dag / gnyis kho na skal pa ma nyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag go //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dang 'das pa dag / gnyis kho na skal pa ma nyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag go //
translated: The homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause give their effect when they are in the present and in the past.

original: da ltar bdag kyang mjug thogs su sgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: da ltar bdag kyang mjug thogs su sgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: The present cause gives its effect immediately, because it is in a state of activity.üîΩThe past cause gives its effect later, because the state of activity is past.

original: de yang phyis 'das pa dag go //üîΩgcig ni 'das pas 'byin par 'gyur //
analyzed: de yang phyis 'das pa dag go // gcig ni 'das pas 'byin par 'gyur //
translated: One gives its effect in the past.

original: 'di ltar lhan cig gam de ma thag tu rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig gam de ma thag tu rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni med do //
translated: The ripening cause gives its effect when it is in the past, because the ripened effect does not occur either at the same time as, or immediately following, its cause.

original: de la chos gang zhig rgyu dus dag gis skyed par byed ce na /
analyzed: de la chos gang zhig rgyu dus dag gis skyed par byed ce na /
translated: What are the causes of those phenomena?

original: smras pa / mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: smras pa / mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: chos rnams ni rnam pa bzhi po dag yin te /üîΩchos nyon mongs pa can rnams dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i dang po rnams dang / de dag gi lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa las ma gtogs pa'i lung du ma @121b bstan pa rnams dang /
analyzed: chos rnams ni rnam pa bzhi po dag yin te / chos nyon mongs pa can rnams dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa'i dang po rnams dang / de dag gi lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa las ma gtogs pa'i lung du ma @121b bstan pa rnams dang /
translated: there are four types of phenomena:

original: zag pa med pa'i skad cig ma dang po ma gtogs pa'i dge ba rnams so //üîΩde dag ni /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i skad cig ma dang po ma gtogs pa'i dge ba rnams so // de dag ni /
translated: those that are afflicted, those that arise from karmic maturation, those that are the first moment of uncontaminated states, and those that are virtuous except for the first moment of uncontaminated states, which are called ‚Äúthe remaining phenomena that are not karmic maturation.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs can dang rnam smin skyes //
analyzed: nyon mongs can dang rnam smin skyes //
translated: Those that are afflicted and those that arise from karmic maturation

original: lhag dang dang po 'phags rim bzhin //üîΩrnam smin kun 'gro de gnyis dang // skal mnyam ma gtogs lhag las skyes //
analyzed: lhag dang dang po 'phags rim bzhin // rnam smin kun 'gro de gnyis dang // skal mnyam ma gtogs lhag las skyes //
translated: are like the afflicted and the first.üîΩThose that arise from karmic maturation and those that are omnipresentüîΩarise from the remaining causes except for the cause of natural outflow.

original: chos nyon mongs pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams las skye'o //
analyzed: chos nyon mongs pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams las skye'o //
translated: Afflicted phenomena arise from all causes except for the cause of karmic maturation.üîΩThose that are the first moment of uncontaminated states and those that arise from karmic maturationüîΩare like the afflicted and the first.üîΩThose that are the first moment of uncontaminated states and those that arise from karmic maturation arise from all causes except for the cause of natural outflow.

original: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams ni kun 'gro'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams las so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams ni kun 'gro'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams las so //
translated: Those arisen from the cause of retribution are produced from the remaining causes, excluding the universal cause.

original: chos lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu de dag ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams las so //
analyzed: chos lhag ma rnams ni rnam par smin pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu de dag ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams las so //
translated: The remaining dharmas are produced from the remaining causes, excluding the cause of retribution and the universal cause.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbang po rnams ni de dag dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams las skye'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbang po rnams ni de dag dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams las skye'o //
translated: The uncontaminated faculties are produced from the remaining causes, excluding the homogeneous cause.

original: chos bstan pa de dag gang yin snyom pa la /
analyzed: chos bstan pa de dag gang yin snyom pa la /
translated: What are these dharmas that are taught?

original: sems dang sems las byung ba yin //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba yin //
translated: They are mind and mental factors.

original: 'o na gang dag sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / gzugs can gyi chos de dag ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang dag sems dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / gzugs can gyi chos de dag ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: But what about those dharmas that are not associated with mind and those that are physical?

original: mtshungs ldan ma gtogs gzhan de bzhin //
analyzed: mtshungs ldan ma gtogs gzhan de bzhin //
translated: The others are similar, except for the concomitant cause.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gcig pu ma gtogs pa chos nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du skye ste /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu gcig pu ma gtogs pa chos nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du skye ste /
translated: Except for the concomitant cause alone, afflicted dharmas and so on are produced in the same way as mind and mental factors.

original: rgyu rgya cher bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rgyu rgya cher bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The extensive explanation of the cause is complete.

original: // / rkyen rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / rkyen rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the conditions?

original: rkyen ni bzhi po dag tu gsungs //
analyzed: rkyen ni bzhi po dag tu gsungs //
translated: Four conditions are taught.

original: gang nas gsungs she na /
analyzed: gang nas gsungs she na /
translated: Where are they taught?

original: mdo las rkyen nyid ni bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mdo las rkyen nyid ni bzhi ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the sutra, it says, ‚ÄúThere are four conditions.

original: de la rgyu zhes bya ba rgyu lnga yin //
analyzed: de la rgyu zhes bya ba rgyu lnga yin //
translated: The so-called cause is the five causes.

original: byed rgyu'i rgyu ma gtogs pa rgyu lnga ni rgyu'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: byed rgyu'i rgyu ma gtogs pa rgyu lnga ni rgyu'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The five causes, excluding the active cause, are the causal condition.

original: sems dang sems byung skyes pa rnams //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung skyes pa rnams //
translated: Arisen minds and mental factors

original: tha ma min mtshungs de ma thag / dgra bcom pa'i tha ma ma gtogs pa sems dang sems las byung ba skyes pa rnams ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: tha ma min mtshungs de ma thag / dgra bcom pa'i tha ma ma gtogs pa sems dang sems las byung ba skyes pa rnams ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: are the equivalent immediately preceding condition, except for the final mind.

original: dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad do //
analyzed: dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad do //
translated: The focal object is all phenomena.

original: ci rigs par mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi ni gzugs la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: ci rigs par mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyi ni gzugs la sogs pa'o//
translated: Form and so on are the focal object of eye consciousness and so on, respectively.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i ni chos thams cad do //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i ni chos thams cad do //
translated: All phenomena are the focal object of mental consciousness.

original: byed rgyu zhes bya bdag por bshad //
analyzed: byed rgyu zhes bya bdag por bshad //
translated: The active cause is explained as the dominant condition.

original: byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The active cause is the dominant condition.

original: yang rkyen 'di dag bya ba byed pas na gnas skabs gang gi chos la byed ce na /
analyzed: yang rkyen 'di dag bya ba byed pas na gnas skabs gang gi chos la byed ce na /
translated: In what state do these conditions perform their activity?

original: re zhig rgyu'i rkyen rnam pa lngar bshad pa de las /üîΩ@122a * // rgyu gnyis po dag 'gag pa la /
analyzed: re zhig rgyu'i rkyen rnam pa lngar bshad pa de las / @122a * // rgyu gnyis po dag 'gag pa la /
translated: The causal condition is explained as fivefold.

original: bya ba byed do //üîΩ'gag pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar yin te /
analyzed: bya ba byed do // 'gag pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar yin te /
translated: Two causes perform their function with regard to cessation.üîΩCessation is the present.

original: 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde la lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag bya ba byed de /
analyzed: 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro // de la lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag bya ba byed de /
translated: It is called cessation because it is about to cease.üîΩThe coemergent cause and the concomitant cause perform their function with regard to cessation.

original: de gnyis ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i 'bras bu la bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgsum po ni skye ba la'o zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyis ni lhan cig 'byung ba'i 'bras bu la bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro // gsum po ni skye ba la'o zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa ste /
translated: These two perform their function with regard to the effect that coexists with them.üîΩThree perform their function with regard to arising.

original: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The future is called arising because it is about to arise.

original: de la ni skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu rnams bya ba byed de /
analyzed: de la ni skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu rnams bya ba byed de /
translated: The homogeneous cause, the pervasive cause, and the ripening cause perform their function with regard to arising.

original: rgyu'i rkyen ni de tsam zhig yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen ni de tsam zhig yin no //
translated: This is the causal condition.

original: de las gzhan pa yi //üîΩrkyen dag de las bzlog pa yin //üîΩmtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni skabs 'byed pa'i phyir skye ba la bya ba byed do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa yi // rkyen dag de las bzlog pa yin // mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ni skabs 'byed pa'i phyir skye ba la bya ba byed do //
translated: The other conditions are the opposite.üîΩThe condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent is the condition for the arising of the thought and thoughtconcomitants, because it causes them to arise by making way for them.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni da ltar gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir 'gag pa la bya ba byed do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni da ltar gyi sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir 'gag pa la bya ba byed do //
translated: The condition as the object is the condition for the cessation of the present thought and thoughtconcomitants, because they grasp it.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni gnas skabs thams cad du mi sgrib pa'i ngo bor gnas pas 'di'i bya ba de ni de nyid yin no //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni gnas skabs thams cad du mi sgrib pa'i ngo bor gnas pas 'di'i bya ba de ni de nyid yin no //
translated: The dominant condition is the condition for the thought and thoughtconcomitants in all their states, because it does not make way for their cessation.

original: rkyen rnams byed pa dang bcas pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: rkyen rnams byed pa dang bcas pa bshad zin to //
translated: The conditions and their activity have been discussed.

original: yang chos gang zhig rkyen du zhig gis bskyed ce na /üîΩbzhi yis sems dang sems byung rnams //
analyzed: yang chos gang zhig rkyen du zhig gis bskyed ce na / bzhi yis sems dang sems byung rnams //
translated: By how many conditions are the factors produced?üîΩThe thought and thoughtconcomitants are produced by four conditions.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni ci rigs par rkyen bzhi pos skyed do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni ci rigs par rkyen bzhi pos skyed do //
translated: The thought and thoughtconcomitants are produced by four conditions, as is appropriate.

original: gsum gyis snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis //
analyzed: gsum gyis snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis //
translated: The two attainments are produced by three conditions.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ma gtogs pa snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag ni sems kyi mngon par 'du byed pa las skye ba'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa can dag yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ma gtogs pa snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag ni sems kyi mngon par 'du byed pa las skye ba'i phyir sems kyi de ma thag pa can dag yin no //
translated: The other meditative attainment, i.e., the attainment of non-perception, is also produced by the power of thought, but it is not associated with thought.

original: gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skye //
analyzed: gzhan ni gnyis po dag las skye //
translated: The other factors are produced from two conditions.

original: chos gzhan ldan pa ma yin pa rnams dang / gzugs can rnams ni rgyu dang / bdag po'i rkyen dag las skye'o //
analyzed: chos gzhan ldan pa ma yin pa rnams dang / gzugs can rnams ni rgyu dang / bdag po'i rkyen dag las skye'o //
translated: The other factors, i.e., the non-associated factors and the material factors, are produced from two conditions, i.e., from the active cause and the dominant condition.

original: rgyu dang rkyen dag kho na las chos thams cad kyang skye'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dag kho na las chos thams cad kyang skye'o //
translated: All factors are produced from causes and conditions.

original: dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs phyir //
analyzed: dbang phyug sogs min rim sogs phyir //
translated: The world is not produced by a single cause, because of gradation, etc.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa gcig kho na rgyu yin na 'gro ba thams cad cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na dngos po rnams rim gyis 'byung bar yang snang ngo //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa gcig kho na rgyu yin na 'gro ba thams cad cig car 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na dngos po rnams rim gyis 'byung bar yang snang ngo //
translated: If the world were produced by a single cause, such as God, etc., all the things of the world would arise simultaneously.

original: dbang phyug dag kyang thog ma med pas kyang gzhan la ma ltos pas 'byin pa thog ma med par 'gyur ba dang 'byin pa la dgos pa med pa'i phyir dbang phyug la sogs pa ni rgyu ma yin no //üîΩyang gzhan ni gnyis @122b po dag las skye zhes gang bshad pa de ji ltar na 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbang phyug dag kyang thog ma med pas kyang gzhan la ma ltos pas 'byin pa thog ma med par 'gyur ba dang 'byin pa la dgos pa med pa'i phyir dbang phyug la sogs pa ni rgyu ma yin no // yang gzhan ni gnyis @122b po dag las skye zhes gang bshad pa de ji ltar na 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba rnams kyi rgyu'i rkyen yin zhe na /
translated: The world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.

original: de'i rgyu 'byung ba rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: de'i rgyu 'byung ba rnam pa gnyis //
translated: The world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.

original: 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩskal ba mnyam pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag gis so //üîΩ'byung las gyur pa'i rnam pa lnga //üîΩ'byung ba rnams 'byung ba las gyur pa'i rgyu rnam pa lnga yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // skal ba mnyam pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dag gis so // 'byung las gyur pa'i rnam pa lnga // 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba las gyur pa'i rgyu rnam pa lnga yin te /
translated: The world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.

original: skyed pa'i rgyu yin te /üîΩde las skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyed pa'i rgyu yin te / de las skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.

original: brten pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: brten pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.

original: skyes pa 'byung ba'i rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa 'byung ba'i rjes su mthun par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.üîΩThe world is not created by God, because God is not a cause.

original: gnas pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: It is the cause of duration,

original: rten du gyur pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rten du gyur pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is the support.

original: / rton pa'i rgyun yin te /
analyzed: / rton pa'i rgyun yin te /
translated: It is the cause of continuity,

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the non-interruption of the stream.üîΩIt is the cause of development,

original: nye bar 'phel ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: nye bar 'phel ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: because it is the cause of the increase of the stream.

original: de ni byed rgyu kho na rnam pa lnga ru phye ba'o //
analyzed: de ni byed rgyu kho na rnam pa lnga ru phye ba'o //
translated: The efficient cause is the fivefold cause.

original: 'byung gyur rnam gsum phan tshun du //
analyzed: 'byung gyur rnam gsum phan tshun du //
translated: The cause of the derived matter is threefold.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang / skal ba mnyam pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dag gis so ;
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang / skal ba mnyam pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dag gis so ;
translated: The cause of the derived matter is threefold: the simultaneous cause, the homogeneous cause, and the ripening cause.

original: / de la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni lus dang ngag gi las sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa phan tshun du yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / de la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni lus dang ngag gi las sems kyi rjes su 'jug pa phan tshun du yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: The simultaneous cause is the mutual cause of the actions of body and speech which are concomitant with the mind, but not of the others.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i'o //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i'o //
translated: The homogeneous cause is the cause of the derived matter of a later time.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni lus dang ngag gi las gang gi rnam par smin pa mig la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni lus dang ngag gi las gang gi rnam par smin pa mig la sogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The ripening cause is the derived matter which is the retribution of the action of body and speech.
